review_text: When my husband and I didn‚Äôt know how to navigate a brand new, scary diagnosis which caused our girl to lose sight in one eye, we went to Eye Care. To say they have compassion and excellent ‚Äúbedside manner‚Äù is an understatement. Dr Stine and her staff spent so much time helping us through this new world and made sure we understood what we needed to do, and what could potentially come our way. The team went out of their way to make sure our dog sitter had detailed instructions in case something happened when we went away. Dr Stine is upfront and honest and really cares about her canine patients and their human parents. I would highly recommend!!

We had our first visit yesterday, and my expectations were exceeded. Wonderful and caring doctors with knowledgeable and patient technicians. Everyone was thorough, efficient and gracious with their time given in explaining their findings and addressing our questions. The front desk experience was lovely, with a caring and supportive receptionist from checkin to check out. The facility is nice too with a large waiting room that is welcoming and comfortable, and the whole place is very clean.
Their therapist Bo has been wonderful. She has been with me through two shoulder replacements and I feel like I couldn't have done it without her. she is an excellent therapist

My therapist has strengthened my leg, core and back muscles and my balance. I am now able to get up from sitting without assistance,  I am able to walk with a cane without my walker, and I can even walk alone within my home with no assistance to go from room to room carefully.
I am extremely happy to have improved and look forward to keep improving.
I have gained a lot on confidence and have received great instruction in how to work on my improvement doing specific exercises on my own between sessions.
I highly recommend this therapy company.

I have been using Fit Pt for over two years now. I has Multiple Sclerosis and Tucker Wrights has been taking care of me through his wonderful Occupational Therapy Skills. He is aware of my capabilities and encourages me to do my best ! He adjusts our therapies accordingly. Having therapy in home is much easier for me and is a great convenience. Fit Pt is right on the ball with their scheduling.

I‚Äôve used F.i.T therapy for about 2 years now and I‚Äôve had the best therapists ! The PT Venezia was truly amazing and she helped me so much and the OT Beatrix has been a blessing for me!! They were both so knowledgeable and kind and Stephanie and the other people in the office that arranged my therapists and treatments were the nicest and most caring people that you could ask for!! Thank you to all of you!
I‚Äôm so grateful that my doctor recommended this company!

If not for Sergio Gomez my physical therapist with F it therapy I don‚Äôt think I would have recuperated so well from my knee surgery. It was tough at times but his encouraging ways helped me. He is what kept me going. Thankyou F it,

The staff is very competent and friendly. The have a relaxed atmosphere where they make you feel at home. The therapy and care I've received is outstanding. I highly recommend this establishment for any of your physical therapy needs. The were very efficient in treating my shoulder.

About a year ago, I went to Herby for knee therapy, and the experience was fantastic. As someone living with epilepsy, there are certain limitations I have, but Herby went above and beyond to accommodate me with care, patience, and expertise. Erica is also an absolute gem‚Äîthey are both truly wonderful owners who set the tone for an amazing practice.

More recently, my husband started therapy with Herby for his neck pain. As I expected, he came home raving about the experience and the staff. He's already improving, and I can see a noticeable difference‚Äînot just physically, but in his mood and comfort.

They genuinely change people‚Äôs lives with the work they do. Their passion and care for their patients are evident in every interaction. I couldn‚Äôt recommend them more highly.

I unfortunately have had the need for Physical Therapy several times. Shoulder, Arm, Knee(more than once)and Back. After recently having a total Knee replacement I went to Fit Therapy in Miami Lakes for the first time and I must say this was the best experience  of all my  rehabilitation encounters. Each staff member is very knowledgeable, pleasant and takes a personal interest in your individual ongoing therapy.They guide and encourage you to achieve your very best outcome and they are always aware of your personal stage of recovery. I would whole heartedly recommend Fit for you physical therapy needs.--Bob Jones

This is an exceptional physical therapy clinic. Everyone here is super helpful and kind and take their time to really listen and understand and treat you with care, compassion and empathy. I recommend this physical therapy location to anyone that is looking to heal their body.

FIT Therapy has a great team. All the staff is professional and pleasant. They have accommodated my sessions to fit my schedule. I thought  it would be boring and annoying, but they used so many different techniques (including ultrasound, electrical simulation machine, massaging, and many other toys besides stretches and breaking down scar tissues, massages, etc) that it has been a nice learning experience. My hand has made tremendous progress and my orthopedic doctor/surgeon was so impressed that he said he didn't need to see me anymore.  Kudos to my therapist, Daniela, to my wife's therapist, Jessica and other great staff like Bianca and Valeria. They played mysic that included some songs of my youth.  I highly recommend them.

FAME Speech and Myo has been so great helping me figure out what to do related to my orthodontic work. I needed braces a second time and I didn‚Äôt realize that my tongue was contributing to my teeth shifting. Alexa was so helpful, patient, and supportive through everything!

FAME Speech and Myo has been so informative and helpful in the airway space. She provided resources, advocacy sheets, and was available anytime I needed support. I highly recommend anyone questioning anything related to orthodontic, speech sound disorders, and/or mouth breathing to see FAME.

We were referred to Alexa by our pediatric dentist for my son's tongue tie, which he had released at 4 days old but has since reattached somewhat, to the point of causing some oral concerns. We had tried another therapist in the past, but my son was not into it, to the point of dreading sessions; the thought of having a tongue tie release terrified him, so we took a break. We had a discovery call with Alexa, and I was immediately at ease and knew she was the right fit for us. She had a clear, cohesive plan and approach, so we knew exactly what to expect before, during and after a potential release if we worked with her.  She met my son for his evaluation and was fantastic with him. She is fun, nurturing and personable. She empowers and educates her patients, even the young ones, so they are part of the process and understand what they are doing and why.  She helps them set goals and has a system to track progress. My son loves going to therapy and works hard twice a day on his exercises. He knows a release is in our future and is already more accepting of that because of the way Alexa has worked with him.  I can't say enough good things about Alexa and her approach to therapy. If you or someone you know needs speech or myofunctional therapy, I highly recommend FAME Speech and Myo!!

Working with Alexa has been a rewarding experience! As a collaborative provider, her extensive knowledge in myofunctional therapy shines through in the way she carefully customizes care to each patient‚Äôs specific needs and works closely with other providers. She‚Äôs not only talented and informed but also truly compassionate and dedicated to helping others!

I am incredibly grateful for Alexa and her company, FAME Speech & Myo. She was essential in helping me recognize a tongue tie and feeding challenges in both of my kids. Alexa guided me to the right specialists to address this concern and then helped me with treatment strategies to address tongue function for speech and feeding. My children have made incredible progress and we are so thankful! I recommend Alexa to anyone who is looking for a phenomenal Speech-Language Pathologist and Orofacial Myologist.

This place is really good.  They succeeded where 2 other locations did not.  Chris has so much knowledge, Gigi is so willing to share the what and why about my situation, she really goes an extra mile or two, every day. Bri is learning fast and so kind. She‚Äôs a great addition.

I can‚Äôt thank Chris and Gigi enough for helping me get back to normal after my knee injury! They were both so helpful and knowledgeable. I do their recommended exercises daily and have been pain free since my last session. I highly recommend FIRST Rehab!

From the first time I stepped into FIRST Rehab I knew I was in good hands. Jasmine at the front deck greeted me warmly and directed me to Jay‚Äôs office for my evaluation. Jay was expert and knew his stuff. I set up appointments for the following weeks.
Christian was always helpful and got me going with the necessary exercises for my shoulder. Next, between Rob, Chris and Alex we worked the trigger points and tested the limits of my shoulder. Over the 5-6 weeks of rehab I have seen noticeable improvements in motion and flexibility. I almost hated to see my rehab come to an end.
Between the staff and other patrons receiving rehab , the talk was always friendly, lively and funny at times resulting in a most pleasant atmosphere.
I highly recommend FIRST Rehab and this whole experience.
Friendly from the get go when I called for a non referred appointment.  Thanks Michelle.  Did not feel rushed during the initial consult .  Setting up future schedule was also easy.

Unique facility! Personal attention given to fulfilling the patient‚Äôs PT prescription but strictly in harmony with one‚Äôs physical abilities to reach their desired goals. Progress is therefore unavoidable. My therapists, Chris and Gigi were flawless in that area. Their view of PT is very personal and they stress that it is a wonderful route to healing. These therapists are very supportive and motivating in helping the patient to move in this direction. I was constantly being educated by my therapist-I was made to understand why I was performing an exercise; I was taught about my body. I have never had this kind of help in a PT office in the past.
I am extremely grateful for this experience. I am improving as a result.
Also, Michelle, the receptionist was kind and helpful  re scheduling.
Thumbs up to everyone.

provider_name: FIRST Rehab of West Palm Beach
review_text: As a local practicing attorney, I had a lot of options on where to go when I was recovering from my own shoulder AC joint repair surgery. I knew the best place in town to get me functioning again was First Rehab. The positive experience my clients have received at First Rehab over the years was something I got to experience firsthand. Jen and all of the terrific therapists there got me back into shape very quickly and were always extremely caring and professional.  They are terrific people and really take pride in what they do. I highly recommend First Rehab to anyone who has been injured and needs first rate physical therapy to get back on track.

provider_name: FIRST Rehab of West Palm Beach
review_text: My experience at FIRST Rehab was exceptional!  It was the finest physical therapy facility I have ever been to.  The therapists are knowledgeable, professional, kind, and are completely dedicated to your rehabilitation.  I highly recommend FIRST Rehab!

provider_name: FIRST Rehab of West Palm Beach
review_text: First Rehab's excellent team made my recovery quick and easy.  They are dedicated, compassionate and knowledgeable.

provider_name: FIRST Rehab of West Palm Beach
review_text: If I could give this office 10+++ stars, I would! The practitioners are top notch, so very knowledgeable and on their game. Everyone is super efficient and get you right on track. I am stronger and feeling so much better and I attribute it 100% to the work they have been doing with me! A bonus is that everyone listens to you here and knows your name (before you sign in!)...whether it be your medical concerns or just remembering to ask about your kids. Bedside manner is so important, but these folks take it to the next level and make you feel like family. If you are unfortunate enough to need PT, your disappoint won't follow you here. Highly recommend!

provider_name: FIRST Rehab of West Palm Beach
review_text: From scheduling to follow-up-First Rehab is friendly and most importantly, professional. My first experience was 15yrs ago and now it's just as I remember, all good!

JUST GRADUATED!!!! these 4 years were the best experience for my daughter. I loved see her growing and evolving to her better self accompanied by Solange, Elizabeth, Kara and last but not least Erika. I‚Äôm delighted and deeply honored to work alongside them on this amazing journey and please continue to support our beloved children ‚ô•Ô∏è

I have been coming here since my son was in kindergarten, I absolutely love the staff! The therapist that we have seen unfortunately have left to pursue other opportunities for their work but we do miss them. The front desk staff have been very helpful and understanding with certain things that you may ask. Kysha does a fantastic job scheduling when this place can get a little noisy, Lettish I can say has been here from the beginning of my sons therapy and has helped alot with my sons scheduling his therapy and asking if I would be okay with this or that before just changing us. Angela works along side lettish now at the front desk and I adore her kindness and how she treats everyone with respect just as much as lettish and Kysha and all the therapist that see these kids on a daily basis.

The most disrespectful placed I've ever visited that's supposed to help ppl. Been taking my son here since October of last year because we had minimal options. The front desk is rude & will not greet you, looking at you sideways when you speak as if you've offended them.

One of my son's therapist Ms Van is very nice nasty. I thought she was trying to help me by informing me about a center called Karen Seigal for my son. It was a sligh & underhanded insult. My son is not retarded & she kept making other remarks saying he will be in occupational therapy for the rest of his life. Today my son wet his pants, Ms Van had the AUDACITY to say they don't have a changing table. My son is 5"1", fully potty trained, & does not wear diapers. He just had an accident & is partially nonverbal.

More about the front desk. I was literally minding my own business when the front desk was grouped up with Hispanic parents talking mad trash about me when I walked by. I am sick of this place. My son has been awaiting speech therapy since October 2024 & June 2025. And the parking HA, good luck. If you're a black woman, don't go here around these racists & disrespectful ppl. Communication is not good either.

Beth the evaluator was, not only late for our appointment, but basically said we should go somewhere else for our therapy. Only went for one month and had alot of rescheduling due to being short of staff. The Race Trac bag and soda shown me how much this place cares about therapy for a POST-SURGERY client. Also unsafe seats in the lobby; kids may hurt their fingers. Would i recommend for others..No not really.

Terrible place to take your children to therapy they do whatever the want, they first lost my son's referrals, I waited 2 years to get my son's therapies, later they changed the therapist without telling me ,then they tell my son have therapy twice a week again without telling me they scheduled me Monday and Wednesday and the lady on the front told me Monday OR Wednesday. So today I called because I had no transportation because medicaid transportation put the wrong address and can't reschedule because I WORK and the only days I have is Monday and Wednesday as they requested. So they want to punish me just because I can't make it, I DON'T HAVE A CAR OR HELP. I've been going through a lot of shit with this people I'm really done with this bullshit

So my son has been in all sorts of therapy since he was 1 year old and been to many eas school that promise the world and don‚Äôt but t let me tell you that when I took my son back to the winter haven first steps therapy now being managed by Liz Green she has made so many wonderful changes to this office. It is clean meat when you come into the First waiting room. There‚Äôs a wonderful sign in computer. The floors are redone. It smells clean the front and staff are now nice and pleasant to deal with. They also redid their gym and it‚Äôs wonderful for the kids to play in. Also, Miss Green told me that they‚Äôre also doing some fun activities for the children like movie night for kids to be able to just watch a movie and that is wonderful what she has done to turn this office around is nothing short of a miracle and I think you shouldn‚Äôt hesitate to bring your child or children or kiddos to the Therapy office you will not be let down

Ms. Jasmin is truly the heart of the front office. From the moment we walk in, she creates a warm, welcoming atmosphere that instantly puts both parents and children at ease. Her kindness, professionalism, and calm demeanor make every visit feel smooth and stress-free.

She‚Äôs incredibly organized and always willing to help whether it‚Äôs answering questions, adjusting appointments, or assisting with paperwork. Ms. Jasmin goes out of her way to ensure everything runs efficiently, and it‚Äôs clear she genuinely cares about the families who come through the door.

We‚Äôre so grateful for the care and dedication Ms. Jasmin brings to her role. She makes a meaningful difference in our experience, and we feel lucky to have her as part of our child‚Äôs support team.

Love the ppl there! Always so friendly and always smiling! Such a warm and welcoming environment my child looks forwards to his appointments! I would recommend them and I have to several parents! Just wanted to give an update we are still coming to first step therapy and my child is getting better!  Staff is still awesome!  He loves Mrs. Sarah and gets sad if for any reason he has to miss!!!!

My 5 year old Autistic/ADHD daughter goes here for OT. She absolutely adores her therapist Ms Fay! On days she isn‚Äôt scheduled she constantly asks to see and whenever she does she is super excited! Ms Fay is really accommodating with us even when our schedules change she makes it work for the betterment of my daughter. I have seen a great improvement with my daughter, before we couldn‚Äôt go out much but after OT with Ms Fay my daughter is now a little more social. I am so grateful for everything she has done to help my little one! The office is also nice and clean and front desk are polite whenever we walk in. I highly recommend going here and I highly recommend Ms Fay!

My son has been taking speech and occupational therapy here in this center from last six months. Everybody is very nice here. From the reception to the therapist almost everybody trying to help you. My son‚Äôs speech therapist Cassiany, is really helpful and dedicated to her work. As my son is nonverbal, he requires some extra effort. She understands his need and doing her job really fantastically. Felicia is my son‚Äôs occupational therapist here, she is also very hardworking. Overall my experience with this therapy center is awesome.
Thank you very much Lidia for being so helpful and thanks to the therapist for being patience with my son. I can‚Äôt wait to start with his therapies

The best place that my children don't even want to leave, a wonderful staff with great patience, I thank you girls for helping with the well-being of my children, I love you, the best of the best, 100% recommend
Excellent service 10 out of 10

My child has been going here for a year. This place is AMAZING with customer service skills. The therapists treat your children as their own and communicate extremely well . Carol always greets with a smile and does well with scheduling if you miss and need a make up session for your child . It is also extremely clean and safe . I will recommend this place for every single person I know in need of therapy services for their children .

Honestly, I don't like some of their techniques. I believe before trying some of these techniques they should describe it to the parents and ask permission beforehand. My 1 year old son has Dandy-Walker Variant and a technique was used to get my son to cooperate with sitting up where they allow him to just fall back onto the palm of their hand. I would've preferred to be inquired of this technique BEFORE it was presented. Because I would have not consented to it. When I told my husband  how his therapy went, after he got home from work, he was not pleased at all and said our son is just a baby. They should go easy on him.

His OT didn't feel comfortable using the technique as well. I could tell and I don't blame her. I enjoyed a lot of the therapists there and the front staff is always friendly to us. But I don't think the communication level is where I feel comfortable enough to bring my son back. I will now have to look for therapy elsewhere. But I feel it's too much at times. Because it's all about demanding the child hits that goal instead of taking it slow and knowing some kids have bad days. Maybe just have fun that day connecting with the child instead of all the demands of performing the tasks. I felt it was all performance based and little to no care for building a connection with the child. And trust me that makes all the difference!

On a side note:
One of our older daughters was in therapy when she was younger and it was night and day difference. It was a super fun environment. We were always told what they would do each time with her before they would work with her. And if she wasn't having the best day they would just allow her to play (which helped her bond with her therapist). She made progress in those years of therapy and graduated the program before we all expected her to. That's what I am looking for in a therapy practice. Communication, patience, connection.

Took my child here and there is so much turn around here and My poor child could never get use to 1 therapist. By the time she would get use to a therapist she would have a new one. Too many rules that make it difficult to follow their schedule. Also cancel therapy sessions on the same day but god forbid you have to call out for any reason.

My Son's therapists anre excellent at what they do! My son always look forward to seeing his speech therapist Ms. Sam! And his OT Mr. Justin is great as well,  they always share with me what they are working on, feedback about his behavior and tips on applying the activities at home to better help him. It's a great environment as soon as you walk in through the door. Front desk ladies are always so nice! Big thumbs up üëçüèæ

The staff at First Step Therapy are kind and attentive. My daughter's therapist, Justin, is amazing. He goes above and beyond to help my daughter, staying up to date on their progress and providing valuable information on activities we can do at home. Whenever I have questions, he ensures to find the answers. I am grateful for the exceptional care and support they provide.

I cannot say enough about this organization and how it changed my life. As a baby, my daughter was exhibiting several signs of autism. I took her to the doctor and also sought out local resources, but no one would listen or take me seriously. I reached out to First Words Project, even though they are 6 hours away, and they welcomed my family with open arms. We travelled there right away for a thorough evaluation (my daughter was 19 months) and they treated us with so much love, kindness, and hospitality. Based on the results of our evaluation, we were offered 6 months of free intervention services via video chat, which we began as soon as we got home. The changes in my daughter were immediate and drastic. After a couple months of intervention she was a completely different child. I‚Äôve never been more grateful for anything than I am for the people at First Words. Today my daughter is a thriving, happy 4 year old thanks to their help.  You would never know the grief and hardship we went though before we found First Words. They are so caring, compassionate, and humble, but also the most intelligent, highly trained, passionate organization I‚Äôve ever had the pleasure of working with. After all these years they are always there to answer any questions I have and provide support. None of this has ever cost me a single penny.  Thank you for everything you do, First Words!

First Words helped us so much with our second child. We unfortunately didn‚Äôt learn about them until my first child turned two, but they were very helpful in finding us great resources for him as well. Our first child has Autism, so we wanted to proactively monitor our second. Everyone at First Words was so nice and very educated on Autism and the red flags to look for. They did formal assessments on my 18 month old and had highly qualified doctorate level practitioners doing the assessments. They gave us some great resources and social growth charts to follow. Our second child does not have any red flags for Autism, but they continue to track her which we really appreciate. I‚Äôm thankful they work with children and families who have Autism and also with those who do not. Thank you, First Words, for all your work and research!

I just can not articulate fully in a Google review how much the First Words Project helped our family. I knew something was off with my son, but people kept saying, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt worry; he‚Äôll grow out of it,‚Äù and ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs just a late bloomer.‚Äù Our pediatrician noticed some red flags and told me to call them. I‚Äôm so glad I did. Our youngest was diagnosed with autism shortly after him being evaluated and we were able to get him so much help! I did an online parenting group for a semester where we talked about how to help our kids grow socially and meet developmental milestones. The online videos that showed real parents doing the activities with their kids were so helpful to us. Now my son is 3 and he is doing incredibly well! Most people don‚Äôt even know he‚Äôs on the spectrum. I went from worried he‚Äôs never speak to confident about how to help him access his strengths. I feel equipped to help him navigate the social deficits associated with ASD. First Words was a life saver for us, and I share their resources with all my friends.

There are hardly words I can use to get my feeling of gratitude across to the staff of this research project. I was told by our pediatrician to ‚Äúwait and see‚Äù about concerns I was having about my then 17 month old daughter, even though my gut was telling me something was up with her lack of communication. As a new mother, I was frantic and looking for answers to the million questions swirling in my head.

A friend recommended contacting First Words, so I reached out to them expressing my concerns. What I was met with was timely response, knowledgeable, professional and, most importantly, an extremely supportive staff that helped to get us through the evaluation process.

Was it horribly stressful and difficult to hear that my kiddo had some developmental delays? YOU BET.

Did I have resentment and fear and a slew of other emotions toward the program and clinicians and diagnosticians as we were getting the evaluations and diagnosis we needed to begin early intervention? Abso-FREAKING-lutely.

Did the staff wait patiently and help me get through my grieving process as my daughter received a diagnosis? YOU BETTER BELIEVE THEY DID.

I was able to seek out intervention for my sweet girl immediately, and educate myself about social communication development, Autism and related disorders from this research project. When I felt completely helpless and overwhelmed starting out with intervention services their How To Guide for parents gave me the empowerment and confidence I needed to get my kiddo communicating and on a completely different developmental trajectory than she would‚Äôve otherwise been on. The few hours of professional therapy we were granted by the State were definitely not lost on us, and I learned so much from them as well (there are multiple heroes in the story of our journey so far!)

But never once did I feel talked down to, uncomfortable or pressured to participate in the studies because they focus so heavily on what a huge impact early intervention AT HOME with THE PARENTS can achieve.

I will continue to advocate for the importance of early intervention and for empowering other caregivers and parents with the tools to make a lasting impact on children until the end of my days!! My daughter and I are forever changed by First Words and all their hard work! THANK YOU FIRST WORDS!

These are the nicest, most knowledgeable folks a person could ask for. I proactively had my last two children screened(nothing turned up). The whole office was friendly and eager to help. I cannot CANNOT recommend them enough. They are definitely putting thier education and skills to good use, especially considering it's free.

If I could give this place a 10 ‚≠êÔ∏è I‚Äôd give them 100. The facilities are impeccable‚Äîmodern equipment, nicely laid out across the space. Now, I cannot stress enough how amazing Dr. Daniel Uriona is. He‚Äôs so knowledgeable, caring, professional, and truly committed to helping people recover and improve their quality of life. If you‚Äôre in need of physical therapy rehabilitation, don‚Äôt hesitate to come here!

My experience at FISIOCORP has been exceptional. The team of physiotherapists is highly professional and personalizes each treatment. They very kindly explained my treatment plan to me in detail and took the time necessary to answer all my questions in each session. This made me feel comfortable and safe throughout the entire process, and the facilities are modern and welcoming. After a few sessions, I experienced significant improvements in my injury recovery. I highly recommend FISIOCORP to those who need reconstructive physiotherapy. I am extremely grateful for your attention.

The Rehabilitation Center is exceptional. From the moment I arrived, the modern facilities and highly qualified staff made me feel at ease. They addressed my concerns with expertise and care, and I saw remarkable progress from the very first day. Their comprehensive approach and variety of services made a significant difference in my recovery journey. I highly recommend the Rehabilitation Center to anyone seeking effective solutions and a supportive environment for their rehabilitation and wellbeing.

I recently had an incredible gym experience that surpassed all my expectations. From the moment I walked in, the staff greeted me warmly and made me feel right at home. The facility was spotlessly clean and well-organized, creating a pleasant atmosphere to work out with state of the art equipment.

Went to the center for lower back pain, the Dr. is beyond excellent. He spend an hour and a half with me, discussed all the symptoms and treated all areas with care, will be coming back. He is very knowledgable from a medical and scientific standpoint.This place is a true gem, the Dr. and his staff really care about you and provide top notch service.

We have been coming to Focus for 2 years.   My grandson has done remarkably well.  His Therapist is Courtney.  She is amazing!!!!   All the Therapist‚Äôs are all in tuned with all the children that go there. They are all so friendly & speak to all the children when they see them.   They all interact with each other & know each child‚Äôs needs.  I cannot say enough good things about this therapy group!!!  They really care about each child there and take the time to interact with the parents with regard to their child‚Äôs progress.   It has been a great experience for my grandson.  I thank Focus for the wonderful treatment & their caring nature.

We‚Äôve been coming to FOCUS for a year now, and I honestly can‚Äôt say enough wonderful things about this place. My daughter receives speech therapy with Shannon and Becca, and OT with Ana and Miraela ‚Äî and she absolutely adores each of them. They all make every session feel more like a fun visit than a clinical appointment.

The progress she‚Äôs made in just one year is incredible, but what‚Äôs even more special is the confidence she‚Äôs gained. The therapists not only care about her development, they care about her as a whole person.

If you‚Äôre looking for a therapy center that blends compassion, professionalism, and results, FOCUS is it. I‚Äôm beyond grateful to have found this team!

Our son has been coming here for a month and he has made such awesome progress! I definitely recommend 100%. Everyone is very sweet and committed to helping all the kids! I look forward to seeing how much more he will excel in his speech and gross motor skills!

My son has been attending FOCUS for two years now. He is in OT, Speech and ABA Therapy. The therapists are truly amazing and really take the time to work with your child and make them feel comfortable. At the end of the session they tell you what they worked on with your child and give you ideas of what to work on at home. I absolutely love this place and we are so fortunate to have such caring people working with our son.

My son receives services at FOCUS Therapy and he loves it! The therapists are phenomenal and I‚Äôve seen tremendous progress in achieving the goals we‚Äôve set. The FOCUS team ensures parents are fully-involved in developing a child‚Äôs plan of care and provides updates/adjustments after each session. I couldn‚Äôt recommend FOCUS more!

I cannot say enough good things about FRP Therapy Centre! My 19-month-old has only had three speech therapy sessions so far, and we‚Äôve already seen tremendous improvement in his ability to speak and repeat words. Even his daycare teachers noticed a huge difference from Friday to Monday, it‚Äôs truly incredible!
Both Doris and Lisandra are amazing, so patient, kind, and skilled at what they do. My toddler genuinely looks forward to his sessions, which speaks volumes. We are so grateful to have found such an amazing team. I highly recommend FRP Therapy Centre to any parent seeking speech therapy for their child!

My daughter has been attending speech therapy at FRP for approximately 9 months now and the progress she has made is remarkable. The entire team at FRP is amazing. They are kind, friendly, professional and truly dedicated. My daughter is thriving thanks to their support and we couldn‚Äôt be more grateful and happy for the positive impact they‚Äôve had on our lives. Her therapist is exceptional. Lauren has been so patient, loving and understanding since day one. I cannot thank her enough for all of her hard work and help.

This review is long over due !! My 8 year old daughter has been attending this center since she was 3 . When she started she couldn‚Äôt even say her name .  Now   you can understand her so clearly . She the best speller in her 3rd grade class . And  I know it had a lot to do with her learning those sounds in speech. Now my 6 year old and 3 year old have been attending  as well. Their speech has been approving so much as well.   All three not only do speech but music therapy as well. Can‚Äôt say enough good things about this place . review_text:

review_text:

I am truly thankful for the care and attention my daughter received with FYZICAL. We look forward to continuing our journey with them. Highly recommended for any family seeking compassionate and expert therapy for their child. STAY BLESSED!

provider_name: FYZICAL Therapy & Balance Center Coral Springs
review_text: I cannot say enough good things about Fyzical Therapy & Balance Center Coral Springs! The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, making each session productive and comfortable. In the past I have been to physical therapists who were incompetent causing me to add months to my recovery at the time. When my doctor recommended that I get treated for a balance problem I was experiencing, I was wary of having therapy. But I am glad I did. From my initial assessment by Gina, to the treatment by the physical therapists, I was happy in their approach and satisfied with the results. The facility is clean and bright with plenty of space to allow you to complete your therapy on top quality equipment. If you are in need of physical therapy, I highly recommend depending on Fyzical Therapy to successfully treat you!

I am happy to say I had the pleasure of having Fyzicals team help me recover from a full knee replacement. Gena and her team are absolutely amazing! They care and push you to heal. If I could give ten stars I would. If I ever need physical therapy again I know where I will be going back to!!

I have a pretty debilitating ankle/anchilles injury and the therapists at Fyzical took great care of me.   All the therapists are very knowledgeable, thoughtful and caring.  They also taught me quite a bit to take with me on my healing journey. Thank you from the bottom
Of my heart.  God bless you all

Just spent 10 weeks (2times per week) with Fyzical physical therapy in Stuart Fl. due to a back surgery!! I would recommend this group of therapist to anyone from the front desk to the Therapist, Dominic, Val , Jay , and of course Chris, all very professional, helpful, listens to your questions and concerns, go see this group to get the help you need.
I found all personal to be professional and receptive to my needs. The exercises helped me immensely and would highly recommend this facility.

A lot of the PT places in town utilize PTA‚Äôs to treat almost every patient, under the supervision of 1 or 2 actual PTs, who are sometimes not even on-site during treatments‚Ä¶ :(

At FYZICAL, it‚Äôs all licensed PT‚Äôs, all the time. Furthermore, the PTs typically only have 1 to 2 patients at a time so they can give your pain and limitations the attention they deserve!

Kim G is the BEST hands-on PT for those with complex medical issues. Instead of just assigning exercises - she integrates a large range of massage, manipulation, stretching and other techniques and tools to give me maximum relief, and improvement, every appointment.

Thanks Kim and FYZICAL!

They can't get their scheduling straight.  I showed up at an appointment just to find out that it had been rescheduled at another location much farther away.  I traveled to that location just to find out that all follow up appointments were also moved there, despite the previous receptionist claiming otherwise.  This wasted an entire morning sorting out and no one apologized or tried to make it right.

edit: I still get text notifications of appointments that were canceled.  This is complete non-sense!
edit2 after owner responded: I missed a "real" appointment as it wasn't clear from text updates which appointments had been canceled and which had  been  kept on the schedule.  I'm just going somewhere else at this point.

I went to Fyzical for quite a few months and worked with Stacy and Peter and they were both so wonderful! I had a spinal cord Injury and had just had a baby when I started and I was in rough shape. Stacy was so patient with me, very encouraging and informative about what my body was going through and what we needed to do to get me more mobile/active and achieve my personal goals for my mobility. Paige at the front desk was so helpful and polite as well. The entire team there really seem to get along and have fun together at work, which made going to therapy an enjoyable experience. Even the owner recognized me and was kind and polite when I saw her every now and then. I would highly recommend this place if you‚Äôre looking for a positive atmosphere for therapy and educated/ talented PT‚Äôs. I will be back anytime I need PT in the future !

Ginger and her team treated both myself and my husband with the utmost professionalism and knowledge of our conditions and how to best treat us. We rate Fyzical Therapy Center with 5 stars! Ginger made us feel like family as she genuinely cared about our physical and emotional well being. Our legs and backs were always stronger after being treated by Ginger and our spirits were always lifted!
Peter Renz is one of the best PTs in Brevard.  Anytime our family is in need, he's available to help.  Staff is very nice and he is very professional.

The best receptionist (Shayla) left,  they don't have enough physical therapists and today it was pipping hot!! I even asked Bianca who was the acting front desk for a day that the ONE therapist is not busy juggling 4 clients. They tell you an appointment time, you get there and don't get called back maybe 20 minutes later. Even still, Tony is updating other clients chart. And the owner is in Colorado! They just sent in my daughter's plan of care, now her doctor's office already signed off on it and sent it back to Fyzical. Tell me why they had to find it?? Now it has to goes to insurance and wait for authorization. So that means my daughter can't be seen until authorization comes back. I asked them to send it in early so it wouldn't be no delays , he said we had time. But now here we are here.
May 29, 2025 update (I wanted to write a new review)
Well my daughter's favorite therapist Aniya is now working morning. I don't know what Renee said to her but we don't see her. (we not morning people) Now I told Tony, routine is key with my daughter. My daughter looked in every room looking for Aniya. Tony had to video call her before my daughter would start her session with Tony. Don't get me wrong, Tony is a good therapist. He a male and my daughter cooperate more with females.Another thing, it's always hot in that building. I don't know maybe it's me.

Been going to them for almost a year and they are so grateful I think my kids with me and they all play with them and I love how sweet they are to them and Mrs Tony does so grate when it comes to helping me get stronger I would always give the a 10 out of 10

Very professional and helpful.Thank You for your expertise. ... Almost a year since I experienced this therapy facility and signed out, I still incorporate the techniques and advice received from them.  Subsequently, no one can visibly fathom the changes I am experiencing and  long haul I have made... thanks to the team.

Love this place! Rene & staff are compassionate caring people who go over & above your expectations.  They helped my balance & relieved my knee pain. Great location too! I have been going there for three surgery and they are awesome you go in feeling bad but you come out feeling strong and better I have done seeing him stripping people that have been paralyzed in the walking chairs I have seen him strengthen the people have been dealing with stroke that I tell you Renee and his company and his crew they would get you not back on your feet ready to run. I love it and his whole staff
Had a bout of BPPV Vertigo, was able to get in the next day, and had successful Epley maneuver. Staff was competent and efficient. Very pleasant experience.

I graduated yesterday from Fyzical, and I'm feeling great at this moment! I had a wonderful experience there; it's an amazing place with a fantastic staff that provides excellent customer service. The environment is very friendly.

He has excellent patient rapport and goes over and above to help you meet your goals. Great physical therapist!
I‚Äôve been going for about a month now and they have helped me greatly with my vertigo and dizziness issues. Very attentive, understanding and knowledgeable staff, definitely recommend!

Nicest, and best people around, Aaron and Mark are top notch in their field really know their jobs and great help and guidance from them.
Pam receptionist just the  at helping wade through the paperwork. These three people are a great blessing.

Dr Hutchinson was superb in helping me recover from surgery to two of my toes. Before beginning treatment, she considered the referral from my surgeon and queried me carefully about how I was feeling and what I hoped to gain from physical therapy. In sessions that followed, she gradually resolved muscular and joint issues resulting from surgery. By the end of my sessions with her, I had returned to normal function and met all the goals she and I established for me. Discomfort from creaky joints was gone, and I had much increased strength in my foot and ankle as well as my body as a whole. The staff supporting her are cheerful, polite, highly competent, and helpful. The facility is immaculate.

I'm 70 yrs old. Had a bad time with vertigo. Went to the balance center to see Dr. Katie Hutchinson. Ran me through some tests and then she went to work on my problem. One visit and my vertigo was 90 percent gone. Two more appointments and I was back to normal. The professionalism of Dr. Hutchinson and her entire team was outstanding. Go there you won't be disappointed.

My wife has a special condition and had been going there for several years, INCLUDING this year.  New referrals are required after a medical procedure, which she had. After several years as a client and at a time we needed them most, got the UPDATED referral went to the store after calling them and then basically, told us sorry go away, we no longer accept your Medcare Advantage PPO insurance.  Why at a time you can't change your Medicare plan would they cast off long-standing clients without notice, just when a disabled individual shows up at their store and needs them most.  The Medicare Advantage PPO plan pays the same as Medicare, same guidelines as other Advantage plans.  You can go there if you wish to pay out of pocket.  Therapists are great, the owner must be looking for the dollars, it is a franchise.  Can not recommend.

Update;  I would be glad to discuss and delte or correct.  Spent the afternoon on phone with UHC, actually started an appeal on the August 5th bill, (even though I did not have to) since that did not cover code 97530, which is reimbursable under medicare and the plan.  I am not sure why store  billing did not appeal. Unless UHC was lying, they said " The preautorization requirement implemented in September came from Medicare".  UHC tied our call in with your billing department to try and help.  Billing office said she does not handle that call the office.  No answer, it was the office who told me call billing inthe first palce.   As I said yesterday, when asked, yes I would like to speak with the owner.  Sorry if you didn't get the message before I posted.  UHC has said along with other Advantage plans, they pay the Medicare allowable.  I can't speak for your billing process.  We always check providers at the end of year to ensure they accept our insurance.  This is the first time mid year we were ever told sorry, even though she was a long standing patient.  Sorry if this is long as well, would much rather a call to understand.  Your office has my number.

I‚Äôve had balance issues for at least 15 years and did physical therapy several times for back, knee, and shoulder issues. But my balance was getting worse. If you need any type of balancing therapy or hearing aides look no more you have found the best here at Fyzical.

provider_name: FYZICAL Therapy & Balance Centers - Beverly Park
review_text:
My doctor sent me to PT for vestibular issues.  He provided a list of PT companies.  This was the second PT company I tried.  I can‚Äôt express enough how pleased I am with the therapy.  I worked with Alan, and not only was my vestibular issues resolved, the testing showed I was very visually dependent, and a few other issues I was aware of, like a tightness in my neck muscles.

Well, to give an example at the beginning I could barely walk on a foam balance beam without losing my balance.  By the end, I could walk this beam fairly well with goggles blocking my vision (no vision) and moving my head simultaneously.

Also my sister noted (without knowing I was doing PT) my posture improved tremendously.  My neck tightness/pain is gone.

This was about one month of sessions.  Definitely give them a try!!  They are in the Aldi center head behind Aldis and you will find on the side of the building.

provider_name: FYZICAL Therapy & Balance Centers - Jacksonville East
review_text: Simply the Best

I highly recommend the Fyzical Therapy & Balance Center. The staff here ( from the check in desk to the treatment room) are professional, compassionate and knowledgeable. My team which includes [Tara, Chris & Blythe]  provide excellent patient- centered therapy, strength and balance training. I feel valued and comfortable but most of all encouraged to follow my treatment plan....which is improving the quality of my life. As a post- op patient with chronic, Ortho challenges - I appreciate the time they all take to listen, and implement PT goals that are safe and effective. If you are looking to find a Center that will work with you, this the place.

My new Physical Therapy home!  I have had a number of PT opportunities over the years for various orthopedic issues, but I have never had a more positive experience than with Tara Swartz and her team at Fyzical Therapy.  After an extensive back fusion just over a year ago, Tara has carefully, thoughtfully, and effectively structured my recovery process.  The projected time for recovery is a 2-year process due to the extensive nature of the surgery, however, Tara and her team have worked diligently to ensure my complete recovery.  I have never had such devoted providers in my corner cheering for me the whole way.  I highly recommend this facility to anyone needing optimal physical therapy care. Chaplain Anthony is amazing! The faith in recovery has been a LIFE CHANGING experience. The whole staff has been more than wonderful. I think rehab without faith as a central component is not as effective as walking the will of God.

One of a kind program that truly cares about the individual and their progress. Anthony is a wonderful chaplain and runs the program well, giving each and every client personalized attention. This synchronicity provides an environment where those who come for healing can thrive and find a new meaning in life and a renewed strength and hope. Thanks Anthony and staff you guys do an amazing job every day!

I had three men fix my life 100% their names are Anthony Brian and Alex. When I started at Banyan, my life was a disaster, buried with drugs and addiction that I cannot work my way out of it. After my first week with these gentlemen, I am a completely different person now I am blessed the direction these men and the Lord put me into. I don‚Äôt know what I‚Äôve done without them because I‚Äôve been blessed and that‚Äôs another thing has become amazing in my life my religion 24 hours a day seven days a week for the rest of my life. I have been blessed by those men. I might be rambling on, but it‚Äôs something that I want to spread to the world.

The faith program is awesome! I have really enjoyed the different groups and group facilitators. The groups are strongly rooted in biblical principles and presented in a relaxing way that supports and strengthens a friendly atmosphere. I felt like I was part of a family Bible study. Thank you Faith in Recovery for the tools I gained!

I feel faith and recovery has helped me reconnect with God again. It taught me that it‚Äôs a relationship not religion which I like more. I learned so much from all the facilitators in many different ways. Thank you Anthony and everyone who has helped me and supported me throughout the beginning of my journey. I truly love you all!

We can‚Äôt say enough wonderful things about Faithful Friends.  In our desperate time of need, while being new to the area, we found ourselves calling around to find a crematorium for our beloved 20-year-old terrier, McGruff. Out of all the places we contacted, no one came close to showing the level of patience, compassion, and empathy that Faithful Friends did.

From the very first phone call, both Mira and Nicole were incredibly kind and helpful. They walked us through the entire process and made arrangements for a same-day cremation, allowing us to have our sweet boy back with us as soon as possible.

When we arrived, we were warmly greeted by Damon (along with the resident Boss Cat, Tinker, and Baby Boss, Macie Marie) and his kindness and compassion were exactly what we needed in that difficult moment.

We‚Äôve spent our lives rescuing dogs and giving them a second chance at life.  We believe it‚Äôs just as important to ensure their passing is handled with the same love, dignity, and respect.  After our experience with Faithful Friends, we wouldn‚Äôt consider going anywhere else. They made us feel like family, and now, we consider them part of ours.

You never want to face the loss of a beloved pet, but if and when that time comes, it‚Äôs comforting to know there‚Äôs a place like Faithful Friends who will treat your furry family member as one of their own.

Thank you, Mira, Nicole, and Damon!  Your care helped us navigate one of the hardest days of our lives, and we will be forever grateful.

Angela and Brian M.

Our sweet Penny Lane passed away during the night, after most pet services were closed. I called Faithful Friends, and without hesitation, Jerry met us at the facility and made an incredibly difficult process as easy as possible. His care and compassion for our pup gave us comfort knowing she was in good hands. The facility was clean, professional, and welcoming. It‚Äôs clear they are true animal lovers who understand the heartache of losing a beloved pet. I highly recommend Faithful Friends to anyone facing this difficult time

We lost our precious Mama's that was 16. It was a Sunday night on a holiday weekend August 31st. We called Faithful Friends to get some information. Ernesto was absolutely amazing and very sympathetic to our loss. He met my boyfriend at almost 1am that night. He took excellent care of our angel. They not only cremated Mama's but gave us a heart with some of her hair, a ceramic print of her paw, a beautiful urn for her ashes, and a death certificate. He advised her ashes would be ready to pick up by the end of the week. Wednesday morning he called advising she was ready to be picked up. Everyone there went above and beyond our expectations and treated us with warmth and sympathy. Mama's was not just a dog she was family and she was the grandmother of our other dog Brick. We will absolutely recommend Faithful Friends to everyone. Thank you so much for your kindness during this difficult time for us.
Thank you,
Dan Riggs and Stacie Hundley

We learned that both children and adults can participate in horseback riding lessons. However, it‚Äôs worth noting that there‚Äôs currently a long waitlist for these courses. After thoroughly exploring the farm, we made our way back home.

Family Solutions Center and Dr. Eduardo Leal have literally saved my life. I was at a point in my life where nothing seemed to work or make sense anymore. I was so depressed that my first phone call to Dr. leal was one from a person that was desperately looking for help. The visits to his office immediately started helping me little by little and I started to get my life back on track. His advice was precise and targeted my problems directly. She respects my pace and goals, yet somehow knows just how to gently challenge me so I can grow. I always leave our sessions feeling heard, supported, and empowered to conquer the day. If you‚Äôre looking for a therapist who is both scientifically grounded and incredibly personable, I can‚Äôt recommend Natalia enough. I feel so grateful to have found her, and I know anyone who works with her will feel the same.

Absolutely love this therapy office! From the moment you walk in, you feel the warmth and care they put into every detail. The environment is calming, welcoming, and thoughtfully designed to make you feel at ease. Her compassionate and insightful approach has made such a difference in my journey. I would recommend this place a million times over!

Family Therapy Group of Weston provides such a warm, professional, and welcoming environment. The staff is kind, knowledgeable, and truly supportive. You can tell they genuinely care about their clients and are dedicated to helping families grow and heal. I‚Äôve had a great experience and would highly recommend their services to anyone seeking therapy.

I never ever leave a bad review. Be careful as they charged my credit card without an authorization. They left me a voicemail in Spanish one time. I don‚Äôt speak Spanish. For some reason, the insurance company didn‚Äôt accept approve of the visit, but that‚Äôs not what I was told when I booked the appointment we did three appointments and then they did a nice charge on the credit card. The lady in accounting was not very friendly. I asked her why she called left me a voicemail in Spanish. she had no answer for that. Why did she not allow me to call her back before she charge the card?

I have been seeing another therapist for nearly 10 years.  Currently he went back to telehealth which I don't like.  That prompted me to find another Therapist, and as the saying goes, "everything happens for a reason".  I was incredibly pleased with my first session. The office as a whole instantly puts you in a good mood.  I'm actually happy today and I thought I would be melancholy.  Looking forward to my future visits.
To be able to sit with cats and chill is the best in the world to calm your nerves. In fact we adopted one of the kitties üò∏ All Love !!!!!!!
Adorable cats and kittens!! Very friendly staff and a large menu to choose from for drinks!

** Update we were informed that the people did not work there which is a relief. The owners stepped in after they were made aware of the situation and did what they could to justify the situation. We greatly appreciate the prompt repose on their end. Despite our experience I would like to add that the facility was clean, fun and enriching to the animals and overall a nice environment for both the cats and people alike.
We just went to the fat cat cafe with our 4 year old child who has autism. We paid for a 30 minute session with the cats and left in less than 10. I just cried in my car with my husband. The people there were staring at my kid and she was just trying to have fun and interact with the cats. We wanted to see how she would be with them and one lady who I'm not sure if she worked there or not was especially judgmental suggesting we consider a dog instead because my daughter's high energy. It was a new place and she was excited to see the cats. At home she's pretty chill and is actually noise sensitive. She was also playing with the cat toy and another lady said she's behaving more like a cat than she's engaging with them. Like I try and give my kid a normal day to day. She didn't feel the eyes on her and she didn't under the ablest micro aggressions but man was that a terrible experience. We got treated better at the panhandle pet store when we went to visit the rats. No shade to the front desk lady or purple hair individual at the cat cafe they were nice but need less to say we might just go back and adopt the pet store rats.

I booked the cafe for two hours with a friend and we both loved it. We went during less busy hours so we had the room to ourselves which was much nicer than having other people with us.

Most of the cats are friendly and want to be petted while some are more shy. There are many toys on a counter to play with them but they provide endless entertainment just being themselves. Along with the cats, the jazz music helps create a super relaxing atmosphere. Fair price for the amount of stress relieving this place does for you!!

It's a cat cafe. It's an instant cure for depression. Every kitten is absolutely adorable. And they all have the sweetest personalities.

The cafe gives a variety of toys for the customers to interact with the cats, but the best part is when they get in your lap and cuddle you.

I will be visiting this place often. Love it so much.
You can tell the therapists here truly care about the children they serve. The office is comfortable and everyone is welcoming, friendly and professional.

review_text:

provider_name: Fetch Specialty & Emergency Veterinary Centers - Clearwater, FL
review_text: The staff at Fetch are highly caring and professional! I have mobility issues & they came to my car & got Nani, my toy poodle, & returned her the me even though it was raining. At the second appointment, I was able to go in, but I had to get my walker. They obviously saw me struggling to get out of the car & came out to offer help. Dr. Bechtel fully informed us of Nani's cancer, prognosis, & treatment options. Again, this was done in a very caring & professional manner. She answered all of our questions & was on board with our holistic treatment measures. We are sure that our baby will get the best care possible. Incidentally, one of our primary veterinarians took her dog to Fetch when it had an emergency. I am Carole Berk, a retired marine biologist. The attached photo is Nani, my little love!

provider_name: Fetch Specialty & Emergency Veterinary Centers - Clearwater, FL
review_text: I brought my beloved Messi into Fetch on Monday morning. We had gotten home from an early beach trip. When I let him out of my truck to go potty he was kind of walking funny. I felt his abdomen and it felt like it was puffing up. A couple of minutes go by and it was definitely getting distended. Well, I freaked. Got him back in the truck and just started driving. My vet office recommended Fetch. I called and told them I thought my dog was bloating. They were very kind and told me to be careful getting there. Messi was still wet and sandy from the beach when we got there. The nurses were up front ready and waiting for him. Dr. Pfefferie was the doctor that was the first to examine and take care of him. It turns out Messi had severe pneumonia and the reason his stomach was so distended was because he was swallowing air according to the doctor. Trying to breathe. This doctor was so sweet. Just an amazing person with so much compassion for somebody so young. He was so patient with me. Explained in detail everything that was happening and everything that was going on. I just could not believe how sweet he was. Never made me feel rushed. Understood how upset I was. Messi was admitted to the hospital and put in an oxygen tank / cage. He was there both Monday and Tuesday. The staff could not have been more wonderful. I want to personally thank Jennifer and Mitch who took pictures of him and sent them to me. And Jennifer spending so much time talking to me on the phone and then on his release. They will never know how much that kindness meant to me. And Dr Anderson who I did not get to meet, was kind enough to call me and give me update overnight. She took excellent care of him during the night. The nurses I dealt with were kind and excellent. Such professionalism. Top notch place. They took wonderful care of my beloved Messi.

provider_name: Fetch Specialty & Emergency Veterinary Centers - Clearwater, FL
review_text:
We can‚Äôt say enough good things about this vet office. Our dog means the absolute world to my husband and me‚Äîshe‚Äôs not just a pet but family. Facing her recent, devastating cancer diagnosis was one of the hardest moments of our lives, but this veterinary team was truly the calm in our storm.

From the moment we arrived, they treated our girl with the same love and tenderness we would. You can tell they genuinely care about both their patients and their people. Even in the scariest, most heartbreaking circumstances, we felt supported and respected. We wouldn‚Äôt trust anyone else with our girl. We couldn‚Äôt recommend a better place or better people to care for your kiddo.

review_text: Dr Chew and Dr Bechtel are truly the most caring doctors. The whole staff is warm and loving and my Hans was cared for with the love only true dog lovers can give. Thank you all for helping us through our loss.

provider_name: Fetch Specialty & Emergency Veterinary Centers - Fort Myers, FL
review_text: What an amazing experience!  I have been to three emergency vet visits in the last week.  The first one was to a different emergency vet as I live in North Fort Myers, and I looked for the closest one.  One of my male cats, Dylan, was having difficulty urinating so I knew I needed to go to the emergency vet.  When he started struggling again three days later, I didn't want to go back to the same vet so I called our regular vet to see if they could fit him in.  They said it would be best to take him to an emergency vet and recommended Fetch.  I am happy they did!  They were wonderful on that first visit, and they even washed his carrier blanket that he peed on.  Fast forward to Monday and my second male cat, Lenny, was also showing signs of difficulty urinating.  So, I didn't even have to think about it, I brought him to them.  Both of them have Feline Idiopathic Cystitis, which can lead to crystals and blockage, and in male cats is quite dangerous.  They were able to help me get them both on the right treatment plan and we are now moving them to a prescription diet.  Dr. Ritter-Shapiro was the vet I saw on both visits, and she was great!  Both techs were great too, but I do not know their names.  If you ever find yourself in need of an emergency vet, I highly recommend Fetch.  I hope we do not have another emergency vet situation anytime soon, but if we do this is absolutely where I will be going.

provider_name: Fetch Specialty & Emergency Veterinary Centers - Fort Myers, FL
review_text: At Fetch we were treated with utmost professional care. Dr Bob and the whole staff were very friendly and made us feel welcomed from the moment we walked in.  I would not hesitate to recommend Fetch to anyone seeking sound advice and great care for their pets.  Most importantly my dog Phoebe felt very comfortable and loved all the attention during her visit.

provider_name: Fetch Specialty & Emergency Veterinary Centers - Fort Myers, FL
review_text: We had an amazing experience at Fetch when we brought Our 10 yr old mini poodle to Fetch . We had already been to his regular vet and to another Vet Hospital in the area and No one seemed to be able to figure out what was wrong with him. Everyone at Fetch showed so much care and compassion and really worked hard to make sure they could get as close to a diagnosis as possible but most importantly to make sure Oscar would start feeling better. We really went in there expecting the worst but hopeful that they could help. They were on top of things. They followed up numerous times even after we went home. We appreciate everything they did to help Our fur baby recoup. We definitely recommend Fetch to anyone that wants honest and caring treatment for their pets.

review_text: This is my third pet to be treated at Fetch. I love Dr. Beck! She is always very thorough and kind. If your pet has cancer of any kind I would always recommend going to Fetch and having a consult with Dr. Beck.

provider_name: Florida Autism Center Lehigh Acres, a division of BlueSprig
review_text: Florida Austim Center of Lehigh acres has been amazing with my son. My son has been in two other ABA therapy offices neither one had much progress with him. But Florida autism center has opened a whole new door for him. He is able to make request without his Augmentative and alternative communication (AAC device) . He is able to not elope from us. He has come a long way. When we first started with them my son had just been assaulted by an RBT at another office (not any of the Florida autism center offices). When we transition to Florida autism center, they were very patient with him. They understood what he had gone through. They took his actions lightly. But now we are a few weeks in with  him being there everyone at that location has come to know that my son is a free spirit. He will do as asked, he will request to move around. He will walk by your side. It's truly amazing that the men and women in this office have gain the trust of him considering what he has endured. I witnessed an RBT get down to his level as he was having a rough morning. Wrapped his blanket around him and cradled him until he was calm enough to start his day. These men and women are true heros to these kids. I have witnessed a lot of cruel comments from outsiders about my sons behaviors but at Florida autism center it's seems they understand a lot more of what is going on. I would recommend Florida Austim Center to any parent in need of help.

review_text: My daughter attended this facility for 4-5 mo.  We thought they would do what was in my daughter's best interest, but they did not.  A lot went on we did not know about.  Reports do not match up and we can't get any real answers.  We pulled my daughter immediately.  They did not even care enough to call until we kept bugging them for more information.  When we left we were not even sure who was running the facility.  We are very upset about the way our daughter was treated and feel guilty for trusting them.  If you need ABA, use someone at home so you can see exactly  what they are doing with your child.

provider_name: Florida Autism Center Palm Beach Gardens, a division of BlueSprig
review_text:
This place is wonderful! I was so nervous about being away from my son, they made the transition so smooth and easy. All of the therapists are so caring and attentive not only towards the children but the parents as well. Everyday he comes home it's like he's a different kid! He's talking more, doing new things  INDEPENDENTLY! Drop off times, his therapists comes out, he'll go grab her by the hand & off he goes NO TEARS. The director just makes you feel like everything is going to be ok & it is.

He's such a picky eater, now he's trying to eat more independently. I pack his lunch and snacks, they can get him to eat at least half of his lunch and snacks. I'm totally ok with that. He gives me a hard time when he's in his mood. They do the best they can in that regard, as long as he snacks I'm good. They're really hands on. You'll know how many pull up changes, what they eat, what they've done etc.

If I could give a higher score I'd do it without hesitation. If you need ABA, I highly recommend this center. Schedule a visit to see for yourself. FAC you guys are the Best!

review_text: I was skeptical about going the first time. My nerves almost got the best of me. But I honestly am so glad that I went. I was so scared that being dizzy was my new way of life. That is not the case. I felt so comfortable there. They made me feel so comfortable and confident. I had tried exercises at home and it made it worse. But within a few of being there and him guiding me I was already feeling better. Fast forward to my second visit, I woke up thinking, oh I‚Äôm fine now, should I even go back? I am very relieved that I did. This is something you have to commit to for your own well being. I did a couple exercises today and to my surprise I didn‚Äôt do them as well as I should‚Äôve. I am going to stick with it! They do such an amazing job for people here! There was a man there who graduates tomorrow. He was doing exercises like a pro. provider_name: Florida Balance Centers, Inc Acupuncture Integrative Medicine
review_text: I suffered with vertigo for several years. It was so bad that I fell twice. When I take the med prescribed , I would not be able to get out of bed for an entire day. I was also unable to drive to see my mom as I would be so sick. Finally my ENT sent me to Florida Balance Center. Tom was very knowledgeable and experienced with the vestibular and balance treatment. I was very impressed. Esther was kind and helped to ease my anxiety.. Well the treatment was so successful as it has been over one year since my last treatment and I am doing very well. Thanks to Tom and Esther. Forever grateful. I highly recommend anyone suffering from vertigo and dizziness to Florida Balance Center. You will never regret it.

provider_name: Florida Balance Centers, Inc Acupuncture Integrative Medicine
review_text: I've been going to Tom once a week for a little over two months.  I I have made very good progress with my balance and ‚Äúdrop-foot‚Äù issues. I have found Tom to be very knowledgeable with a pleasant approach.  He is willing to give so much time to me that I sometimes have to limit him.   I have gone to therapists for other issues and they push you out the second your time is up. He always goes above and beyond.  I think that shows how dedicated he is.  His staff is attentive and very friendly as well.  Overall, I recommend Florida balance centers completely. Five Stars!!!

I had a very positive first appointment here. The meet and greet at the front desk was very pleasant and enjoyable. The Medical Assistants were fun and professional and obvously enjoy working here. Dr. Do is a great communicator and I know I am in good hands. I am looking forward to my follow up appointment.  A very special thanks to Erika who did such a wonderful job drawing blood while having a genuine talk. I firmly believe FCS is the right care team for me. I am blessed.

Always a pleasant experience with my visits there. Staff is amazing and caring. I appreciate the snacks, coffee, or drinks available. Time is usually spot on for appointments and treatments.  A shout-out to Erika...thank you for your kindness. She's one of the phlebotomists and a true asset in her field.

From the moment I walked in, I was treated with care, respect, and professionalism. The staff at Florida Cancer Specialists made a difficult time feel a little easier with their compassion and attention to detail. The nurses were incredibly kind, patient, and knowledgeable, and the doctors took the time to explain everything clearly and answer all my questions without rushing.

The facility itself was clean, organized, and comfortable, which made a huge difference during long appointments. I truly felt like I was in good hands and that everyone there was working together with my health as the top priority.

While no one ever wants to need a place like this, I‚Äôm grateful for the team at Florida Cancer Specialists. Thank you for making such a big impact during such a challenging chapter.
I have been going here for two years. I love the staff and the Doctors. You can tell they care about their patients and when I am not feeling my best, their kindness and caring means a lot.

The Cancer Institute is conveniently located and easy to access, with ample parking. The facility and staff present a welcoming environment, and guests rarely wait more than a few minutes to be taken to the patient meeting and/or treatment areas. Within the latter, reclining chairs and warm blankets offer comfort and relaxation during the process. The nursing staff could not be any more caring and sensitive.

Life changing‚Ä¶that‚Äôs the only way to describe Micah‚Äôs training. I completed two rounds of 8-week in-home sessions for my 2-year-old rescue Staffy mix, Flynn Rider, who came from a rough past. The improvement has been absolutely incredible.

We worked on everything: basic manners, door dashing, leash walking, recall, nail trimming, muzzle training, reactivity, resource guarding‚Ä¶you name it. As a busy college student, I used to feel nervous just walking Flynn around my apartment complex. Now, I can confidently take him out in public whether it‚Äôs a park or a crowded Home Depot.

Micah‚Äôs training is top-notch and tailored specifically to your dog‚Äôs needs. Not only does he train your dog, but he takes the time to educate you as well. I truly can‚Äôt thank him enough for the dedication and care he put into helping me and Flynn. If you‚Äôre looking for dog training, I couldn‚Äôt recommend Micah more.

Micah has been amazing with my dog! With his training she has done a 180! She used to show signs of aggression/possessiveness towards anyone who approached us, but now she is neutral and keeps moving. Her listening skills have improved too! I've also boarded my dog with Micah and I know for sure that she is comfortable, safe, and having a good time. I love getting updates about how she is doing too. Florida Coast Canine has become my go-to place! 10/10 would recommend Micah and Florida Coast Canine to anyone looking for a trainer or boarding!

Micah at FCC has been absolutely phenomenal to work with. We‚Äôre currently training for protection sports and I‚Äòll always recommend FCC. Micah really knows how to troubleshoot different issues, is quick to provide feedback, and every session we see tremendous growth. My dog loves going to see Micah every week!

I‚Äôve seen friends‚Äô dogs who have done board and trains with FCC and they‚Äôre such solid, well trained dogs after leaving Micah‚Äôs care. Would recommend 1000%

Micah was absolutely awesome! We did an 8 lesson package for my 2 year old rescue pitbull. My dog had very bad ‚Äústranger danger‚Äù and became extremely protective over her home. Micah worked with her on easing her anxiety and teaching her many different things such as place, down, heeling on a leash, and even took the time to work with her at parks and home depot in public settings. Micah also listened and focused on what was important to me and was very patient in teaching me how to properly handle her. She is truly a new dog and when you do the ‚Äúhomework‚Äù each week you will see an immediate difference! I would highly recommend Micah and Florida Coast Canine.

My fianc√© and I can‚Äôt recommend Micah and Florida Coast Canine enough! When we first got our 4 month old rescue, the first couple of months we were really struggling with communicating effectively with her and getting her under control. She was pulling on the leash, barking at dogs, and couldn‚Äôt walk in a straight line outside the house. Inside the house she was bitey and couldn‚Äôt settle on her own. We sent Nola to training with Micah and when we got her back, it was a total 180. When Nola came home, Micah taught both my fianc√© and I how to communicate with her, use the tools, and translate all the training that they did to our own lifestyle and in our own home. Since our initial training with Micah, he has boarded Nola every time we need to go out of town and can‚Äôt bring her along. We trust Micah whole heartedly with our girl and he has even become a friend throughout the process. Not only is he an incredible dog trainer, he is a good person who will take care of your dog like his own!

Review for Dr. Enas Iskander: A Disappointing Experience

I had a highly disappointing experience with Dr. Enas Iskander. Her demeanor was incredibly rude, and her medical approach felt outdated. From the moment we stepped into her office, I felt judged and stressed as a parent.

Dr. Iskander asked if my 2-year-old daughter knew how to count to 3 or identify geometric shapes. There are numerous ways to assess developmental milestones, and these questions seemed arbitrary and inappropriate for her age.
