I am so pleased with the progress since beginning therapy with Dr. Susie in January 2021. I've been in therapy o and off for the last 7 years. Dr. Susie is the first therapist ever that has elicited positive change in me.
I also participate in group therapy facilitated by Dr. Susie. We are a small group of five women with similar issues. We are working on learning the skill of detachment in our personal relationships. It has been very helpful.

Dr. Susie is a highly skilled, experienced and compassionate therapist. I recommend her WITHOUT RESERVATION.

Dr. Susie has been a wonderful counselor and mentor for my daughter.  As a parent, Susie has been supportive to family as well as helping each one of us understand, support and cope with the trauma of an eating disorder.  I will be forever grateful to Susie for making such a difference in my daughter's life and in the life of our family.  She is the very best!

We recently lost our beloved dog, Rex, and Foster‚Äôs Cremation helped us through one of the hardest times in our lives. His passing was unexpected, and we were overwhelmed with sadness and grief. Foster‚Äôs was compassionate, professional, and truly made this painful process easier for us.
The cremation fee included a beautiful urn, and they thoughtfully saved a piece of Rex‚Äôs fur for us to keep. They also made a gorgeous clay paw print, which means the world to us. These small but meaningful touches gave us comfort and something tangible to hold onto as we grieve.
Rex will be deeply missed, but we are so grateful to Foster‚Äôs for their kindness, care, and the respect they showed our boy. This was the best experience we could have asked for during such a difficult time. Highly recommend them to anyone facing the heartbreaking loss of a pet.

Recently lost my cat after 13 years. I did not know where to take him to be cremated. Foster‚Äôs was highly recommended by friends. They were great. Very compassionate and helpful. I highly recommend them for anyone looking for somewhere to take care of their fur baby when the time comes.

- I'm so happy that I chose this place for my preciousüíólittle dog to be cremated at..-Hailey was very kind‚ô°, compassionate‚ô°,  & understanding‚ô° during this devastating time..-My
"DAISYüåºMAE" was well taken care of, & the amount of precious‚ô° items I received back-meant so VERY much to me..-We appreciate everything you did.....
-GOD‚úùÔ∏èBLESS-
~Thankü´∂üèºYou,
Sincerely‚öòÔ∏è,
"DAISYüåºMAE" family,
B.-&-R. VanGorderüïä
üêïüêæü©∑üêæüê∂
Thank you so much for turning my frown to a smile. Your caring touch and words for my little Peanut softened my heart. I really appreciate your service. I received what I asked for and more.

We were devastated by the very sudden loss of our Yorkie puppy. We took her to a (horrible) vet ER that was the closest to us in the middle of the night and she died. The ER pretty much rushed us through cremation paperwork without any details. I was in shock and grief, so when I came to my senses I called the ER the next day to get cremation info and the lady rudely told me to call Foster‚Äôs. It was almost 6:00 pm and I figured I would be leaving a voicemail, but surprisingly a sweet Foster‚Äôs employee named Haley answered the phone. She took her time advising me of the process and added in paw prints to the cremation order‚Ä¶.the ER had NOT done that or given us the option. Haley was so kind and didn‚Äôt rush me off the phone even though she probably wanted to go home. We picked up her remains yesterday and I was blown away by the thoughtfulness of all the different items included. Foster‚Äôs helped ease our grief with the care they gave our girl and the kindness they showed me when I called. Thank you ‚ù§Ô∏è

I can't say enough good things about this family owned business. The trainers are incredibly knowledgeable, patient and committed to improving the relationship between dog and handler. They are able to achieve the goals desired by owners while calming fears about undesired behavior. The boarding facilities are first-rate if you ever need to board your dog and don't want to worry about their well-being.

I've just recently returned to the world of dog training after being out of that realm for over 20 years. Meeting Tammie from Foundation First K9 was a chance meeting at a vet appointment we both happened to share. We struck up a casual conversation and the rest is history. I have been now training with them for over 6 months in both protection and scent detection. Foundation First K9 is more than a place to train. Through this organization I have gained knowledge, a training outlet and a second family. Come and join us!!!

I have been going to Foundation First k9 for the last 3 years. I couldn't have asked for a better training facility. From obedience, personal protection, and detection I have learned so much from them and still learn something new everytime I go.  My first malinois and I have been going since he was 8 weeks old and will be turning 4 next June. As soon as we turn down their road he knows where we are going. They are always changing up the scenarios and tactics to best serve you and your dog. I cant say enough great things about the facility and the Pipkin family. They truly care about you and your dogs, and treat you as family.

Great experience all around with Foundation first from boarding to training classes. Successful board and train with a much better behaved dog, private and group lessons, so grateful for trainers that care about what they are doing! Family run business that puts thier all into what they do. Very responsive to messages and reasonable pricing. Highly recommend.

Have been attending this trainer for 1.5years. Highly recommend. Trainers have exceptional K9 behavior insights. Amazing pricing for all the services. Owner is a retired Police K9 handler & trainer. Service area (6 acres) has a variety of training tools that helped my dog tremendously in normal day to day interactions.  I showed up with an open mind, willing to receive feedback and ended up learning so much more than I thought possible.

provider_name: Foundation Physical Therapy-Pelvic Floor and Orthopedics
review_text:
The birth of my first child was very taxing for my body. My Dr diagnosed me with pelvic floor dysfunction and recommended PT. To be honest, I had lost all hope at 6 weeks postpartum being in an average of 8/10 daily pain still, and very little mobility (it was painful for me to sit - not ideal with a 6 week baby!) - so going to PT, I didn‚Äôt have high expectations for my body to improve and recover. Boy was I WRONG about that! After my first visit, I left feeling hopeful, and heard! Gina made me feel so comfortable right from the start. She completely reassured me that what I went through was not the norm, and encouraged me to continue with the process.

When I was introduced to the exercises, I started getting stronger and was able to do things I was doubtful about being able to do again. The trainers make you feel great and they challenge you while building your confidence. I love seeing each of the therapists (Gina, Jamie, and Veronica) and they make you feel so comfortable! The fact that I can bring my son to my appointments and they accommodate you like that as a new mom is so amazing‚Ä¶it‚Äôs honestly a wonderful place and I‚Äôm so grateful to have found this awesome team of therapists and trainers helping me in a very low and desperate time in my postpartum! I can gladly say that after a few weeks of consistent visits, I am now PAIN FREE!! This team has truly given me my life back.

provider_name: Foundation Physical Therapy-Pelvic Floor and Orthopedics
review_text: I‚Äôm in the medical profession and the level of professionalism of all staff at this office is top notch. I have been impressed with my improvements in a short time period. But I did all of my assigned exercises as prescribed, so I did work at it. Everyone is very upbeat and encouraging. Even though you are exercising and working hard it is a pleasant experience. I highly recommend Gina the PT and her device. I had quick results-thumbs up!

provider_name: Foundation Physical Therapy-Pelvic Floor and Orthopedics
review_text:
Gary and his staff are top notch!  My husband and I went to his office before for shoulder injuries and he was fantastic.  He‚Äôs been doing this a long time and knows how to diagnose and naturally fix the body.

A couple years went by, we moved farther north, I hurt my back and a chiropractor in the area messed me up worse to the point I couldn‚Äôt barely walk, even with a cane (I‚Äôm 50..). A few month later, living pain free. I sleep great, it‚Äôs amazing!  Thank you Gary!!  No matter where we live, if we get hurt, we‚Äôre coming back to Foundation PT!

provider_name: Foundation Physical Therapy-Pelvic Floor and Orthopedics
review_text: Foundations is an exceptional physical therapy provider! All the therapists are outstanding! They are professional, compassionate and knowledgeable. I have used them for several different conditions and each time I am amazed at the results I have gotten. The staff is friendly and outgoing and they make you feel comfortable. I highly recommend Foundations Physical Therapy for anyone looking for physical therapy. They standout above all the rest!!

provider_name: Foundation Physical Therapy-Pelvic Floor and Orthopedics
review_text: I started their pelvic floor treatments in the hopes to resolve a bladder prolapse and some intimacy issues. With physical treatment and exercises to strengthen pelvic muscles over a 10 week period and the professional guidance given to me, I am 98% to where I need to be. Thank you to all the women who made this happen.

My daughter went to Foundations for ABA therapy for 1 full year, for approximately 20 hours a week. All of our hours were in the office, and I observed every session. Each of our therapists were amazing, dedicated, caring, knowledgeable individuals who truly made a positive difference in my daughter's development. Ivy and Laura, the owners, also took a personal interest in my daughter and her progress. I can say with absolute certainty that the staff at Foundations is responsible for helping my daughter acquire important skills and assisting her with becoming much more independent. I am also thankful for all of the feedback, input, and encouragement the staff gave to me, as a parent. The therapists and owners were, and continue to be, wonderful resources.

Mrs. Kaplan is one of the best in the field. Her people skills are amazing. The evaluation process is comfortable and pleasant. She provides useful insight into our sons‚Äô behavior.

Their therapist are amazing. My sons enjoys playing with them. From their point of view, they are a fun friend with lots of toys and his favorite games to play. Through active play, they have taught my sons useful skills.

The parent training is probably the most important role that they play. They help us understand my sons. They provide parent training for the proper ways for us to handle behaviors, improve their abilities, and replace destructive behaviors with productive ones.

We are a family with three autistic sons. Thank you for the help you provided our family : ).

Our son is now 3 and is diagnosed with ASD. We were lucky enough to get Foundations Therapy for his ABA Therapy at home, and they are incredible!!! Below is a thank you letter I wrote to them. From one autism mom to another...use them! This is their passion!
When we started ABA therapy with Wyatt, he was non verbal and screamed constantly. Within just a couple of weeks we could see huge changes in his behavior. Within a couple of months he had mastered the crucial signs to show us what he wanted or needed. Just shortly after that he was speaking. And not too long after that, he was speaking and understanding what he was saying. He is able to listen to commands, and follow through with them (even if doing so in protest üòä).  He is repeating words and really trying to understand their meaning.
The attention to detail your therapists showed with my son truly transformed how we live and communicate with him now. His teachers are so impressed that he already knows his letters! Lily has been the most amazing person to our family, and has encouraged us to learn along side Wyatt so we are able to implement his therapy 24/7. If we had questions she would help us out. If something we had been trying wasn't working, she would collaborate with other therapists to see if they had encountered it before and give us some ideas. She is the reason Wyatt is speaking and learning so fast. She has taught us how to calm him down fast, and shorten his tantrums. She has shown us how to better understand and communicate with our son, and we could not be more grateful. She has given us a life we did not think was going to be possible with our son at this time, and has given us a new hope in his future.
Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for everything you have done for our son and our family. You can tell this is not just a job to any of you, it is your passion; and as an autism mom, I am forever grateful to all of you for that!

The absolute worse. These people are money hungry jerks who couldn't care less about the children they treat.
My daughter has been going here for a couple of years and putting in a lot of hours since my insurance covered 100%. Her progress has been minimal. They've had her counting to 10 for the last couple of years when in school she's learning addition and subtraction.
They constantly lose therapists because they pay them peanuts, so there is a huge inconsistency as when she finally warmed up to a therapist then she was gone.
But I tried to stick through it hoping to see improvements, until there was a problem with my insurance.
Well, the very polite and smiling faces turned into horrible monsters. I got an invoice from them and ONE day later was getting threats that my daughter would be removed from the schedule unless I paid immediately. ONE day!
And so they did. They hijacked her therapy even though I told them I would pay them that week. They are absolutely the worst place I have ever had to deal with in my life.
I had been warned by others about this but I didn't listen and here I am. I regret choosing them.

No words can be thankful enough for Jake¬†O'Neill. The work and effort he has put in to helping my son Jonah is insurmountable.¬† As a father seeing Jake's work shine throughout my son I cannot be thankful enough. So blessed to have Jake come into our lives and we will never forget it! Thank you!!!

We absolutely love Foundations therapy! My son was nervous coming in, but the therapists did a fantastic job helping him adjust and he couldn't stop talking about how much fun he had. Amy and Bill were patient and kind. This place is wonderful and I highly recommend!

If you are noticing some warning signs of speech/language delays, do not hesitate to bring your child to this clinic. We have been seeing Ms. Kelsey for about 4-5 months now and have seen a world of a difference in our son. She is knowledgeable in so many areas of child development and guides us through learning more about our son‚Äôs development. She is kind and even though he is shy usually, he has enjoyed and looked forward to going. The clinic is also a great place for us to wait with my other child and play so my son can receive his therapy.

I don‚Äôt have enough words to praise Kelsey!  People are shocked at how my 3 year old went from barely speaking to now never stopping in such a short period of time.  I was skeptical about therapy at first thinking my little one would eventually get there but now I wish I had come sooner.  He wouldn‚Äôt be where he is without her.  She is such a blessing!  We HIGHLY recommend Kelsey!  Not to mention all the staff who help with flexibility in appointments and handling insurance.  If I could give more stars I would!  Thanks for all that you guys do!

I wish I could give more than 5 stars.  JoAnna is our favorite person outside of our family. She is the best! But honestly every single member of the staff has been nothing but amazing and friendly. I have waited a month before reviewing it. But we chose it because of the other reviews, so I'm not surprised.  But I am very thankful that we are able to attend. My daughter goes for occupational therapy and hopefully speech therapy soon. She is speech delayed, but in the month she has been seeing JoAnna, her speech has significantly improved.

We was referred to a physical therapist by my daughter's pediatrician.  Jodi was fabulous and worked with my daughter to get her up to speed in her physical development.  Jodi was excellent with my daughter and very caring.  The whole team was a pleasure to work with and helped my daughter with her physical development.  They genuinely enjoy working with children and it shows in the everything that they do.  A very caring place to bring your child.  Highly recommend!!

In July when I came to foundations I was welcomed with open arms and immediately treated like family! I‚Äôve been to a lot of treatment facilities trying to get sober and foundations is the first  recovery based facility with groups that you attend that give so much depth and weight. The staff truly cares about you as person, your recovery and growth! From the techs , case manager, coordinators, therapists to even the person who  oversees and runs the place they all are involved, supportive, and truly care about every individual! Foundations has went over and beyond to help mold me into the woman I am today and I‚Äôm so grateful for that! If your wanting to get sober and looking for a treatment facility That will give you a fighting chance and support and help you grow while your there and continue even when finish the program I highly recommend foundations
It‚Äôs a safe place to heal and recover

My experience here at Foundations has been nothing but positive. The employees here really know how to make you feel welcomed and wanted. Everyone strives for each of us to be better in our recovery. If you are ever thinking about making a difference in your life I recommend coming to Foundations to find those tools to apply into your life!

Foundations wellness Center is an amazing place to recover. My therapist was Carrie and she has a spot in my heart forever. She taught me how to find good things about myself even when I couldn't you would not be wasting your time going to foundations wellness Center

Thank God for Foundations!! When I arrived at foundations I was broken and unwilling to take ownership of my choices in life. They were patient with me, they loved me until I could start loving myself. They're caring staff nourished me and guiding me in the process of self-examination they also guided me to a solution.AA!! 6 months clean and sober for the first time in my life, I just turned 51!! A life a few months ago I was unable to see or imagine. They will be a part of my story and many more one day at a time. I truly respect and love your heartfelt approach. Thanks again and I love you guys!

The therapist are very professional especially carrie. Larry in discharge is super helpful and gets the aid you need while in therapy. Without him I would not of found housing. Highly recommend foundations wellness center

What an amazing place. Rest assured that if your loved one has to be taken care of, this is the place to have them. You could not ask for a better staff. From the Maintenance crew all the way up to the director top notch 100%.  Walking in the front door. You can tell that they care. For us the peace of mind going home after a visit knowing they are being taken care of.

I had Major Surgery in June and afterwards  I had to get physical therapy since my surgery and hospitalization. I had a limited list of places to choose from my insurance company, but my daughter and I read every review of each one and we liked what we read about this place.. My daughter visit here at Fountains at Mill Cove, and felt it was an excellent choice. and we both agreed that this is the one.
When I tell you, it's like a family you never knew or met before. Everyone shows The love, smiles, caring and concerns everytime you see them, which makes your time worthwhile being here.  I can truly say, every nurse, CNA,  maintenance staff, physical therapist, housekeeping, front desk staff & food dietician,  explains what you need to do to meet your goals of success with respect. Mr. Bobby Brown, always smiling and goes above and beyond to make it right. If you have a love one that needs a family that will take care of them, this places has it all. If I could rate this a 10 STAR üåü,  I would.
They have so much to offer to your future of success to be able to get back to your normal routine and daily life.
I'm only here for 20 days, but if I ever have to go to a rehabilitation center again, THIS IS MY FIRST CHOICE.
KUDOS to everyone that is a worker for this outstanding organization

The Fountains at Mill Cove is a well managed
Living facility for senior citizens. The levels of care are remarkably well staffed. The cordial and friendly culture is real. The residents look out for one another. The activities are regular but not over-whelming. The dining areas are well maintained. The food is well prepared and balanced for utmost nutrition.

To begin with let me say that I have been to numerous nursing facilities, and this is the first that I have been in that was totally clean, fresh, the staff was friendly, and the residents even appear to be really happy. There was no foul smell or stench when I walked in, which was surprising. The entire facility smells so fresh, which means that they are attending to their residence as they should. No complaints from the person who I was visiting. She looks great, and also has very wonderful reviews as well for the facility. When I was leaving I actually complimented the staff on the cleanliness of the facility and I told them that they were doing a great job and to keep it up. If I were to have to place my loved one somewhere, I would definitely definitely consider placing them here. I was really pleasantly surprised.

Top tier facility! The staff is always happy to be there, great activities, good dining options, and great care for their residents. Trustworthy and consistent with services and amenities.
Clean and well-maintained grounds as well as convenient location with convenient transportation to local attractions.
As a healthcare worker myself, I would trust them with my family members and recommend them to anyone looking for placement for their loved ones.

I had a very positive experience at Fox Physical Therapy. Erika was knowledgeable, attentive, and brought a consistently positive attitude to our sessions. She was methodical in her approach and adapted when needed. I also observed the other therapists working with clients.  They were equally professional and highly competent. The facility is clean, full of natural light, and very well-equipped. I highly recommend Fox Physical Therapy and would definitely return if needed in the future.

I just finished up physical therapy after having made an incredible recovery ‚Äî all thanks to Taryn. She was always one step ahead in assessing my progress and adjusting my plan. Her expertise gave me the confidence to trust the process, and her encouragement kept me going even when it was tough. A top-tier clinician and an even better human.

I see Taryn for a neck injury and she is the absolute best. She has been comforting and extremely knowledgeable since day 1. I love coming to see her and I always feel better after! Fox is so lucky to have such a sweet/ caring therapist who knows her stuff.

Who knew getting your knee bent into shape could be this much fun? I came into Fox Physical Therapy thinking I‚Äôd leave with sore muscles and tears. I did still leave with tears, but they were the good kind. The kind that come from being pushed, supported, and genuinely cared for. The entire staff is incredibly friendly. From the amazing and helpful people at reception to the rest of the therapists.  From the moment you walk in the door until you limp I mean walk out, everyone is warm, kind, and truly invested in your recovery. Now let‚Äôs talk about Dr. Taryn Park. This woman is a miracle worker in sneakers. She always knew when I had more to give and pushed me (sometimes with a smile, sometimes with a raised eyebrow) to do it. Her mix of tough love and real encouragement helped me hit milestones I didn‚Äôt think were possible. Because of her, I‚Äôll be able to dance at my upcoming wedding. Not well let‚Äôs not get carried away to be fair to the good doctor I couldn‚Äôt dance before the injury either. But now at least I‚Äôll be able to flail both legs around with equal enthusiasm. All jokes aside, Dr. Park is amazing!! She‚Äôs incredibly skilled, genuinely compassionate, and somehow made physical therapy something I looked forward to. I can‚Äôt recommend Fox Physical Therapy especially Dr. Taryn Park enough.

My experience with Fox Physical Therapy was extremely positive. I worked mainly with the therapist Taryn while recovering from a broken humorous bone at the shoulder. Wow! What difference!! I went in in pain and walked out with tremendous relief. Hard to believe actually. Their staff are friendly and professional. Julian I appreciate you getting on the schedule so quickly! üôèüèª
Absolutely the greatest experience. As a USMC veteran I am doing equine therapy here once a week and it is awesome. The people that work with you are wonderful. When I get there I don't wanna leave.

Beautiful new modern barn with all the amenities. Thoughtful caretakers are always available and on the property. Equine trails right out the back gate with a lake and hand grazing area. It couldn't be any better in Pinellas Park!!!

Amazing experience with Warriors at Rest staff is outstanding however Alan stole the show for me he is a wonderful horse and as crazy as it sounds he became my friend at first interaction. I love working with fresh start therapy.  Everyone is so good with my grandchildren even though they have behaviors and are a handful.  The center director cares about my family. Wonderful! I can‚Äôt say enough great things about this place. The staff is amazing, kind, patient and friendly. They treat your kids with so much love and care. AVOID!!!  They overcharged my family for services and have refused to refund us even though we have EOB‚Äôs detailing what we owe verse what they charged us. The clinic director is very nice and very professional. The clinic director really do care about her patients. And she love to get updates about her patients. This place is beyond words!! So amazing!! From the first time I called until now a year later. As a parent I was scared and not knowing what to expect.  All I knew was my son needed help with speech. Day!! I love this place. They are so down to earth and it‚Äôs by far one of the best experiences I have had in a long time.

Yeni & Kathy have both worked with my son & we adore them! The clinic is beautiful & my son loves to go ‚Äúplay‚Äù there. My son was diagnosed with a rare genetic syndrome that causes muscle weakness all over his body since birth. I appreciate so much what they do for my baby , especially Mrs Carmen and Sarah , from no words , now he talks a lot more than before . The staffs are very nice , kind . I went to some others center but this is the best I have . Don‚Äôt surprise why you see they have 5 stars reviews .
My baby gild is caming here for speech and fooding therapy. Ruth is a blessing for our family thank you for your love and dedication God bless you and God from the heart therapy you are the best.

I am beyond grateful for the work and experience we had with my son‚Äôs OT sessions. We worked with Yenicel and I saw so much improvement in my little one‚Äôs grasp and hand strength. He was more confident and it isn‚Äôt easy with toddlers, but Yenicel would send me updates and as a parent that helped ease my mind that we were getting the help needed. She is wonderful!!

I came here a couple years ago for about two weeks to treat my sciatica after having gone to several other chiropractors. The staff are amazing and I have been pain free of sciatica for the past 2 1/2 years. The spinal decompression table worked wonders on me along with several other treatments.
