I just finished 16 weeks of bi- weekly visits for severe neuropathy in my feet. The treatment consisted of PRP and trigger point injections as well as laser and shock therapy. The salesmen are good. Insurance only covers a part of the cost. My out of pocket was over 9k. I did not get the results that were promised and want to warn others before they have a similar experience.

Amazing place and staff! I started treatment about a month ago and I‚Äôm already feeling some relief!
Everyone is very personable and caring. If I could give 10 stars I would!

I started treatment for neuropathy at Frontier several months ago.  When I first started I was experiencing severe pain in the back of my legs,  numbness, sciatica etc. About 6 to 7 weeks into my treatment program I started feeling significantly better,  the pain began to subside and I started getting restored feeling in my feet and legs. j am now at the end of my treatment program and am completely pain free,  the numbness across the tops of my feet is gone and I am now sleeping peacefully throughout the night and I have significantly improved function. The staff at frontier are incredible and extremely caring and always made sure was comfortable.

Highly recommend. I was seen within 10 minutes. Everyone was friendly. Started my first treatment and have felt immediate improvement with pain I was having.

Will definitely be back and look forward to future treatments. Wish I had come to them sooner.

My mom was sent to this facility at the end of August. The level of care my mom is getting is beyond my expectations. She is happy there. The nurses are kind, patience and care for her needs. The room is always clean and she is always clean. I was very scared to put mu mom in a nursing home but I feel comfortable and I feel my mom in a safe place. Great job from admissions to the aids.

If I could give this place 0 stars I would. It was the biggest disgrace for care I could ever have a nightmare over. I chose this place on the 4.7 star reviews. I wish I researched a little more before sending her here. There are 153 reviews 4-5 months ago and you can tell they are fake.

My Aunt was in the hospital for a PE and was admitted to the hospital for approximately 8 days. I was ecstatic to finally get her in this place and it all ended here. Nikki was super nice and responsive and it literally ended on the day she arrived.

First off, they picked her up from the hospital after midnight and brought her to the facility. I drove all the way to the hospital to find an empty room. I had no idea from this place or the hospital she left. Upon arriving to this place around 11AM, Nikki said she was finishing lunch and would be up shortly (see attached pic). Well, it was 2:30 when I left and she never came up. The reason I left at 2:30, my Aunt Virginia was being transported back to the hospital because she had fallen between late the previous night and when I had arrived.

The scan came back negative and it took me another 7 days to get her back in this dump. Upon coming back, they took no precautions and she fell again, less than 9 hours this time. This time she hit her head and got a hematoma which was her demise, my aunt passed away from it.

We did get her into a much nicer facility that took precautionary measures (ordering bedrails from the physician) and they padded the floors around her. Unfortunately, the damage was done and we had to take her back to hospice after two days where she passed away.

Not one time did Ft Lauderdale Health & Rehab reach out to check how she was doing or apologize. Fortunately for them in Florida, they are protected by law so they can't be sued.

I would think really hard before sending anyone here. The pictures make it look to be a nice facility. It was actually kind of disgusting by my standards. My aunt was on the lowest setting of the bed, which was smart. The huge window was wide open with no shades pulled down. The sun was blaring on her. You're right on Federal and Commercial, a very busy area with terribly tight parking. I didn't see any outdoor area that looked decent, although I never was spoken to by anyone there other than text before admitting her. The floor was sticky. The room wasn't private and her roommate was topless when I walked in the room. Patients seemed to be sprawled all over the place in there.

And once again, do you really think 153 people randomly decided to write reviews 4-5 months ago and very few before and after? I'm not sure this place holds 153 people.  This place is a disaster and a sham! Between the hospital and Ft Lauderdale Health & Rehab, they killed my aunt.  Cause of death is hematoma on the certificate. I will be contacting the state next.

My moms health got really bad and she was hospitalized start of the year. When she got out she went to a rehab. I chose Ft Lauderdale Health & Rehab cause it was very close to my home, plus the staff seemed committed. There was only a little time from when she was released from the hospital, so I chose quickly. But I would learn that Ft. Lauderdale Health turned out to be an awesome decision. They construct a plan for the patient, and estimate how long it will take until the patient can return to society. They arent trying to milk the insurance company and ensure the patient stays with them forever. Much to my shock, my mom got better sooner then anticipated and she is fine now. I credit Ft Laudedale Health & Rehab to some degree.

I had a wonderful experience at ft. Lauderdale. From the moment I arrived, the staff was welcoming, compassionate, and professional. The therapists were incredibly knowledgeable and helped me regain strength and mobility after my surgery. The facility was clean, well-maintained, and had all the equipment I needed for recovery. I especially appreciated the personalized care plan and how the team kept me motivated throughout the process. I highly recommend this place to anyone in need of rehabilitation services.

From the moment I walked into Ft Lauderdale Health & Rehab, I felt a real sense of warmth and professionalism. I really appreciated how the staff treated the residents‚Äînot just like patients, but like real people‚Äîwith patience, kindness, and respect. The place was calm, clean, and well-organized, and I could tell the team paid close attention to the little things, whether it was making someone more comfortable or just taking time to really listen. It‚Äôs clear they care about more than just physical health‚Äîthey‚Äôre there for emotional support too. I left feeling confident that this is a place where people are truly cared for by a kind and dedicated team.

We‚Äôre so happy we chose Full Potential K9 for our puppy‚Äôs training! Our dog Kai stayed with Dillon for four weeks, and the difference in his behavior since coming home has been amazing. Dillon kept us updated the whole time with pictures and progress, and he took the time to train us too so we could keep up the good habits at home. He even helped us get everything we needed‚Äîlike Kai‚Äôs place, clicker, and leash setup. Highly recommend!

Full Potential K9 has been an integral part of us being dog owners. We used them back in 2020 when we adopted our Husky Eli who was SUPER stubborn & hard to manage. Dillon had him for 5 weeks & it was a huge help for our family. We got his basic obedience down & learned how to exercise him properly. Have you ever seen an obedient husky?!?! We still use some of the basic training like place & door holds so he doesn't escape lol.

Now being 5 years later, we adopted an Akita puppy named Pepper. We knew Dillon would be our first call as Akitas can be difficult breeds. Pepper stayed for 5 weeks and is like a different dog. She knows all of her basic commands and grew in confidence, which helped eliminate some of my own stress and concerns for her future.

We're super grateful for Dillon & his team, their dedication to excellence in dog's lives, how well they care for our dogs, and for their transparency along the process.
Can't wait for dog #3!!!!

Dillon and his staff were amazing. They are super passionate and care so much for their doggy clients. When we dropped him off four weeks ago he was like a wild pony. Now he has better manners and better impulse control. We could not have done it without Dillon's guidance and support. We are forever grateful to have found him.

I would highly recommend Dillon and his team at Full Potential K9 if you‚Äôre looking for dog training or a trustworthy boarding facility. Dillon truly has a gift with dogs. His passion for bringing out the best in your dog shines through with his work. We enrolled our 2 rescue puppies in the 5 week board and train program at Full Potential K9. They came back home a dream‚Ä¶well trained and obedient while still having their same fun loving personalities. Dillon is kind and so helpful‚Ä¶not only does he train your dog he also works with you and teaches you how to maintain your dogs training. It‚Äôs very obvious that Dillon has so much respect and love for dogs. He truly wants your dog to live up to their full potential and ensure they live a happy life in their home. Now that we have completed training we will continue to use Full Potential K9 for boarding. Our puppies get excited when they walk in the building and see Dillon and his team. He genuinely treats each dog like they‚Äôre his own family.

We came to Full Potential K9 in desperation. We've always had labs but our new baby girl Gaia was a tornado. She could get out of any crate, over any gate, had the zoomies for hours at a time, jumped in every toilet and flipped the water bowl as we chased her through the house. After 2 months in our home she was 6 months old, 50lbs, and knocking over (with love) anyone who came to visit. Dillon calmly talked us through his process and we boarded Gaia for the 5 week program. It was hard and I felt like I failed, but now I am a true believer. Gaia is still our fearless wild girl but now we aren't screaming no at her all day. She engages quickly and corrects easily. We are following up with a once a week training day with Dillon for ten weeks and daily sessions at home and she is happy as can be, and so are we.

So far this company has been great on communication and has been fast. The process has been easy for my son, Amyas and I.

PS:  I will provide another update once he starts the actual ABA treatment he needs.

1-Yr update:ABA update! Omg! What a big difference he starting to use his utensils, doing better with parallel play, and even has started trying to use the potty. Communication is AMAZING and I love our biweekly checkins. 10/10 must recommend.

2-Year update: Fully potty trained and expressing wants and has been given the tools to succeed for VPK. Still an amazing center and great team.

A nice place for a private event in Melbourne, Fl
According to their website, Funky Dog is ‚Äú...a nonprofit improv comedy troupe and theater based in Melbourne, FL. As a 501(c)(3) organization.‚Äù Their stated mission is to bring improv education, performances, and artistic collaboration to the community. It is located near downtown Melbourne and is pretty easy to find as it is one of the locations that opens onto the north side of Eau Gallie where the road splits right next to the bridge. I consider that there is limited parking. Their website shows a lot that was full when we arrived and I ended up parking on the street. Even though the venue seems to host a wide range of improv performances, from classic short-form games to long-form storytelling and themed nights, I visited for a private event, the Melbourne Independent Film Festival Replay. Aaron, the staff who took care of us was professional, friendly, and went above and beyond to make everything run smoothly. From helping set up the films that we were there to see to selling drinks at the intermission. It is an intimate affair with a stage to the right as you enter with a series of tables and chairs that can be configured as needed for any affair. We were there in full daylight and they had blackout type curtains that did a pretty good job of keeping the sunlight out and the street sounds down. Overall, it was a very nice experience and I would suggest using it for future events.
I absolutely loved this place. This was my first time there and want to go back every weekend! I was hesitant since I do not always find improv that funny. This changed my mind completely.
Attended the Improv last night for our 4th time.  Talk about a talent staff.  I had tears from laughing so hard for this amazing two hour show.  We will be back‚Ä¶

OMG this place was the most fun we‚Äôve had in awhile! Definitely something different to do in the Melbourne area.

The lineup was pretty funny and engaging! Make sure you check in online to save $1 on your drinks. They also offer classes if you are interested and the bar has fresh honey and honeycomb.

Will definitely be back!
Love this place.   Intimate venue with great local talent all giving it up!  Our kiddo (11) just did a week long camp with them and the performance at the end was quite a pleasant surprise.

I have a 200 pound Daniff, a smaller bossy female dog and a senior cat who thinks he‚Äôs a dog. We had tried a vet close by but he had no giant breed experience and was scared of my biggie who was 6 months old and hiding behind me. Dr Aimee was recommended to me by a mobile vet when the 200 pounder was just a baby because no one wanted to deal with him since he would obviously be big. I was impressed because they weren‚Äôt scared of him, didn‚Äôt treat him like he was going to eat them, and while he‚Äôs not in love with going to the vet- or anywhere for that matter because he‚Äôs trifling, this is my forever vet. All of my babies have received excellent care here, and I am old and have had many fur babies and a tarantula over the years, so I have had many vet experiences. My big boy will try to sit on her head, but he only does that if he loves you. She can pretty much do whatever she wants to him. The staff is also wonderful. Prices are reasonable. The big one costs more because he requires more-of everything.

I first started going to Dr. Aimee back around 2010? She treated my husbands cats briefly. When I adopted my first shelter pup, we quickly learned, in Dr. Aimee's words, he would end up being our own personal money pit. During the long 3.5yrs she helped us make very hard, realistic, and financially possible decisions. She NEVER shammed us, but instead helped us weigh options on what was essential. No one expects to adopt their first puppy to find out it has a world of health issues. She was there from day one guiding us until that last day. I knew that she was straight forward, she doesn't sugarcoat, but her REAL reason, is for the animals. During this decade and half, I have followed her to north Clearwater all the way down US19, and finally to her own clinic further south. Its always been an inconvenience cause all the years, I never lived close. BUT I don't trust anyone else but her. Over the years, she was there when I had to put my husbands cat down. I tried to prolong this cats life because I had lost my husband and the cat was the last of just him. She came to my home for us to say goodbye so he wasn't more stressed. It was sad but the easiest goodbye and peaceful. She was also there when I had to put my 2nd foster failure down. That was one of the hardest. When I officially adopted, we found out shortly after that he had mass cell tumors. Dr. Aimee again helped us weigh all our options. The decisions were EXTREMLY hard! It wasn't a cure but it extended his life longer than expected. The day we knew had come, Dr. Aimee helped my dad carry my dog out of my truck and was there for one of the most difficult times. I now have a what I think might be a 6yr old pup that I've had for about 3yrs now. She is a small dog and has been the biggest stressor of my life with her small dog syndrome. Again, Dr. Aimee listens and helps find solutions! My pup came overweight and too much attention made her obese. Dr. Aimee put her on a diet plan and she went from 22lbs to 15lbs in a year. Yesterday's visit was a win with a clean bill of health! There has been 2 times since Dr. Aimee has been my only vet where I had to see another. The first was at a clinic where they scheduled me wrong and on a day she was off. The other vet tried to tell me what I needed when I was there for was for a urine check with my cat. The second she tried to question what Dr. Aimee was already doing and getting pushy and wanting to charge me for more.... I asked for my cat and wanted to leave. Worst nightmare! The 2nd time, I wasn't there, and I had to have faith cause Dr. Aimee trusted her enough in her clinic. Yesterday, my stomach was in knots and all I was there for was my pups annuals. First question I asked the tech in the room, "who is the vet today".... The sigh of relief..... If you've read this whole review, then you would rather eat garbage out of a trash can on the street than let your fur babies suffer. If you feel the same....GO TO DR. AIMEE! You will thank me later! I will travel far and wide for my loves to get the best care! I owe her a lot for all she has done and all her clients end up feeling the same!

Coolcat Blake- Died in her dads arms in route to Haines Rd, buried in a sacred place
Blaze Odie Blake- Haines Rd cremated by Anderson McQueen and on a shrine of the best pets in the whole entire world
Gracie Boy- Buried at the Suwannee River on family property alongside other loved pets
Ford Hero Blake- Sunshine (previous owners) Ashes scattered in a butterfly garden in Palmetto

A real review from a real customer that can confirm the best care!

I can't express enough how grateful I am to have found Dr. Aimee and her incredible team at Fur Ever Friends Veterinary Clinic. From the moment we walked in, the level of care and attention our pets received was second to none. Dr. Aimee's compassion for animals shines through in everything she does, coupled with her extensive knowledge and expertise, which puts you immediately at ease.

Her team mirrors this dedication, ensuring that every visit is a positive experience for both pets and pet parents alike. While the clinic may be a bit of a drive for us, the peace of mind knowing our furry family members are receiving the highest quality of care is absolutely worth it. Dr. Aimee and her team truly go above and beyond, and we couldn't be happier to be a part of their clinic family.

I didn‚Äôt have a great experience. The newer vet was pretty abrasive, which I could overlook, but I was also given injectable medication with no instructions how to administer despite my asking. Additionally, my dog who was already anxious at the vet now experiences full body shakes and cowers at the sight of the vet which he didn‚Äôt do previously. It was a bummer because they came very highly recommended. There was some other stuff too, but I‚Äôll leave it at that.

My friend did have a fantastic experience with end of life care, and saw Dr. Aimee who she loved, which is why I‚Äôm giving a couple stars.

I took my dog to have the vet Dr. Miles look at a cyst that was near her throat. He looked and I looked and we couldn't find it. I asked, does it just  go away? His answer was they can. I was so relieved. He didn't even exam her. He spent 10 minutes with us. I was charged $60.00 I never got any paperwork or receipt, and I asked twice. They sent me an email telling me that my dog was examined. Liar Liar. He Only touched her neck and told me that it's her esophagus. That's all. Very Disappointed. I won't be referring anyone. They charge you $60.00 before they even look at your dog. I am not being nasty I'm being Honest.

I cannot stress enough how professional, educated, and real Dr Gentile and her staff are. I highly recommend! We moved to the Davenport area recently and our sweet senior calico took a sharp turn. We were so worried about what to do as our previous vet was several hours away.  She got very, very sick very quickly; we anticipated this was end of life for her at 16, almost 17.  Prior to this turn she was a healthy cat; so, I had not taken her to the vet since 2021. I feared being judged as a bad cat owner, but Dr Gentile was the exact opposite. She is kind, informative, compassionate and understanding. Her staff all have the same attitudes as well. She presented us with all of our options, and was incredibly honest with us. She could have totally taken us for a ride and caused more pain for our kitty, but she did not- for this I will be forever grateful. Dr Gentile listened to our wants for Ella, explained the end of life process, and answered all of our questions. She came up with a plan for her that reflected exactly what we wanted: a dignified, comfortable passing at home. The facility is clean, and calm. I‚Äôve included a picture of Ella.

From small to big, canine to feline, Dr. Gentile and her staff are nothing but kind and respectful. I originally came to them after researching for vets in the area to do vaccines for my recently adopted Chihuahua. From that first visit to when I had to drop him off for emergency care, and every other visit since then, they have always been accomodating and looking out for my baby's best interest. We ended up rescuing a boxer mix after the Chihuahua and knew that Forever Family Animal Hospital was going to be the best fit for her. I am not longer in the area and still prefer to drive an hour to see Dr. Gentile and her staff than chose a local vet. They are helpful, willing to answer any questions you have, and assist in any way they can to facilitate travel with your little one and getting prescriptions for outside their office. In here you and are your furbaby are treated like family. If you're undecided, look no further and give the office a call. Your little ones are in great hands!

Thank you for all you and the staff have done for us, Dr. Gentile!

My experience with Dr. Deanna Gentile and her team was EXTRAORDINARY!

Hambone (my cat) needed to get travel ready, and they made the process extremely easy.

The veterinary office was very clean, and their service exceeded my expectations!

They are very warm, and my kitty was happy to be there üêà‚Äç‚¨õüíù

I definitely recommend taking your fur babies here!

This has been one of the best vet hospitals I've ever worked with. Dr. Deanna Gentile is an amazing, caring, and understanding individual. Her team is extraordinary. I had to make a difficult choice in putting down my dog and before it came to that, my girl was their patient for a while. They were so patient and understood finances at different times of my life. When it came time for that choice, they were with me through the entire process. I couldn't have asked for a better team to take care of my baby.

I've been taking my cat here for years. The doctor and staff are like an extension of our family now. They remember us every time we visit, and they always make sure you and your animal are comfortable. I started coming here as a broke college kid and my cat had a paw injury. They always helped to advise me on medical decisions while discussing the financial aspect of the procedures. They never made me feel bad for things I couldn't afford or pressured me to do procedures that weren't urgent at the time(like nail clipping or ear cleaning) They would gently explain why its important to do certain procedures and urge me to come back for those when I could. Now that I've grown up a bit and have a career, I still bring my cat here. I genuinely don't trust any other vet like I trust them. My other cat passed away almost 2 years ago, and I brought him in to be cremated. They were so gentle with me and him during the entire process. They sent me home with a grief package and the next time I came in they had all signed a card with personal notes about my sweet kitty, notes that ensured to me that they knew him, remembered him, and cared about him. As long as I live in or around the area, I will always be bringing my  animals here because I really do believe they love our animals as much as we do

The best vet I‚Äôve ever dealt with. I‚Äôve had dogs my entire life, and Alissa the vet tech is so caring and quick. Dr Andres was to the point, sweet and listened to my concern. My Mini doxie is a mess at the vet and they do such a great job with her, me and making sure all my concerns are addressed. Forever a fan of furry friends thank you!

I drove an hour and a half to adopt my sweet Lilly because I was looking for a small size dog, and they had several wonderful pups to choose from. The facility is beautiful, clean, and well-maintained, and the staff was incredibly kind and helpful throughout the process. Lilly has been an absolute joy, and I couldn‚Äôt be happier with my experience. If you‚Äôre looking to adopt, I highly recommend checking them out!

Adopted our new fur baby from this wonderful place.  They obviously care a lot about the wellness of their animals, all seemed happy and healthy and the facility is spotless.  The adoption process is smooth.  Highly recommended!

we adopted our little guy now named tito (used to be cooper) and the process was so easy and straightforward and we now have a forever friend :) i only spoke to the rescue over the phone as we were adopting at pet supermarket, but they answered any questions i had and even sent over his medical records as soon as everything was processed. he fits in great at our home and is getting acclimated with our older kitty :)

Wonderful experience- all the vet staff were so friendly, knowledgeable and helpful, especially Dr Platt. Veterinary office was very clean, and efficient from making appointment to checking out. Highly recommend!

provider_name: Fyzical Therapy & Balance Center - Brevard Beaches - Melbourne Beach
review_text: My significant other Sharon developed dibilitating vertigo and was taken care of by Jordan and Katie. Jordan and Katie were wonderful, very knowledgeable and insightful in their diagnosis and treatment plan for her. Sharon has recovered and graduated from their treatment plan. They were wonderful and caring to us and we cannot thank them enough for all of their help. We want to make a special mention for Gabriella at the front desk. She was very helpful and sweet to us. We give them our highest recommendation.

provider_name: Fyzical Therapy & Balance Center - Brevard Beaches - Melbourne Beach
review_text:
I had the necessity for PT after two falls and operations. I was lucky enough to select Fyzical Therapy and Balance Center (Driftwood Plaza). I found the therapists to be extremely knowledgeable and helpful in my treatment. I strongly recommend Peter, Stacy and especially Jordan S. Jordan - I give you a shout out for all your patience, support and guidance in my journey from being unable to walk without my walker to being able to walk without assistance for 5 minutes!!
Peg Tanis

provider_name: Fyzical Therapy & Balance Center - Brevard Beaches - Melbourne Beach
review_text: I had rotator cuff surgery in June and have been seeing Jordan for PT since then. She is knowledgeable and keeps me informed about the recovery process. She is also consistently cheerful and encouraging.  She is always willing to answer my questions. The rest of the staff are friendly as well and keep the atmosphere fun. I highly recommend Jordan and the facility.

provider_name: Fyzical Therapy & Balance Center - Brevard Beaches - Melbourne Beach
review_text: After my knee replacement surgery, I chose this place because of its convenient location. I was pleasantly surprised at how wonderful it is! The therapists are knowledgeable and tailor the program to the patient. They are enthusiastic and encouraging. They did such an amazing job, I progressed quickly and exceeded my expectations. I actually enjoyed going and am going to miss Jordan, Sam and Katie.

provider_name: Fyzical Therapy & Balance Center - Brevard Beaches - Melbourne Beach
review_text: At the end of March 2025, I limped into Fyzical wearing a big black boot and pushing a noisy walker. I was hurting and couldn't imagine how I'd ever get back on my feet after a serious ankle break and surgery. Over the course of two months, Katie showed me the way. She was cheerful and encouraging and never pushed me harder than I could go. Several weeks ago, Bonita joined my team and worked with Katie to get me to the finish line. Her strong hands massaged massive knots in my feet and calves and gave me a real sense of relief. The other physical therapists were equally positive, which gave the whole place a good healing vibe. I highly recommend this place.

This is a great place to achieve your physical therapy goals.
Dr. Melissa Shabani is a very nice, caring and dedicate professional. She carefully  listens your diagnosis and concerns  in order to tailor the best therapy plan according to your medical needs.
It has a very friendly atmosphere,  as soon as you walk in you can capture the smile of the girls at the front desk.
The therapists are great professionals very knowledgeable and caring who take the time to explain in detail how and why to do each exercise and the benefits of it.
I would like to THANK , Dr. Melissa and her excellent  team who really care for their patients and their commitment to make our lives better.
I am very grateful for the results and if you need physical therapy this is the place to go.

Wicky and staff are extremely knowlegable, kind, and efficient. Their friendliness makes me look forward to appointments. I am thankful for their expert attention. Wicky went "the extra mile" in getting my new knee
back to normal. He is my hero!

Highly recommend this PT place! Dr Melissa and her team are professional and caring, my therapy sessions with Wiki have totally helped me with my post surgical knee recovery. With care, listening and a careful program of exercises and healing. I have been able to recover and also gain my energy back!
The facility is top in term of space and equipment and the background music sounds  to set the energy right to where it belongs.
Thanks! I am looking forward to continuing this coming weeks.

Melissa was great, listened to my issues and made a plan perfect for me.  The facility is clean, open and full of light with easy parking and very convenient location.  The staff is friendly and booking easy, both on-line and over the phone. I love how I get updates when there are openings to see if I can fit into my schedule!

I LOVE IT THE PLACE IS VERY CLEAN AND COMFORTABLE THE WOKERS ARE VERY RESPECTFUL AND VERY HELPFUL.AND DR.MELISSA SHABAN IS THE BEST.SHE LISTEN TO YOUR CONCERNS AND SHE ALSO MAKES SURE THAT YOU GET THE PROPER CARE.AND BEFORE LEAVING HER OFFICE SHE ALSO MAKES SURE THAT YOU FEELING A WHOLE.LOT BETTER THEN WHEN YOU CAME IN.I WOULD RECOMMEND HER FYZICAL THERAPY OFFICE TO ANYONE.

provider_name: Fyzical Therapy and Balance Centers - formerly Physical Therapy Associates PA
review_text: I highly recommend going to Rita Magill for any physical therapy needs. She is an incredibly intelligent woman and is undoubtedly the reason I am healed today. She answered all questions I had about my condition and the healing process with such depth of knowledge. She helped me through a very difficult and painful time in my life, and during my visits I saw how she did the same for so many others. Everyone else who works in the office is also incredibly kind and helpful, which made the experience of going to PT more positive.

provider_name: Fyzical Therapy and Balance Centers - formerly Physical Therapy Associates PA
review_text: Rita is a great physical therapist and even greater if I do not need more than 3 more therapy visits.

provider_name: Fyzical Therapy and Balance Centers - formerly Physical Therapy Associates PA
review_text: I had knee pain for 5 years and who knew that my friend would recommend me to this office. The fact that I don‚Äôt have that pain anymore is incredible. The therapists there are amazing. Parissa, Steven, and Rita really improved my life and I am so grateful for them. Even their assistants were so cheerful and helpful. 5/5 stars!!

provider_name: Fyzical Therapy and Balance Centers - formerly Physical Therapy Associates PA
review_text:
I rarely write reviews, but I felt compelled to share my experience because finding a physical therapist like this is truly rare. From the very first session with Dr. Ira Fiebert, I felt completely at ease and genuinely cared for. As a woman, sometimes it's hard to find a healthcare professional who makes you feel safe, heard, and understood‚Äîbut Dr. Fiebert went above and beyond in every possible way.

Not only is he incredibly knowledgeable and skilled in treating my condition, but he also took the time to explain everything in a way that made me feel empowered and informed. I never once felt rushed or uncomfortable. Dr. Fiebert created a space where I could ask questions without hesitation and made sure every step of the process was tailored to my needs and comfort level.

What really stood out to me was his attentiveness and empathy. He remembered the little things, checked in on my progress regularly, and truly celebrated the milestones with me‚Äîno matter how small. It didn‚Äôt feel like I was just another patient; it felt like I was being supported by someone who genuinely cared about my well-being.

If you‚Äôre looking for a physical therapist who is not only amazing at what he does, but also treats you with kindness, respect, and professionalism, I honestly cannot recommend Dr. Ira Fiebert enough. I‚Äôm so grateful for his support and guidance‚Äîit made all the difference in my recovery.

provider_name: Fyzical Therapy and Balance Centers - formerly Physical Therapy Associates PA
review_text: Rita Magill @ PT Associates is one of the best therapist I experienced in Miami ...Rita is not only a therapist, she is an excellent human being, very professional, experienced and very knowledgeable . Rita is a person with empathy and every time I had to use a therapist, Rita @ PT Associates is the place I will go. I highly recommend Rita and thanks for caring and curing my issues.

The Westchase location is amazing. The office staff Tatiana goes out of her way to get you in as soon as possible and secures insurance approval. Stephanie is kind and very knowledgeable creating a treatment plan specifically to meet your individual need.

One-on-one treatment by Sarah and Sephanie my highly skilled and knowledgeable therapists. I have received substantial and unexpected improvement of my conditions in a short period of time, and look forward to attending upcoming appointments. Highly recommend the staff, facility, and management Of Fyzical.

I first experienced the services of Fyzical Westchase with my late wife a few years ago. I was very impressed with the expertise and treatment provided by the therapists. Hence, when I faced my own balance issue, my first thought was to seek out the help of the Fyzical Westchase Team. A couple of years have passed since my wife's treatment.  Nonetheless, the staff is exactly what I expected - great knowledge and treatment.  Thank you!
Dr. John works smart to help me improve my vertigo & & balance. I am very grateful!

I wanted to express my gratitude and appreciation for the excellent care I received when I was a patient under the supervision of Michael, David, and Vincent during my recent treatment. I must say that I am feeling significantly better now, which is a testament to the expertise and professionalism of the entire staff.

The young men who assisted me, along with the office staff, demonstrated exceptional compassion and dedication to ensuring my comfort and well-being. Their standardized exercise routines were specifically designed to address my needs and goals, and their genuine interest in my progress was evident throughout my treatment.

I would highly recommend their services to anyone who is in need of physical therapy. They truly prioritize their patients' satisfaction and strive to create a positive experience. If I were to rate their level of care, I would certainly give them a 10-star review.

Thank you again for the opportunity to share my positive experience with you.
Beautiful facility! Jana is fantastic and the horses are all super happy!

Went for a tour so my girls could take lessons. Jana said she would get back to me and never did. Her reason is that she was ‚Äúhorse shopping.‚Äù But for 3 weeks? Give me a break. At least have the decency to let me know we aren‚Äôt the right fit for your program. I saw her at the feed store and asked her about it and her response was short and rude with no attempt to make any kind of amends. Business must be booming to neglect potential clients like that. She would have had four new riders but instead has zero. Don‚Äôt recommend simply based off of the few encounters, lack of consideration, and lack of professionalism.

Jana & Marylu are the absolute best! I‚Äôm so glad I found a barn close to home, with an awesome program, and such great people. Marylu has helped me tremendously with my seat. I‚Äôm 31, have been riding my entire life, and she teaches me things every week that I didn‚Äôt know before. Highly recommend!

Happy to call Galaxy home! Jana is the best trainer you will find. She is SAFE! She will teach you the foundational skills you need to be successful and safe. Jana will also help you learn to master your reservations and overcome and previous fears or bad experiences you may have had. She will never ask you to do something she is not confident you can handle. Jana is flexible with lesson scheduling and makes time for her students. That being said, she is naturally swamped during show season like many of our riders. New riders should understand this. The students at this barn are incredibly kind and welcoming. Highly recommend it for children and adult riders, both amateur and professional.

I was in need of some processed straw for my garden, with little luck at the big box stores, I gave Janna a cold call (email) explaining my situation. Jana was quick to reply and had informed me to call and set up a pick up time. For not being a regular customer or even a horse owner, I'm impressed on how generous Jana is. The ranch appeared very orderly, clean and has a corral with lots of obstacles for horse training. The horses looked very healthy. Shade, food and water all visible from a distance. Thank you for helping out a neighbor. I will refer my peers to Galaxy Farms for horse related matters.

We entrusted our two dachshunds a 6 year old with anxiety and a 2 year old with multiple behavioral issues to this team, and the transformation was remarkable. Within just two days, they were calmly walking on the leash and no longer reacting aggressively toward other dogs. The facility sent us daily progress videos, which built our confidence and showed us the results in real time.

The program not only changed our dogs‚Äô behavior but also gave us the tools to continue their training at home. Mariana was outstanding responsive, knowledgeable, and supportive throughout the process. We highly recommend their services. 10/10.

I'd like to share my experience with GIFMAF. I gave them my German Shepherd for a month and was very happy with the results! My dog ‚Äã‚Äãis 1.5 years old and he started going through puberty, pulling the leash and barking at absolutely every dog, and sometimes he just couldn't cope with his emotions outside. This caused me extreme discomfort and constant stress. I was terrified that I wouldn't be able to hold him one day. Having reached my breaking point, I started looking for a trainer. I spoke with a huge number of trainers, but my gut instinct told me to contact this school, and it didn't disappoint. I received training videos every day. Mariana was in touch with me 24/7, answering all my questions and requests. I'm very happy with my communication with her and Manuel. They genuinely try to make you happy and make sure your dog is doing well. When I arrived to pick up my dog, I was very worried and didn't know what to do. My dog ‚Äã‚Äãwas also acting strange because he really missed me and didn't always listen to my commands (I advise you not to rely on first impression). When we arrived home, I went for a walk with my dog ‚Äã‚Äãand simply didn't recognize him. He was very obedient and responded to all my commands. It's been almost a month since he came home, and our results are continuing. I follow all the trainer's recommendations and continue to train my dog twice a day. Now we have a wonderful time together outside, without stress, and we get a lot of compliments ‚ò∫Ô∏è

GIFMAF was recommended by our trusted dog sitter, and we couldn‚Äôt be happier with the experience! We have two dogs ‚Äî Maverick (Pomsky) and Jake (Shiba Inu) ‚Äî who completed a 17-day board and train, and it was absolutely worth it.

Jake can be stubborn, tends to pull on walks, and gets anxious around children, while Maverick struggles with new environments and meeting new people. The team at GIFMAF worked their magic ‚Äî the progress they made was incredible! They regularly sent us videos throughout the training, and it was hard to believe how much improvement we saw.

Communication was excellent. They kept us informed about any concerns and made sure we understood how to maintain the training once our dogs came home. When I picked them up, Ludiana patiently went over everything with me. It was a lot to take in at first, but she was so responsive afterward ‚Äî always ready to help when I needed reminders or reinforcement.

Now, I can walk both my boys calmly around the neighborhood, and even our neighbors have noticed how well-behaved they‚Äôve become. I highly recommend GIFMAF! The staff truly love the dogs they work with, and their thorough follow-ups and open communication make all the difference.

My puppy, Cookie, went through the 15 day training program. I am thrilled with what she‚Äôs learned and her overall behavior and demeanor. The assistance from the facilty and trainer on what tools I needed and how to correct any issues when she came home have been nothing short of miraculous! So looking forward to the group training class on Sunday. I love that they continue to stay in touch with me! Well worth what the program costs!‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è

I wish I had brought my 6 year old German shepherd to Gifmaf years ago. He has always been a great dog, just reactive on leash to other dogs and also very stubborn. I had chalked it up to his nature, but after a 15 day board and train, I realize I was completely wrong. The work and effort they put into my boy Coast has completely changed his demeanor on leash and around other dogs. I can now confidently walk him anywhere knowing he‚Äôs going to be calm and focused on me and the walk. I am so so so happy with the results Gifmaf provided and look forward to enjoying much more time exploring with Coast. Thank you for everything!

I took my English golden retriever to GIK-9 for service training and obedience. He did great, he loves Emma, Chaz and Sean! We utilize the training after the training as he is in the teenage part of growing. He LOVES going back to GIK-9 . He loves the Saturday pack walks and walking with his pack. The team did a great job training him and I look forward to him being better and better behaved.

I took my dog Ollie there for 6 weeks after we had issues with aggression towards people at our home and other dogs. He came back a different happy, super obedient dog. The trainers Emma and Chaz ate super patient, attentive and extremely communicative. They sent daily videos with explanation of how the day went and what the focus of the day is. We love this company and the people. We are a forever client and please take it from me they are the best in the business. Then, after the 6 weeks are over, they train the owner everything they taught the dog. They do.it with patience and kindness. They deserve 10 stars. Best of the best. Call them you won't regret it

Found Sean and his team via google. I have a 3 year old Malinois who began showing aggression toward men (even bit two people)
I left my dog for 6 weeks, brought back home a new and improved version. Sean was great very professional! Explains everything. Want to emphasize that training is an everyday thing, something to keep in mind,
This training doesn‚Äôt magically fix behavior forever. In my malinois case it definitely solved her aggression and Sean definitely helps with guidance on what to do and how to do it.
It‚Äôs near racking to leave your dog with a person you just met for that long but she was
In great hands! Would definitely recommend Sean to anyone needing help but particularly if you have a German Shepherd or malinois. He was great. Thank you!

GIK9 is awesome, can‚Äôt recommend them enough. I was worried cause my chi is a little older and stubborn but they took the time to get to know and bond with him and grew his confidence during his boarding. When I picked him up, I got a different dog, I‚Äôm now able to take him places and also not have to worry about him loosing it when guests come over. They go over all of the training with you after pick up and give free one on ones for life after you board with them so you can continue growing your dog!! I appreciated this so much after we had gone through other trainers who went quiet after pick up. I‚Äôm so happy I chose this facility and am very grateful to Sean, Chaz, and Emma his trainer. üêæ

Incredible dog trainer! Our dog Cash loves him so much and has the best time at training. We needed help training our new 7 month old puppy we adopted who was extremely hyper active, didn‚Äôt listen at all, and was food obsessed. We have little kids so it was important for us to know we could trust this new dog and have a strong connection. After just one session, our pup was so much calmer and in turn so were we. You can tell our trainer Sean genuinely loves animals and respects them, knowing the importance of building a bond and doing right by them. You will leave the sessions with some good homework and advice to continue practicing the training and building that bond at home.  We are very grateful we found this trainer and are excited to see our pup become even more well behaved, confident, and have lots of freedom (knowing he will listen to keep him and others safe). Thank you Gi-K9!

Rachel ‚ÄúRue‚Äù Peterson guidance and support was excellent! I needed a physical therapist that would work as my healing partner and teach me how to get back to my active lifestyle through functional exercises. I could barely walk from an injury to my hip when I began, couldn‚Äôt sit comfortably to drive and was very limited in activity. Now I am back tending my farm, enjoying yoga classes and hiking and plan to get back in my kayak soon. Rue, not only facilitated my recovery, but taught me how to stay safe doing everything I enjoy. I so appreciate that I had one on one sessions with her each visit. I Highly recommend GPW and especially Dr Peterson.

I am incredibly grateful for the expertise and care provided by Dr Rachel Peck. Her knowledge and professionalism truly made a difference in my recovery and overall well-being. She took the time to thoroughly understand my needs, explained everything clearly, and guided me with compassion and patience. Thanks to her, I feel 1000% better and more confident. I highly recommend her to anyone seeking a skilled and caring pelvic floor therapist. Thank you so much for your outstanding support!

Megan and the staff at GWP are AMAZING!  They are caring, dedicated and listen!  This is my second rotator cuff surgery and the treatment plan Megan has me on has me helped me improve so much quicker than my first surgery.  She is always changing things up to what my needs are.

When I had my first rotator cuff surgery done last year, my progress was slow and not improving.  I left the other PT and came to GWP and Megan and Lauren and the results and improvement were significant.  I would highly recommend GWP to anyone looking for kind, caring and compassionate physical therapists.  They are the best!!

I had a fantastic experience at GWP Physical Therapy! The staff is professional, welcoming, and truly focused on your recovery. The clinic is clean and well-equipped, and they offer great services like dry needling, which made a big difference for me!!

The best place to go for physical therapy! I was having shoulder pain and was having a hard time sleeping because of it. I made my appointment with Lauren and she took the time to explain everything to me. She gave me exercises to do at home between our sessions. Everyone is so kind and they treat you like family! Thanks to Lauren I do not have shoulder pain anymore!

Dr. Toledo was so pleasant and easy to talk to. He made me feel really comfortable throughout my visit. His office is very clean and welcoming, which added to the overall positive experience. I left feeling really good about my visit and would definitely recommend him to anyone considering acupuncture or holistic care.

Dr. Toledo is an awesome acupuncturist. I sleep well & fall asleep naturally, since I started acupuncture sessions with last year in 2024.

The sessions are tailored to your needs & multiple modalities are used if necessary.
And you can ask for things to make you more comfortable like heat or blanket, etc. Just welcoming atmosphere. I always have a great long nap.

It Definitely üòÅ helps me with my migraines  and lessen my chronic pain symptoms & other trauma symptoms.

And I like that there is flexibility in scheduling and you can even schedule or reschedule on the website. There is some weekend appointments available on Saturdays. Accepts most insurance policies including VA Community Care. Yeah üòÇ

Namaste

Tee

Dr. Tuledo did a fantastic job of relieving me of some chronic pain. He got a full understanding of what my issues were, did some movement and seating tests to gauge my pain levels/ability, and then expertly found the exact spot in my back that had been making life difficult for years.

From early February - present, I have been able to walk, work, bend, stretch, etc. in a way I haven't been able to do in a long while. I'm really grateful that one of my sisters encouraged me to visit his office, and I'm grateful for Dr. Tuledo's skills.

A.P. Toledo‚Ä¶Alvaro, in my opinion is the ‚Äúbest of the best.‚Äù First of all, Alvaro always takes the time to sit with the patient to discuss issues and concerns; providing excellent feedback so that the patient understands acupuncture-dry needling procedures. This in itself alleviates one‚Äôs anxiety or apprehension and allows the patient to speak freely in describing their issues and/or pain. Alvaro is extremely professional and his knowledge of body systems is soon apparent in the administration of procedures; always providing feedback in a caring and friendly manner. This helps the patient in describing any pain locations. I have complete trust in Alvaro and am very fortunate to have found such a knowledgeable physician who is so caring. Another factor is the modern facility and relaxing environment. Making appointments is also a seamless and quick process. All this adds up to a great experience. As a side note, and even though my pain is in a concentrated area, I have noticed that I sleep much better. Having dealt with chronic pain for many years has allowed me to fully understand the science of cellular benefits of acupuncture-dry needling procedures. Having a professional such as Alvaro, who has such knowledge, has helped me on this journey; each session allowing me to become more active and pain free. Again, I am fortunate to have found his clinic.

This place has been truly life changing. Always great service and hospitality. The healthcare provider here are so personable and professional. I would highly recommend you give them a try for your acupuncture needs.

provider_name: Gainesville Animal Hospital: Sameck Jack DVM
review_text:
The people there are very professional, good at their job, and kind. I like that they always take the time to talk to me about my dog. And just ask about me as a person. It's also reasonably priced.

They were able to handle my yodelling husky, so they have dog handling skills.

provider_name: Gainesville Animal Hospital: Sameck Jack DVM
review_text: Great place! We stopped during a recent road trip to have a tick removed from our Golden Retriever. The staff were friendly and efficient. The vet even came out to show us that he had been able to remove that he entire tick. And the service was free of charge! If we lived in the area we would definitely come back here for care for our dog. Thank you!

provider_name: Gainesville Animal Hospital: Sameck Jack DVM
review_text: Great quality. They really took care of the kitten I found. However, I find some of their practices questionable. They had you sign your full name next to a procedure you DO NOT WANT during the time your cat will get fixed. It should be opt-in, not opt-out, and why your full signature? Seems like a psychological attempt to get you to do the procedure. I don't like it at all. They just seem like they nickle and dime you, like they did selling me the cone that was kind of unnecessary.

provider_name: Gainesville Animal Hospital: Sameck Jack DVM
review_text: We have used Gainesville Animal Hospital for almost 30 years, following disappointing experiences at two other local veterinary practices when we were new to Gainesville.  They have seen us through regular shots and procedures and through tragedy.  They have always been compassionate and treated our cats as if they were their own.  They are honest about when something can or cannot be remedied and have referred us to the vet school when needful. Best of all, they have seen us through the lives of several cats that died of old age. We are very happy to have them to care for our animals.

provider_name: Gainesville Animal Hospital: Sameck Jack DVM
review_text: COVID-safe and very focused on animal health and comfort.. honestly the kindest veterinarians ive dealt with in a long time and very understanding and knowledgeable.  my cat is v lucky to have them taking care of him!

Sorcha is so knowledgeable and has a great approach to teaching. She gets right down to business and uses the class time wisely. She provides a good environment for learning and keeps the class size small so she can work individually with each of us as we work to train our dogs. Sometimes her husband comes to assist and he is also very helpful. I would highly recommend her level one obedience class.

I highly recommend Gainesville Canine Academy. I hap appointments w both of my dogs individually as they both were in different places in their training. The strategies we learned were easy to carry over to at home training. The learning was turned in to a game so it was enjoyable for all.

Sorcha and Michelle were amazing at working with our dog Barley--a 2-year old rescue dog.  They are both expert at their craft of service dog training--and also as important, in being patient and thorough in helping us as handlers understand our roles in providing clear direction to our dog. Barley's first plane trips (literally across the world) went totally smoothly because he and we knew exactly what to do--thanks to Gainesville Canine Academy!
I've been working with Samantha and it's been amazing so far! My dog is taking the training really well and is eager to learn. I can't wait to work more with her.

Sorcha is amazing! She helped me learn tasks for my dog Luna. Luna was therapy certified prior and we wanted to get her service certified. Sorcha was wonderful and taught us a lot in the time we worked together before we had to move. I was able to practice with Luna all of the foundational skills I took from our sessions.
Eryan is a wonderful therapist. The front desk staff are also very sweet and helpful.
Larry the only PhD therapist doesn't take new patients and the other therapist are so unprofessional. My appointment was reschedule so many times. Therapist interns don't call you back. Just horrible

After being referred to this Counseling Center by a program through work, I realized I already knew of several of the therapists here through friendships and church relationships. As a queer man, it‚Äôs always a nerve-racking experience to start with a new therapist, but I am very thankful for the unbiased and helpful service I‚Äôve received so far. The scheduling system is efficient and the reminders are great. Everyone has a smile on when I walk in, and I‚Äôve never had to wait more than a minute or two past my appointment time to be seen.

This place is terrible. Do not go here.. I was referred here through work because my insurance covers a certain amount of free sessions.

I should have trusted my gut from the beginning when the guy working the front desk told me I needed to call my insurance and find out how many sessions were covered and call him back... Pretty sure that's his job but he was too busy every day sitting there eating food and just chatting..

Next my therapist.  She was nice but after a couple sessions you could tell she wasn't a great therapist.  Talking to her did nothing, zero helpful guidance and info. I went to most of my scheduled appointments but each one started later and later. She was consistently starting our sessions 10 to 15 minutes after our appointment time but she was definitely quick to stop right at the 15 minute till the hour mark or sooner. . I finally just canceled the rest of my scheduled sessions and never went back. You get the feeling this place is just a bunch of college kids having fun with zero actual investment in who's coming in and their well being.

The only bright spot was the blonde girl working the front desk with the lazy guy. She was extremely nice and actually helpful and seemed to truly care.

Avoid this place at all costs. It wasn't even worth me going for completely free sessions.  That should say it all.

Absolutely loved my experiences here! Front desk staff is so friendly and helpful, and therapists are very prompt if you need to get ahold of them. Everyone is so understanding and genuine with you. If you're looking to start therapy somewhere, this is the place to do it!
Morgan is amazing! The massage is just invigorating and she knows exactly what‚Äôs needed. Her bedside manner is just awesome. My back has never felt better. My sciatic nerve pain is under control.

Morgana is absolutely a miracle worker. I have been seeing her twice a month for about 5 months now and she has tremendously helped with my cubital tunnel syndrome and my low back pain. She‚Äôs extremely in tune with people‚Äôs bodies and knows exactly what to do to improve pain and increase quality of life. I don‚Äôt know what I would‚Äôve done if she hadn‚Äôt been recommended to me. She‚Äôs an absolute life saver!

Unprofessional massage therapy. For the first visit the therapist refused to do an hour massage simply because you were few minutes late and had to fill out paperwork and explain what your needs as a patient are. So very rudely your appointment turns to only half an hour. Now if you don't accept the situation, you'll be rejected! unfriendly environment, unable to dissolve the tension with patient in a right and curtesy manner.
I always look forward to my appointments. I leave relaxed and rejuvenated. Always very professional, knowledged, caring , on time, and helpful. I would highly recommend making an appointment.

Traci is wonderful! She is very knowledgeable and in tune to each patients individual needs and customizes a treatment plan accordingly. My husband and I both noticed a difference after our first appointment. We both now see Traci weekly and highly recommend her to all our friends and family.

Wait the month it may take you to start physical therapy at this particular facility. You won't regret it.

Either therapist is excellent. Cough up the money for any shoes they recommend. The correct shoes are a game changer.

Then get to work. I have been to 2 other physical therapists in town over the last 10 years who were unable to alleviate my back pain.  After this physical therapy I can bend without experiencing pain. I can climb a ladder. I can bend down and pull weeds. I can wash windows. I can get to the floor and plug in a computer.

When I finished PT, I started their wellness program which is like personal training at a lower cost. You work with an exercise specialist during the visit but you still have the PT overseeing your program.

It is pleasant being around the students from UF getting their degrees who oversee the Wellness Program.

Kudos to the entire staff for their part in my journey back to health. This place is like Cheers.....where everybody knows your name.

I really appreciate everything this place has done for me. I did PT for about 6 months for shoulder and neck issues, and things improved dramatically. The therapy helped in the short term - I'd never had dry needling before, but came to really appreciate it - and I‚Äôve learned a bunch of exercises and stretches that have helped long-term.

I‚Äôve since been in the wellness program (about 8-10 months), and that has seemingly helped to maintain and gradually even improve where things were at the end of PT. I still get occasional pain and flare ups, largely due to my posture at work, but much less frequent, intense and long-lasting.

Everyone I‚Äôve met has also been great. David (the PT and owner) is incredibly nice and goes out of his way to help, his wife Missi is equally kind and generous, and they seem to have an eye for hiring good people.

My family and I have been going to Gainesville Physical Therapy since David had his business at northwest 14th Ave. He has seen us through the whitewater kayaking days, the Bicycle trick riding days, the soccer wars and joint replacement. He and his crew have pretty much worked on most of our bones, joints, muscles, tendons and ligaments to wonderful success. The slang might be ‚Äúthey stuck us back together‚Äù. His staff is always courteous, knowledgeable and effective, conducting themselves in a flawless professional manner.
Without reservation I can recommend Gainesville Physical Therapy to anyone in need of this kind of attention.
These are great people!
Gary

I had an Amazing experience here! All the staff are friendly and very knowledgeable. Ilya has extremely helped in improving my neck and back pain. He gave me the tools needed to continue strengthening my muscles beyond my sessions. I am thankful for my time with Gainesville Physical Therapy & Wellness! I recommend physical therapy highly if you are facing any muscular pain issues!

I rarely rate anything as 5 stars, so this review may seem a bit lengthy. The summary is they are a pleasant, professional staff offering reasonably priced health and wellness programs in a relaxing environment.

The more fullsome comments are that I cannot say enough good things about Gainesville Physical Therapy & Wellness. I have found if you put in the time and effort, PT almost always improves your condition. I have completed a course of physical therapy several times in the past at various venues,  but none have been more successful than at Gainesville PT & Wellness.

The front desk and office staff (Kim & Rachel) are efficient and pleasant. They work very hard on your behalf relative to ease of access, scheduling and payment.

The physical therapists and the interns/students are extraordinarily skilled.  The therapists ( David, Audrey, Chris & others) have all demonstrated strong listening skills and the ability to craft a personalized program that addresses your presenting issue(s) and really helps drive you to recovery.

Gainesville PT & Wellness also offers an exceptional wellness program.  It's flexible, innovative and surprisingly affordable. I joined in order to continue to build on the flexibility and strength I developed in my initial therapy sessions, with a view to continuing to improve and reduce future injuries.  The exercise techs I have worked with (Kayla, Keith & McKayla) are supportive,  encouraging and fun. They focus on ensuring that your exercise program is tailored to meet your goals while minimizing pain. One of the benefits of this welless program is the easy collaboration betwern the exercise techs and the medical team if questions arise.

Important to me, is that I almost ALWAYS feel better after my session versus when I arrived. I highly recommend Gainesville Physical Therapy & Wellness for your therapy and exercise needs.

provider_name: Gainesville Riding through Equine-assisted Activities and Therapy
review_text: Great for Kids and adults.

Joining Gainesville Wellness and Performance has been truly life-changing. I came in with years of chronic pain and limited mobility, and through their guidance, I now move more freely and without pain‚Äîsomething I wasn‚Äôt sure would ever be possible.

The trainers here are next-level: highly skilled, incredibly attentive, and genuinely compassionate. They‚Äôve helped me unlearn years of misinformation about form and movement which has allowed me to surpass previous plateaus and stop constantly injuring myself. Their approach is thoughtful and personalized, never judgmental, and always focused on long-term well-being.

But what makes this place stand out even more is the sense of community. It‚Äôs become so much more than just a gym‚Äîit‚Äôs a space where I feel supported, encouraged, and seen. I can show up, be myself and share a few laughs along the way. If you‚Äôre looking for a place that prioritizes acceptance, real health, and sustainable progress, without all the fads, competition, and performance, this is your place. You‚Äôre going to love it!

I‚Äôve been to many gyms, but Gainesville Wellness and Performance stands in a league of its own. From the moment you walk in, you can feel the difference‚Äîthis is not just a place to work out, it‚Äôs a place to see real results. The environment is clean, modern, and incredibly well-equipped, with an emphasis on both performance and wellness.

What truly sets this gym apart is the personalized approach to exercise. The trainers are knowledgeable, professional, and genuinely invested in your progress. Every session feels purposeful and efficient, tailored to help you reach your goals without wasting time or energy.

If you‚Äôre looking for a facility that combines elite-level training with a strong focus on health and longevity, this is it. Gainesville Wellness and Performance delivers excellence at every level. Highly recommended.

I have worked out under the guidance of GWP since its conception (over 10 years). I have an active lifestyle and enjoy lots of traveling. Having a regular, daily workout routine has helped to keep me strong and injury free. At 69, I feel fantastic! And to top it off , the coaches and my fellow workout buddies make it enjoyable.
Hands-down the best physical therapy experience I have had in my life. GWP has earned my business for hopefully years to come.

I have dealt with a chronic condition for over 20 years and thought I knew everything about managing it. Saw Dr Haley Sweeney and she taught me so much more. I am feeling stronger and empowered. She is very patient, informed and fun to work with too! So glad that I gave PT another chance. It has really added to my quality of life. Very nice facility and staff too. (And easy parking which is rarity it Gainesville!!)
Shay is wonderful with my dog. We have been seeing her for a year now and I have seen much improvement with my dogs knees tear. Highly recommend!

I highly recommend!!!  My chronic back pain is gone-I didn‚Äôt even know that was possible!  Brian is knowledgeable, professional and takes the time to listen to what you have to say. Again, I highly recommend!!
Brian is an amazing chiropractor. He is friendly and knowledgeable. I love the laid  back feel and the real concern for my health.

I have been bringing my 13 year old English Bulldog to Dr. Gainer for 5 months now and we absolutely love her! She is very patient with our old girl and has really helped her through some difficult times with her Vestibular syndrome. I highly recommend chiropractic care for your animals, especially from Gaining Wellness! Class act! Thank you for all you do!
Gaining Wellness and Dr. Gainer help our yellow lab tremendously! He was having a hard time even getting up to go outside, after she does an adjustment on him, he gets around great. Highly recommend!

We had a wonderful experience working with Garellek Counseling for one of our kids. From the very beginning, they made our child feel comfortable, safe, and truly seen. Our child looked forward to sessions every week!

As a parent, I appreciated the thoughtful communication and regular updates that helped us stay informed and involved in the process without ever feeling intrusive.

I‚Äôm incredibly grateful for the care and compassion they brought to every session, and I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to recommend them to any family looking for meaningful, effective support.

I‚Äôve been going here for a little over a year and it has truly been a life changing experience. Working with Jamie has been so transformative. The amount of healing and positive change in my life from working with her has been something that I will cherish for the rest of my life. I am seriously so grateful to work with someone so compassionate and understanding while also expanding my comfort zone to have an even better life than I could have imagined. I highly recommend this place. The staff in general is always welcoming and kind! Thank you Garellek Counseling for the amazing help and support to live a beautiful, peaceful life!

We are extremely grateful for Garellek Counselings professionalism, amazing staff and clean offices. We always feel welcomed and loved when attending our weekly sessions. We highly recommend this practice to all those seeking a safe and caring environment.

I LOVE the Garellek Counseling team and how everyone works together  like a family.  Its one of the very few practices that cater to all ages.  The practice has two amazing play rooms, one art room and tons of toys and games to incorporate into play therapy sessions.  The practice just added a really cool play room geared for teens and young adults. My 10 year old son loves the basketball hoop arcade game, the life size boxing bag, and foosball game additions.
I had a great experience with Garellek Counseling. The staff was welcoming, compassionate and professional. They created a safe space and I felt truly comfortable there. Highly recommend them!

provider_name: Gators Spine & Wellness Clinic Dr. Wendy L. Flynn, Chiropractic Physician
review_text:
Dr. Flynn has been a constant source of care and support in my life, from childhood through years of competitive sports. She‚Äôs helped me recover from soccer injuries and has always approached every situation with professionalism, knowledge, and genuine compassion.

I‚Äôve also had the privilege of watching how she treats her patients, and it‚Äôs something I truly admire ‚Äî she listens, takes her time, and makes everyone feel cared for. She‚Äôs not only an incredible chiropractor, but also an incredible person. Anyone who visits her is in excellent hands.

provider_name: Gators Spine & Wellness Clinic Dr. Wendy L. Flynn, Chiropractic Physician
review_text: Dr. Wendy and her team were fantastic! She was extremely professional and took her time to assess my issues and develop a plan specific to my needs. I can honestly say I have not felt this great in years! Thank you so much and I can‚Äôt wait to come back.

provider_name: Gators Spine & Wellness Clinic Dr. Wendy L. Flynn, Chiropractic Physician
review_text: After multiple visits with Dr. Wendy and her team, I‚Äôve been thoroughly impressed by their attentive care and flexibility. Their approach to mobility and recovery is both individualized and adaptive. Every visit is a step in the right direction towards feeling more agile and aligned.

provider_name: Gators Spine & Wellness Clinic Dr. Wendy L. Flynn, Chiropractic Physician
review_text: Dr. Flynn and staff are amazing.  They have truly helped me in many ways.  I have not felt this good in many years.  Please give them a chance to help you, you won't be disappointed.

provider_name: Gators Spine & Wellness Clinic Dr. Wendy L. Flynn, Chiropractic Physician
review_text: I can‚Äôt say enough great things about Gators Spine & Wellness Clinic and Dr. Wendy Flynn! From the moment you walk in with a nice atmosphere that instantly puts you at ease. I loved the relaxing music staff had played, really adding to the tone of the space. Dr. Flynn is incredibly knowledgeable, attentive, and truly takes the time to listen and understand your concerns to find a solution. She explains everything clearly and works with you to create a personalized plan for healing and long-term wellness. Whether you‚Äôre dealing with pain, stress, or just need routine adjustments, this clinic is a gem. The care here goes beyond just chiropractic, Dr.Flynn and I have become great friends. I‚Äôve seen real improvements in both how I feel and how I move thanks to Dr. Flynn‚Äôs expertise and compassion. Highly recommend to anyone looking for a chiropractor who genuinely cares and delivers results! Thank you Dr. Wendy!

I can‚Äôt say enough good things about Genesis Counseling!

Whether you're dealing with anxiety, family issues, past trauma, or just need someone to talk to, Genesis Counseling is the place to go. They genuinely care about your progress and it shows in every session. I‚Äôm so thankful I found them‚Äîthis place has made a huge, positive impact not only in my life but my family as well.

Highly recommend to anyone looking for real change and lasting support! You won‚Äôt regret it!

We‚Äôve been seeing Rebecca Joseph for a few months and my son has made such amazing and positive headway since our visits started. He looks forward to their sessions together, which is pleasantly surprising. She‚Äôs kind, down to earth, and trustworthy. I appreciate that things remain confidential between them, unless he or she have concerns. Rebecca is very communicative, and offers incredible and honest support to my family and my son.

The office itself is lovely! The waiting room for parents is bright, colorful and very inviting.

Finding a therapist or counselor can be daunting; you may have to see a few before you find the perfect fit. I‚Äôm so grateful that we found Rebecca and Genesis Counseling.

I highly recommend Genesis Counseling! The owner is incredibly compassionate and deeply committed to providing the best possible support for every client. You can tell that they truly believe in the healing process and take great pride in ensuring their clients feel heard and supported every step of the way. The therapists are equally amazing. They are not only highly skilled and knowledgeable but also empathetic and understanding.

This is a very compassionate group of therapists, working online and in person to help individuals and families to live their best lives with the support of skilled counselors. I highly recommend this team. They have a great location in Coral Springs. As a seasoned therapist, it's great to know colleagues like the Genesis team that I can refer out when we cannot accommodate a person or family in need of therapy services.

I don‚Äôt typically write reviews, but I feel compelled to share my experience. It has been two months since I started therapy with Carrie De Souza at Genesis Counseling, and I am incredibly grateful for her caring and compassionate approach. Carrie is both knowledgeable and intuitive, which has made a significant difference in my journey.

Since I began working with her, I can feel an improvement in my mental health, and it‚Äôs a reminder of how vital mental health is‚Äîjust as important as physical health. If you‚Äôre considering starting therapy, I highly recommend Genesis Counseling. Take that first step toward prioritizing your well-being‚Äîyou won‚Äôt regret it.

We had to unexpectedly put our 16 year old cat down in the evening hours on Saturday. Gentle Pet Crossing had someone out there within a couple hours for us at our house. They were kind and helpful. The fact I didnt have to try and move or bother my cat in his last few hours and could just spend that time showing him all the love really made the experience so much easier. From the moment we called until the end, they were so supportive through such a hard time. Thank you so much Dr. Rachel and staff!

There are not enough words to explain how amazing they were from the very first phone call to the day we had to pick up our sweet boys ashes. They are all truly angels! Kind, patient, compassionate and understanding. The doctor was wonderful with us during one of the most hardest times in our families life. I would recommend GPC a million times over! Thank you all for being the people you are. Times like these are when true angels shine.

Can't tell you how amazing this place is my 10 year old Lab mix Loki passed away on Labor day, I called them right at 7am praying that they would answer and they did. Steele was very compassionate and met me there within the hour. Helped us bring our pup in and made us and made things as easy as possible on us.  Would definitely recommend to anyone! Thank you guys from the bottom of our hearts

Rachel and the Office staff were wonderful. First time doing an at home euthanasia of a pet.. but Rachel was amazing. She was so patient and gentle and everything just made the experience a lot easier..

We used Gentle Pet Crossing in 2022 for our Siamese. Our Bully regretfully was 13 years old and I contacted them for help. We had Dr Rachel who we had in 2022. She is great. I like her very much! She was very patient and understanding the whole time and was great with our bully. It‚Äôs a rough time however they do make it easier and they do trully care about you and your family members. I don‚Äôt call anyone but Gentle Pet Crossings. Nothing compares to saying goodbye to your loved one in the peace of your own home and not in a vets clinic. Thank you Gentle Pet Crossing for caring and for your compassion!

provider_name: Give Me 5 Therapy and PPEC Center
