My son  is doing OT and PT  for several months now. The therapist are loving, caring and knowledgeable .The office staff is very helpful and welcoming. I would highly recommend.

provider_name: Johns Hopkins All Children's Outpatient Care, Fort Myers
review_text: Our MRI tech was hands down the best! Very calming and attentive. Thought I was at a spa for a minute there!! Kudos!!

provider_name: Johns Hopkins All Children's Outpatient Care, Fort Myers
review_text: So thankful for Dr. Terrie and Dr. Holly, their care, support and patience goes without saying. My daughter has been lucky enough to be in their audiology care since she was only days old and they‚Äôve always gone above and beyond to help in any way they can. Providers that love what they do and it showsüôåüèΩ ‚ù§Ô∏è My babygirl got her BAHA today, so grateful to these ladies for all of their help and guidance, thank you for all you do ‚ù§Ô∏è

provider_name: Johns Hopkins All Children's Outpatient Care, Pasco
review_text: I received exceptional service. The team's extensive knowledge guided me in choosing the right stroller and car seat for my son. Their professionalism and kindness were truly outstanding.

provider_name: Johns Hopkins All Children's Outpatient Care, Pasco
review_text: Auditory check was great. Staff was easy to work with and kind. Dr was amazing and well versed at working with my son. Very good experience. Would recommend for auditory issues.

provider_name: Johns Hopkins All Children's Outpatient Care, Pasco
review_text: The doctor and the staff always treat my son and myself if we were all family, with compassion and with every situation they explain every option They truly care about how my son feels about with each medical challenge that he faces. I would like to thank the doctor and all the staff for always being there for my son and I and making us feel so much happier and so much better than when we walked in the door.

provider_name: Johns Hopkins All Children's Outpatient Care, Pasco
review_text: We love our therapist at JHAC outpatient in Pasco! Aside from the drive we look forward to our visits! Miss Laura and Michelle in PT/OT are amazing and they adore my boy as much as my boy adores them! And then we also see miss Megan for feeding therapy and she is equally amazing!!!!

provider_name: Johns Hopkins All Children's Outpatient Care, Pasco
review_text: We had a really good experience at this office. Everyone was kind and professional. My daughter was scared and they made her feel welcomed.

provider_name: Johns Hopkins All Children's Outpatient Care, Tampa
review_text: Tampa facility is great. Love how it understands just how important it is to have parents involved in their kids health and therapy. I've experienced several aspects and departments of this facility and everyone is amazing. Those who have interacted directly with my children over the years have always bent over backwards to make them feel comfortable and always leave them with that sparkle of excitement and joy in their eyes. One year they had a Santa and gifts for the kids and were just so generous and kind not only with my kids but myself and I'll never forget that touching day. I still have the pics of us with Santa. Even the guard is super friendly. From cardiac to speech and some in between, they've always left me sure that as long as we have the need to come there, that's the only place we'll go!

provider_name: Johns Hopkins All Children's Outpatient Care, Tampa
review_text: Dr. Bell-Sambataro is excellent. Friendly, easy to talk to, and extremely thorough. She goes through the explanation of tests results until you feel comfortable in understanding the information. Her bedside manner is top notch for both the patient and the parent.

provider_name: Johns Hopkins All Children's Outpatient Care, Tampa
review_text: Check-in is a little different from what I am used to. After going to the security check, I was told to sit down and wait. I waited for 5 minutes in a waiting room before I was called to be checked in. Still had to file paperwork even though this was all required of me before I came through the MyChart app. Despite this unusual check-in process, the staff was all polite and courteous. Jordan, for the physical therapy, was amazing. She was very understanding of how my daughter reacts to doctor's visits and handled this visit with great care. She was able to complete the entire evaluation, which is huge since my daughter refused to finish TGH's evaluation last year. We were very satisfied with our visit, and we are so grateful she was so kind to our daughter. Very happy with the services at St. John Hopkins

provider_name: Johns Hopkins All Children's Outpatient Care, Tampa
review_text:
We had a very disappointing experience with Dr. Amanda and her team during a circumcision consultation for our newborn. The nurses and staff was great and friendly. From the beginning, both the doctor and her assistants were rude and seemed completely indifferent‚Äînot only to us as parents but also to our baby. It felt like we were just another number, not a family seeking care for a sensitive procedure.

Dr. Amanda explained that if we didn‚Äôt get the procedure scheduled within a few days, we‚Äôd have to wait until our baby was older and undergo general anesthesia. That seemed completely unnecessary and risky, and added a lot of stress. Scheduling was a whole ordeal‚Äîwe were told to contact someone else who would then need to coordinate with Tampa General Hospital the appointment. We called the same day, and the person we spoke with promised a call back the next day or by Monday. It‚Äôs now Tuesday and we‚Äôve heard nothing.

The lack of communication and empathy really stood out. I would not recommend this office for circumcisions or any care that requires compassion and responsiveness. Very disappointed.

provider_name: Johns Hopkins All Children's Outpatient Care, Tampa
review_text: Daughter (14 months) had some labs drawn - very quick and the staff was excellent with her. She only had to be stuck 1 time for the blood work! 10/10 recommend

provider_name: Johns Hopkins All Children‚Äôs Rehabilitation Center
review_text:
You list yourself as a clinic, misrepresenting that you would be a copay facility versus a hospital billed facility and you do NOT disclose this upfront.  Some of us working class barely get by as it is and we dont qualify for help.  Then you want us to pay all our max out of pockets for insurance instead of the copay you should be taking because you are in fact a clinic not the hospital.
You are not doing this because you care about kids and families, if you did you wouldnt be willing to take every dime they had in order for their child to be able to treat at your "clinic" that bills like a facility.
The bottom $$ is what yous seek.
We will have to go somewhere we can afford to have our daughter treated and that  is upsetting.  But I guess thats life because no one can afford over $300 per visit.
And might I add I have brought this up to billing and theyre "looking into it"...its been several days with no call back from them, no call back from patient advocate we asked to speak with...the call back we did get, nothing was discussed as to why you choose to bill like you do.
Nothing about this has been right.  We even told you we cant do 8am appointments and what did you schedule thru June?  8am appointments...all of them.

provider_name: Johns Hopkins All Children‚Äôs Rehabilitation Center
review_text: This place is amazing! So happy with the ease of scheduling, checking in each visit and treatment for my daughter.  The therapists are all great! It doesn't matter which one you get because they are all great and so nice! 10/10 recommend it here for any adolescent!!

provider_name: Johns Hopkins All Children‚Äôs Rehabilitation Center
review_text: They canceled my daughter appointment without notice.

provider_name: Johns Hopkins All Children‚Äôs Rehabilitation Center
review_text: Good clinic and good service for my son and exelente staff üëç

provider_name: Johns Hopkins All Children‚Äôs Rehabilitation Center
review_text:
Kali Macgregor  very prefess
onial and she is so kind üôè

Dr Davis and staff are wonderful. He replaced two disks in my neck and two weeks post-op I feel improvement. Dr. Davis takes the time needed to listen and treat the individual and that sets this experience far above others for me. His kindness will always be appreciated and remembered.

Dr. Melendez is absolutely a rare gem of a Physician. He truly cares about his patients and gives his undivided attention, to get to know his patients. He is a top notch physician. Hands down, the BEST!!! Highly recommend Dr. Melendez, if you are a patient in pain. Not a pain patient . His staff is phenomenal! I absolutely love them all!

If you are having back issues, this practice is a godsend. They diagnosed an issue that a neurosurgeon with a different practice completely missed on my MRI. I did the physical therapy in house with them (working with Nicky), and I was able to get completely back to normal after almost giving up hope about that being a possibility. Their billing department is fantastic. At all levels, this is an incredible group.

We saw Dr. Henn yesterday afternoon for a fracture in my 97 year old mother's spine. He went over both her MRI and x-rays and explained what he could do  step by step and this will be done today!  We both felt extremely comfortable and confident in his explanation and look forward to having this procedure done so she won't be in such agonizing pain!

Dr Melendez has to be one of the most compassionate and caring doctors I have ever met. He listens , And he is extremely thorough. I highly suggest joint implant surgeons of Florida, and of course my favorite doctor there is Dr Melendez. Great Job üëç.

provider_name: Joleen R. Fernald Pediatric Therapy Services
review_text: What an amazing therapist! Whether you are a colleague, a parent, a patient, or just have questions, Joleen is always a joy to talk to and learn from. Her office is warm, inviting and always clean. And I was lucky enough to meet her beautiful family. Highly recommend!

provider_name: Joleen R. Fernald Pediatric Therapy Services
review_text: Joleen has been such a huge blessing for our family. My daughter loves going to see her!

Dr. Joshua Shannon was amazing. He took care of all my needs, and he is very responsive when I had to have any paperwork sent to the DUI counterattack or my probation officer. He is definitely a step above and really cares about your needs. I would recommend him over any healthcare provider in the area!!!

Dr. Shannon is great. He‚Äôs always available whenever I call, he has great bedside manner (unlike most Dr‚Äôs I‚Äôve been in contact with), he makes sure whatever you need (whether it be an appt, paperwork be sent over etc) is done in an efficient and timely manner, and he has a great staff. Dr. Amanda (his employee) is a phenomenal therapist and really does care about her patients and makes you feel very comfortable during your sessions with her. Highly recommended!

Dr. Shannon was very informative, knowledgeable compassionate counselor and doctor. He assisted me to satisfy DUI matters and was prompt and followed up in a timely manner. He was about the only doctor I could find in the Tampa Bay Area that had all credentials needed to conduct assessment. I appreciated his helpful mannerisms. Would recommend to my family or friends. Was referred by others he helped.

I have been a patient of Dr Shannon‚Äôs for several years. He is an amazing therapist. And has made a tremendous difference in my life. I highly recommend him, very professional and with his vast experience he is able to make a huge difference.

Dr Shannon has been a huge part in my recovery and getting me the help that I needed.   He's very professional, knowledgeable, courteous and empathetic.  Without his help and treatment I feel I would be in a much worse place and state of mind.  Thank you so much Dr Shannon.

Joy is an enthusiastic and caring physical therapist that offers a personal perspective towards patient care. Joy consistently listens and gives appropriate treatment for patient concerns. She treats a variety of patients, but is particularly adept in treatment of scoliosis using the Schroth-Barcelona method.

Joy's clinic is also a total gem. The clinic design is top-notch, more out patient clinics should feel this good to be in. The clinic is very welcoming, and is a great space for physical therapy; bright, well decorated, and practical.

Joy has done more as a Physical and Scroth therapist than I ever expected. I was so amazed at the difference she made with my back in a few visits. Very gentle, precise tweaks in the office along with the home exercises keep me pain free.  So very thankful for Joy!

I had a terrible backache that didn‚Äôt heal fully for months despite steroids and n-saids.   A friend then referred me to Joy.  Joy IMMEDIATELY identified the problem after physical palpitation of my muscles and we began work on my back. Within days I felt relief. Honestly, Joy is a very talented and intuitive therapist. Don‚Äôt lose hope if you have tried other things.  Call Joy!

My experience has been healing, educational, and delightful. Joy is so knowledgeable and I feel so comfortable with her hands on treatment and directions about caring for myself outside of the therapy sessions. I feel like I have received therapy and education about how to care for my back that will help me long term so I don‚Äôt have to depend on therapy to stay well, yet I have the option to check in at intervals as needed.
I really enjoy her down to earth attitude while bring so knowledgeable and encouraging.
Thank you Joy.
Yolande

Joy must have been destined for her work as a physical therapist because her name says it all! The experience at Joy of Therapy is simply that, a joy. The practice itself is welcoming, comfortable, and professional. As a practitioner, Joy is the same. She takes the difficulty of my medical condition and approaches it scientifically and personally so that I leave every time feeling better physically and mentally. Her abilities with the Schroth Method give me optimism for my future with scoliosis. I give my highest recommendation for Joy of Therapy.

If you need therapy for your little one, look no further. When I found out my son needed occupational therapy, I was very overwhelmed with how to pick the right fit and navigate insurance. I am so glad I ended up at Joyful Motion. The front staff are so welcoming and really walk you through everything. We worked with Stephanie and I can not say enough wonderful things about her. My son truly enjoyed going to therapy because of her. She worked with him, but also communicated with us so we could implement tools at home to help him along. The entire staff love on your kiddo, make you feel so welcome, and honestly care about your child, and it shows. Thank you Stephanie and Joyful Motion for helping our family.

As a pediatric  Chiropractor I trusted all the practitioners at Joyful Motion. Their expertise, compassion, and ability to connect with children makes a huge difference in the high quality of care they offer.

I brought my son to Joyful Motion after years of early intervention and a year of therapy in the public school.  He had issues learning colors, letters, sounds, etc.  In the first meeting with our therapist at Joyful Motion she clearly understood our concerns and identified development issues we didn't even see.  After a couple of months of their treatment he learned more than he did in a year of school.  We have continued his therapy weekly and he has transitioned from a child we were told should stay back to a child on the honor roll for the last 2 years.

I can not say enough great things about this place. Savannah has been such a blessing to our family. She is the most lovely person I have ever met, a true angel who goes above and beyond. I highly recommend this place to anyone who wants a team who takes such great of children.

We having been going to Joyful Motion now for 2 years. 3 of my children receive therapy there. It has been a God-send to me and my kids. They truly care about your child and what they need to thrive. The ladies there are very professional and experts in their fields. I love how they incorporate play and games into therapy sessions. If your looking for OT, PT, or Speech for your child you won't regret choosing Joyful Motion!
Best Competition Farm in Horse Country
For the √∫ltimamente equestrian experience, go with confidence.
Best place to ride ever!
Best riding lessons
Spacious premises. Horseback riding lessons. Well-cared for horses. Responsibility.

We had a GREAT experience at JCAH!! I dropped by without our dogs just to ask a few questions about becoming new patients. The front desk staff was super friendly, greeted me as I walked in, answered my questions and shared the ways I could schedule a 1st appointment. Star was FANTASTIC with our pup, took her time since he was a tad protective of us, but she knew how to handle things and soon our old guy was wagging his tail with her (and the treats didn‚Äôt hurt!üòâ) We saw Dr Rod, he listened, asked questions about Tofu and his surgery and cancer diagnosis (this showed us he‚Äôd read the records we‚Äôd forwarded), heard our concerns and gave us his recommendations. Oh and he and Star both introduced themselves when they entered the room which we liked!
The clinic is not fancy but I‚Äôd rather have staff that care, a friendly and warm atmosphere and skilled doctors that want to work with us in caring for our pets than to have a fancy lobby. We‚Äôve scheduled our other dog‚Äôs appointment and look forward to building a relationship with this great clinic!! Highly Recommend!!

I have been going to Julington Creek Animal Hospital for over 2 years and absolutely love them. For the care my fur-babies receive, to their willingness to make sure we are comfortable and understand the care. Of course I have my preference of doctors and technicians, but they are all very component.

All of the vets at Julington Creek Animal Hospital provide top notch care for our animals.  I highly recommend them and refer all of my pet sitting clients to them. Compassionate, caring and skilled vets.  The techs are always kind and attentive to our animals, even when they can be difficult and resistant. Office staff is always friendly and knowledgeable.  If your pet needs boarding or daycare, the Animal Walk is your go to place! They are so kind and helpful and always meet you with a smile on their faces as they take your pet into their care.

The staff at Julington Creek Animal Hospital is the best! From the front desk to the vets, they show true care, kindness and professionalism toward my dogs and me! I highly recommend their vet services as well as their daycare and boarding.

My dog was sick and they made sure that he got in to be seen with 24 hours of a phone call. We were on the walk-in list but we only waited 30 minutes upon arrival and we were seen shortly after we got into the room.  He was diagnosed, treated, prescribed medication and out the door within an hour. The customer service is always wonderful, so friendly and efficient.

I took a long time to write this review and debated whether or not I even wanted to at the risk of sounding like "that mom."

I signed up two of my dogs for daycare and received absolutely no confirmation and no one contacted me to confirm or deny.
Eventually, I had to reach out for ANY information.
After confirming, I dropped my lab off (her name is Riley, about a year old).
Upon drop-off, I received zero information on what to expect, the potential of getting any update during the day, etc.
After work I went to pick her up and again had to ask for any sort of update. The person at the front desk told me there were no notes which means she probably did fine. At approximately midnight that night, we received an email stating that Riley was nervous at first but eventually by the afternoon she was playing having fun in the pool.
I took her back for a second time and again received no information. But I figured based on the first report card she would be fine.

About 3:00 p.m. that afternoon before we went to pick her up, we received a report card that Riley was brought into a yard and snapped at a dog who ran up to her and was immediately put back in a kennel.

Hence the "that mom" part of the review.
My dog absolutely snaps at dogs when she's correcting them. I have several foster puppies in and out of my house and she has told many of them to not rush at her face, bite her legs or her ears etc.
I oversee every single one of her interactions with other dogs I bring in my home and not once was there an inappropriate correction or an appropriate snap.

The employees at this business clearly have zero clue about dog behavior. Allowing any dog to bum rush a brand new, already noted as nervous dog, in a new environment is inappropriate on all levels.
I have been working with animals in and outside of daycare for about 10 years. My previous job was actually a manager for a daycare, where we did new dog introductions, often.
If any of my staff had allowed this sort of behavior, quite frankly, they probably would have been reprimanded for an inappropriate reaction. Dogs need to be allowed to correct other animals.
I know my dog, I know dog behavior. Not one time has she ever overly corrected a dog. To put her in a kennel for the remainder of the day was absolutely insane and we're actually pretty angry we paid for my dog to get zero exercise and zero interaction.

We have not returned since and we will not return again.

Everyone is so friendly. The reception area and the front looked very clean and well maintained.
The check in was super good and our boy was remembered by all staff despite not having him there since august of 2021 üòä
The staff were real nice and courteous! They all said good morning when walking by while we were checking in and they just seems to enjoy themselves with the pops!

I recently moved back to Jax after 10 years in Gainesville, and I was nervous about finding a new place for my one freaky dog‚Äîbut decided to give them a try based on long history with them; my family has used this place for my childhood dogs since their boarding resort first opened, and used their veterinary care for ~30 years.

Review: Their kennel techs are great. They actually read (and took seriously) the notes I left about my freaky dog, and they were happily accommodating; using my notes about my freaky dog, they sent out the smallest female tech they had working when he arrived, and as expected he handled it well so of course I felt better about it from the beginning. Upon leaving, a tech was able to get his harness on after his first stay because she read the notes about what body language freaks him out. (Years ago I had to get him early from a different resort because staff didn‚Äôt read my notes about him so, as warned, he freaked OUT). Will be using them from now on. A+ from me. Thanks much. (Also very reasonably priced especially compared to chain resorts)

We love this daycare and boarding, and our dog loves it even more.  The caregivers are great. We started out needing a puppy daycare, but we still drop our dog off 3 years later!  He gets all his energy out and has lots of friends- both dog and human.  We leave him here for boarding and get his grooming here too.  Great place we are lucky to have found!

My 8 month old Frenchie had a wonderful time when I boarded her the first time last weekend for four nights.
She  loved interacting with the other dogs as well as their amazing staff.
She was cleaned and looked beautiful and happy when I picked her up.
I will always take her there when she needs to be boarded.
I plan on taking her weekly for playtime for socialization.
Thank you to the amazing staff! ‚ù§Ô∏è
Mrs Erin is a true gem.

These are the best harness, period. Easy to fit, great customer service etc. But.. the US store is way behind. We had to get a family member back in the UK to purchase a Power Air lightweight harness that we could pick up when visiting home. Impossible to get here on the US. Impossible to ship from UK store to the US. UK store wouldn‚Äôt accept order without UK address for credit card. Julius K-9 you have a fab product but please get your international game together.

Fast shipping!  Great product, easy to buckle and material is very strong.  The handle is great for control. Got an extra large for my 70 lb girl, fits well but could‚Äôve done the large I think. Overall very satisfied.

I adopted Tammi from the Cape Coral Animal Shelter 3 years ago this month. She was 5 months old. I saw her picture online and fell in love with her.  The litter had been dumped in DeSoto county at 4 months old. She was the runt of the litter & bullied by the other puppies who denied her food and she got very sick and almost didn‚Äôt make it. She was petrified of everything, and I knew she needed patience and love.  At the time I had 2 dogs with cancer. I had gotten Tammi when one was diagnosed so the other would not be alone when he passed but sadly that one got an even more aggressive cancer and they both passed away within 6 months of each other leaving Tammi alone.  She had built a bond with both of them.  The first 6 months that I had her she was too scared to even come out from under my desk except when to be with the other dogs. I couldn‚Äôt walk her. I had to carry her to get her in the car. Forget going for a walk; she would shut down and shake (she even feared the front door). I had never seen a dog so traumatized before. I boarded her for 2 weeks with a trainer in LaBelle hoping she could pull Tammi out of this but with minimal success and she wouldn‚Äôt eat the whole time she was there so she was skin and bones when I got her home, I vowed never to do that to her again. While she was at the trainers, she met a Siberian husky named Gwen, also a rescue, looking for a home... they bonded instantly, and I ended up taking Gwen home with us also. I decided to take Gwen in for routine puppy training. She was 11 months old and I found K9 Enrichment Center on referral from my Vet (Islandside Animal Hospital). I read the testimonials on Facebook and thought I would check it out.  Gwen loved it and after a few months I asked if they might be able to help with Tammi, who was basically fine in her home environment, but when I took her out of it she would shut down and shake uncontrollably with her tail between her legs. It broke my heart to see her like this. I asked Ryan and Crystle if they thought they could help Tammi come out of her shell & get more confidence. They said you bet we can.  We have now worked together for about 5 months now and the change in Tammi is amazing. It is baby steps but every day I see her gain more and more confidence thanks to their gentle loving training.  We hit a big milestone just a week ago where she used the doggie door for the first time (with the flap held up) Ryan & Crystle are giving her what she needs, and she is braver and more confident thanks to them.  We go every other Wednesday for day training now (Gwen goes the other Wednesdays). Crystle has even been able to comfort Tammi when she gets her nails trimmed after the Vet said they wouldn‚Äôt do it anymore without sedation because she freaks out so badly. Crystle just holds her and whispers comforting words, and it goes quite well. I am amazed and so happy with Tammi‚Äôs progress thanks to K9 Enrichment Center. I honestly did not have much hope for her being able to go on regular walks without her freaking out when a car drives by or when a loud noise is near her, she use to shut down and shake uncontrollably.  We both have more confidence seeing the world, and we are so excited to have found such devoted people to help us through this journey. We look forward to our morning walks now every day . I can never thank them enough for what they have done for us and plan on being a part of their family for a long time.

My older dog has also been coming to trainings to work on his separation anxiety & to learn how to properly socialize with other dogs. This center has been a godsend - exactly what my dogs needed! I am so grateful to have found K-9 Enrichment Center! Thank you Ryan & Crystle for your amazing work!!

I am SO EXCITED! I was super-confused after the first training session with my aggressive dogs, but after the second training it is finally making sense to me.

Better yet, it seems to be making sense to my mischievous "Dynamic Duo", too.

The Pups aren't always bad, and mostly they are good. But a lot of times they get out of hand & have super aggressive (prey) instincts.

The only reason I do not have a 5-star rating is because I had to purchase the training tools on my own.

Granted, Adam sent me a bunch of links to purchase these products. But it would have been so much easier if these training tools had been included in the training package...even if they added another hundred dollars or so to the enrollment fee - which is much smaller than I thought it would be.

Why was the fee so low? Well, unlike other training services, K9 Advisors doesn't charge per dog. They only charge for the house visit, so you can get training for three or four dogs for the price of one. How cool is that?!!

We have two Rottweilers who are getting bigger and stronger for my husband and I to discipline especially on the leash when walking in our neighborhood. K9 Advisors provided us with a plethora of information because the training is not just for our dogs but for us as well. We‚Äôre in week two and we see great transformation happening. We have tried a few trainers in the past but Ruben from K9 Advisors is by far the best!

This is an update of my May 2025 review.

After my first two sessions, I felt very blessed at the positive behavioral changes in my beautiful, fun and happy (but seriously misbehaving) canines.

Now it is four months later, and everything Adam has taught me feels like a miracle!

The kiddos suddenly have manners. They sit politely at the door when they want to go out or come in.

Their prey drive is nearly suppressed. They are no longer lunging at the fence when the dog next door is outside - or when the lady down the street walks her dog - or when the cat in my neighbor's backyard is rolling around the grass.

They can walk on leash with near precision - and without fear. We trained one at a time. Now both of them can walk on my left-side, in tandem, without any distractions (and without tripping me up by moving from side to side).

Bath time is now a pleasure! I have never been able to reign these guys into a bath. But Adam showed me how to gently lure them into the process, and they loved every minute of it!

My dogs and I can FINALLY go on car rides together! That is something most of my previous dogs enjoyed, but not these two. No way! But Adam came to the rescue again. With just a little momentum and an UP, UP, UP command, they are both happy to go for a joy-ride these days.

Before engaging K9 Advisors, I was struggling. I had a lot simmering anger at the pet rescue lady who persuaded me to bring two sibling pups into my house without telling me that it is nearly impossible to train twin pups at the same time.

But DANG, those twins claimed my heart right from the start!

It has definitely been an adventure and a journey, but I think Adam has now given us the balance that I so desperately needed.

Thank you Adam & K9 Advisors

I have never written a Google review before today, but this one felt necessary. I cannot say enough good things about Reza and K9 Department‚Äôs board and train program. I highly recommend K9 department to any dog owner who is looking to do a board and train with a professional.

He has a gentle but authoritative approach. My dog loves him so much and listens perfectly to all his commands. We are still working on incorporating all of the training at home, but overall we're happy with her progress.

Laura is a great trainer the dogs all love her and she‚Äôs so kind to them. She trained by four dogs and Took  care for them For a couple weeks They were happy and loved her. Rex was one of her dogs and she gave him To meHe‚Äôs so well-behaved and so trained He never leaves my side when  we go and visit Laura it‚Äôs hard to get Him to leave he loves her so much he doesn‚Äôt Wanna go?

K9 Off Leash is the real deal. Their professionalism, attention to detail, and passion for what they do are unmatched. From day one, you can tell this team genuinely cares about delivering results and building trust. The trainers are knowledgeable, friendly, and completely dialed in... they make the process smooth, clear, and effective. It‚Äôs rare to find a company that lives up to the hype, but K9 Off Leash goes above and beyond.

Before finding K9 Off Leash Miami, we were convinced our 1.5-year-old Bernedoodle might be part dolphin. If there was a body of water‚Äîeven a mildly suspicious puddle‚Äîshe was in it. We‚Äôd spent thousands on in-home training trying to get her to heel, come when called, and most importantly, resist cannonballing into pools, oceans, lakes‚Ä¶you name it.

Enter Laura and her team.

After four weeks in the board and train program, our Piper came home with her same sweet, quirky personality, but now she actually listens (the E-Collar is essential to reinforcing the training). Like, really listens. I can walk her calmly at heel without her trying to tackle every lizard, squirrel, or rogue leaf in her path. She comes when called (even with distractions!), and best of all, she can chill by the pool with the kids swimming, and not treat it like her personal splash zone.

Laura and her trainers clearly love what they do, and it shows. We were super nervous when Piper left for the program (missed her so much) and of course, cautious based on past in home fails, but we are beyond impressed with the results and so grateful to finally feel like we‚Äôre in sync with our dog. Highly recommend‚Äîunless you‚Äôre really into wet paw prints on your furniture or a dog that will chase a squirrel into ongoing traffic. üòâ

Cannot recommend K9 Off Leash enough! They did such a fantastic job with my 84lb Newfoundland. Since I‚Äôve picked my dog up from a 4 week board and train, I‚Äôve been able to walk everywhere off leash and take her out in public without any anxiety. My dog seemed extremely happy during every visit and K9 Off Leash sent daily updates, which gave me peace of mind.

What can I say, we got our service dog from here and he‚Äôs the best boy ever. The facility is great, their program is amazing, and all the staff are kind, skilled, and compassionate. They offer full service training for veterans as well as continued mental health services. If you are a veteran in need of a service dog, go here.

On Memorial Day of 2022 my Service Dog Guapo of 13 yrs Passed away. I had already been in contact with K9P4P who assisted me in pairing me with a dog and Ruff Rescue donated to me this dog nobody wanted I name him Maldo and K9P4P is in the process of helping this rescue dog soon graduate so he can continue where my last Service Guapo left off. I could not have found a better organization for helping Veterans. Mary and her staff are outstanding they are the best.

I qualified for a service dog
I wanted to see if my Mini Portidoodle would qualify for service dog training
They tested him without me and with me
He PASSED!!!!
I found them to be very thorough and understanding
They were veteran or married to veterans
I had never been surrounded by veterans since my medical retirement
I have struggled with severe depression and anxiety
I feel the first time in over 15 years I have HOPE
Caring & focused on helping veterans to obtain and train service dogs.

Awesome! Was matched with a dog in October and are anxiously awaiting training. The staff is incredible and knowledgeable. Rated on the top of training facilities, they are a godsend for veterans with disabilities. We are pleased and excited to have found this non profit.

Chris is an incredible dog trainer!
We couldn‚Äôt be more grateful for Chris and everything he‚Äôs done for our dog Loki. We signed up for 18 sessions with him, and the difference in our dog has been unbelievable. Before training, our dog was food aggressive, barked excessively at anything and anyone, pulled on the leash, and pretty much did whatever he wanted. From the very first session, we started seeing real changes. Now he‚Äôs calm, well-behaved, walks perfectly on heel, and has learned how to socialize properly with dogs and humans.
Chris is incredibly knowledgeable and straightforward, which we really appreciated.
He didn‚Äôt just train our dog ‚Äî he trained us too. He communicated clearly, corrected us when needed (which was super helpful), and always made sure we were part of the process. His approach is firm, honest, and extremely effective. Also even though Chris corrected our dog a lot during training, our dog LOVED him, which says a lot about the kind of trainer he is.
We‚Äôre beyond grateful and couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better trainer. Highly recommend Chris to anyone looking for real, lasting change with their dog!

Chris is hands down the best trainer. I‚Äôm so grateful we were introduced to him. I am generally skeptical of most things and Chris wow-ed me with his kindness, education, knowledge, and PATIENCE. He trained us really well in order to train our sweet Patty Girl. He knows his stuff and is truly an animal and human whisperer. We have a very happy well developed 7 month old golden retriever and we wouldn‚Äôt have been here without Chris‚Äôs guidance and structure. Even more amazing was the bond that we deepened with Patty through training. We are so happy with the outcome and will recommend Chris to anyone who is seeking a superior trainer. Thank you Chris and K9 Solutions!

Chris is amazing!!  I needed trained more than my dog and Chris was very patient and extremely kind to me and my dog!  He boosted my confidence and trained my dog the highest level of obedience!  Chris adapted the service training to best meet my needs with my limitations!  If you want the best trainer go with Chris!  We trained with 2 other trainers and it wasn't a good fit, Chris was exactly what I and my dog needed!  His group classes are amazing the way he handles all different dogs with different needs is amazing!  My dog LOVED Chris and going to the training classes!  Thank you Chris!!  üíõ

My son and I are very thankful to Christopher. He helped us with our German Shepherd She-Ra who was very reactive. Car rides and walks at the park were almost impossible. She-Ra would lunge and bark constantly at people and cars (honestly just about anything) it was difficult. Thankfully we found Christopher who changed all of that. With his expertise we are now able to enjoy car rides and walks at the park. She-Ra even went to the mall and other places where there is a lot of people and she did good. I never thought we would be able to take her anywhere. Christopher not only trained She-Ra but also trained my son and I. We are all so happy, you could really see the difference in She-Ra. It was a great journey with our teacher‚ò∫Ô∏è Mr. Christopher. I couldn‚Äôt thank him enough for everything he showed us. I highly recommend Christopher!

Thank you so much Chris!

Chris trained our 11 year old little Shihtzu mix. You can teach an old dog new tricks. She went from highly dog reactive to calm and steady. She went from frantic on flights to calmly sleeping through a 9 hour flight recently. Her life has changed for the better and so has ours. Highly recommend Chris.

provider_name: K9 Spa Dog Training & Dog Boarding
review_text:
5-Star Review for K9 Spa Dog Trainers and Boarders

K9 Spa has been an absolute game changer for our dog, Cato and our family. From the moment we walked through the door, we felt the warmth and genuine love they have for every dog they care for. Their team doesn‚Äôt just train‚Äîthey connect. They took the time to understand our dog‚Äôs unique personality, quirks, and needs, and adjusted their approach with empathy and patience.

What truly sets K9 Spa apart is their personalized focus. Our dog wasn‚Äôt treated like just another client‚Äîthey recognized her emotional needs, responded to her behavior with care, and used positive reinforcement to build trust. The commands were taught in a structured yet compassionate way, and we were kept updated on her progress with thoughtful insights into what was working and why.

The team at K9 Spa goes beyond basic training‚Äîthey genuinely care. It‚Äôs clear they treat every dog as if she were their own, giving her attention, love, and tailored guidance. Our dog came home more confident, calm, and well-behaved‚Äîand we felt more empowered as owners, too.

If you‚Äôre looking for a place where your dog will be seen, understood, and cared for with heart, K9 Spa is it. Highly recommend.

provider_name: K9 Spa Dog Training & Dog Boarding
review_text:
I have been using K9 for the past 10 years for the grooming of my golden doodle. They not only did a great job with the grooming, but also showed love and affection for my Dog Max. When we got a new puppy several months ago we elected to use K9 because of the manner in which they treated Max. We signed up for the 2week course.During that time they kept us informed of Remys , our new puppy‚Äôs, progress with pictures and videos.    At the end of the training Remy seemed to have learned his lessons well. However after several weeks at home his old habits of biting and jumping returned.  We called Pam And Mike and told them of our problems . After trying to fix the bad behavior by phone with us they agreed to take Remy back for some additional training and guidance.  They were not required to do this but nevertheless they did do it.  When Remy was done with his his remedial lessons they brought him back to my home and spent a great deal of time Retraining both my wife and myself.  So far I am cautiously optimistic that the problems have been resolved .
Without question I am so pleased with their service and skills that I fully recommend  K9 to anyone who is looking for a caring dog trainer.

provider_name: K9 Spa Dog Training & Dog Boarding
review_text: The 2 yr old twin cavachons love K9 Spa dog boarding. When Michael comes to pick them up, they are so excited to jump into the back of his car because they know they are truly going on a resort vacation where they can run freely in their protected backyard. Michael‚Äôs wife Pamela is so wonderful and you know the pups are being cared for by a smart and diligent dog mom who looks after our pups as well as we do. Can‚Äôt say enough good things!

provider_name: K9 Spa Dog Training & Dog Boarding
review_text: Pamela and Michael are phenomenal, dog trainers, and caregivers and caretakers of our dogs! I don‚Äôt trust anyone with our dogs except them. It‚Äôs so convenient that they pick up and drop off for any number of days we need, after our original two week training camp. FYI, the two week training camp when our dogs were puppies was a lifesaver and life changer. I would not go anywhere else! Many thanks to Pamela and Michael for making the process, smooth and easy ‚Äì in addition to wonderful care and it‚Äôs a beautiful environment for our dogs. I would give them 100 stars!

provider_name: K9 Spa Dog Training & Dog Boarding
review_text: I have been using K9 for boarding for 8 months and they are the best! Finley is always so happy when I drop him off. I get updates while I am away on business trips on what he is doing and videos of him playing. I would highly recommend.

I cannot say enough good things about this company! They helped my young service dog in training, who was struggling with a lot of anxiety, and the difference has been incredible. The trainers were patient, knowledgeable, and truly cared about my dog. They took the time to explain each step, gave me practical tools I could use at home, and made sure we never felt rushed.

My dog is now so much more confident, focused, and relaxed in situations that used to overwhelm her. It‚Äôs such a relief to see her progress, and I feel much more supported on this journey. I would absolutely recommend them to anyone looking for humane and effective training, especially for dogs who need a little extra understanding. They are very passionate about what they do and take the time to personalize the experience for each dog and owner.
They also gifted me a harness and some other training tools at no extra cost, thanks again!!

We trusted Vit with our 11 month old Great Dane. She's our Baby and as hard as it was to leave her, it was so worth it in the end. She left a mischievous teenage dog with no major issues but a lack of consistent listening. She came home after 30 days behaving like an adult dog with impulse control. We're not done with our training but very happy with her progress. Vit was available to me any time to check on my girl. I would recommend him to anyone!

Vit and Kloe are just awesome. Vit and Kat trained our Chachi in 2020 and Chachi goes to daycare now. We are family. They take such great care of Chachi. I tell my friends that Vit is the Dog Psychologist extraordinaire. He makes it so easy to use his teachings. Even for the kids. Hands down He is the best. Talked to 2 other trainers in the past and listening to them was like üòµ‚Äçüí´ Vit is the expert. Period

Katherine and Vit are exceptional at K-9 Training Center. They trained my dog Vito to be a well-behaved attentive boy. During his training they took very good care of him with a very kind and professional approach . Vito is like family now with them. He occasionally goes back for refresher training and he is always so happy to see his friends. Their techniques are highly effective and efficient in a very humane manner. I highly recommend anyone to have their dog trained by K-9 Training Center.

Vit is a true hidden gem in Jacksonville! We feel very lucky and grateful to have found his training program
From the first meeting to when we picked up our little pup, we could tell he loved dogs and even had his own relationship with each dog with him.
Our rescue puppy learned how to listen and some impulse control, we're getting to spend time and build our relationship with him instead of fighting to get him quit eating everything in sight or jumping on top of the counters or all over the place in general.
We're still continuing training and reinforcing what he's learned at home, but it's been amazing to have our same sweet boy back but getting to really spend time with him.
Vit did an amazing job and is very supportive, even after he's back home

A friend recommended Niketa for our two dogs Moose and Mabel. Mabel is 1.5 and Moose is 2.5 and we thought it would be too late to get them trained. Niketa was so reassuring that it‚Äôs never too late. That couldn‚Äôt be more true, in just under two months we‚Äôve seen a tremendous change in both of our dogs. Our girl is super fearful of a lot of things and we‚Äôve seen her confidence build since starting with Niketa. Our boy has learned so so much, he‚Äôs a completely different dog on the leash now and we‚Äôve learned how to manage his anxiety and defiance. Niketa has been awesome, we cannot recommend her expertise enough. She is always a text away with any questions or concerns we‚Äôve had and ours dogs love to see her on training days.

We adopted Cassie from the Humane Society at 3-months old and she was a very nervous, insecure dog. She was afraid of the leash, wouldn‚Äôt go outside, was terrified of noise and any vehicle. I was ready to give up. It seemed impossible especially living in downtown Fort Lauderdale. I contacted Niketa and she came the next day. She took the time to explain puppy development and the necessity to work through her fears. Niketa explains why we are doing a training exercise, demonstrates it and then has you perform the exercise. Needless to say, Cassie is a confident and well trained puppy now! She knows all her basic commands and we have graduated to controlled environments off-lease training. She has surpassed all expectations and it is a joy to have a confident and well-trained puppy. I highly recommend Niketa for your dog training needs!

When I had my first consult with Niketa, I told her that Mandy was my first boxer puppy and that I needed help with typical puppy behavior as well as to teach commands for her safety that would last a lifetime. Niketa understands the challenges of the boxer breed and we went right to work. From the get-go, training progressed extremely well. She was there for me at all hours providing me with quick answers to my questions.
I trust Niketa's direction and training technique because I see results. She also praises the boxer dad as well!

Fantastic board and train experiences with Niketa at K954 Dog Training. Niketa has boarded and trained our pups, Nikki and Iggy quite extensively as rescue puppies separately and now integrating together. She also routinely boards besides. I can‚Äôt say enough about her knowledge and sensitivity as a trainer; she develops her plans according to each pup‚Äôs personality and owner‚Äôs goals and she‚Äôs very effective. Best part is that our dogs love her and enjoy training with her - she makes it fun for them. She has trained our‚Äôs in nosework, muzzle training, and socialization which is huge for our Jack Russell, Iggy, as he matures to develop better impulse control and social skills. She excels with behavior modification strategies to achieve a more balanced dog and as a former vet tech, she picks up on potential medical issues which might contribute to leas than optimal behavior. If you want results, call Niketa at K954 dog training -
You‚Äôll be very happy you did!!

After reaching out to multiple dog trainers we knew right away that Niketa would be the best fit for our anxious dog Maggie.

Niketa doesn't use the same methods for every dog, she takes the time to learn about your dog and to see how and why things effect their behavior and then creates a training plan based on these factors.

In only a couple of months we have seen such an improvement in Maggie's confidence and with her anxiety. Niketa really puts her heart into her work and we highly recommend her!

K9W is the real deal. Look no further and trust Andrea with your pup of any size, any age, any issue needing correcting.
Want on-leash manners? You got it. Want off-leash freedom and recall that you can count on? You got it. Want manners in the house? You got it.
We‚Äôve been working with Andrea and our K9W pack since 2023 with our small pup. Andrea made us love being a dog owner again after months of frustration surrounding pulling leash while walking him, poor manners, jumping, and crate anxiety. He became a completely different dog, and our relationship with him became so much stronger. We loved K9W and swore by Andrea‚Äôs training so much that we adopted a GSD she was fostering & training.
Both of my dogs are well mannered, obedient to boundaries, and excellent family members ALL THANKS TO K9W. We have an infant now, and my baby‚Äôs safety around my dogs is never a concern due to the training they have received and the guidance Andrea has given me to properly reinforce their good behavior. We get compliments on our dogs ALL THE TIME, they make us so proud to be their owners/parents.
All of this to say‚Äî put your faith in Andrea, she is incredible and you will not be disappointed in the results ‚ù§Ô∏èüôåüèº

My senior dog Baloo was highly reactive to even seeing other dogs on walks, it was not enjoyable to take him. My daughter started dating a mman with a service dig that Baloo had to be around. Training with K9W for both us humans and Baloo turned out really well. Baloo can now walk be other dogs and joined in an event at K9W Training Center, lives in the house with the service dog and even accepted a young high energy dog in our house while I was dog sitting. Thank you Andrea and K9W you made all our lives better!

Andrea is amazing and so knowledgeable! Her programs work and her facility is lovely. She has taken our anxious, insecure Chihuahua puppy and transformed him into a confident and social dog! She works hands on with the entire family and with your schedule. We used the board training and training in the home environment and it only took a few days to notice a huge difference in Diesel! Thank you Andrea!

My dog spent 3 wks w Andrea, and when I got home my dog felt much easier to manage. Sh√©s very smart, I just didn‚Äôt know how to teach her what I needed from her. Less barking, pulling, and needy behavior. Much improved, very happy, will continue w K9W in the future

Having five Pomeranians can definitely be a lot! Andrea took the time to truly understand both my dogs‚Äô needs and my concerns. Her approach was patient, clear, and incredibly effective.

She didn‚Äôt just train my dogs‚Äîshe taught me how to be a better leader and communicator. For the first time in two years, I was able to step outside without Marbles barking. That alone felt like a miracle.

I‚Äôm so grateful for Andrea‚Äôs guidance and highly recommend her to anyone feeling overwhelmed. She genuinely changed our lives for the better!

K9‚Äôs Place is the absolute best!! My dog, Billie, recently did their board and train program and is a brand new dog! Their training has helped both me and my pup feel safe in public, around other dogs, and at home. Billie listens to commands and is so much more calm and confident in herself, and in me, when we encounter new people or animals. I am so proud of her and happy with the board and train program.

Both my dogs have boarded at K9‚Äôs Place over the past 3 years and absolutely love it. They are so excited whenever we pull into the parking lot! Between their amazing and knowledgeable staff and owners, who are so supportive and helpful, and fantastic services that the dogs adore, K9‚Äôs Place is the only place for my dogs! We love K9 Place! We did the pack walk a few times and realized our pup needed training to live a happier life.  I am happy we decided to do the board and training.  He came back a new dog. We struggled with reactivity and now we can walk peacefully without hiding behind cars or walking the opposite direction when we see another dog.  Thank you so much to all the staff at K9 Place. My Doberman Puppy, Silas loves K-9s Place. He went at 12 weeks old for a 2 week board and train and learned such a solid base to build from. We love it!!!

When we had our first Meet & Great, it felt immediately good. The staff is very friendly, professional and they have a great knowledge of dogs. They are flexible and understanding and there is always a spot for her overnight.
Everytime it is hard for me leaving ‚Äòmy baby‚Äô when we fly to the Netherlands (where we come from) and when we drop Kyk (our German Shepherd) off, I am able to leave her with confidence, knowing that she have a wonderful time and can play with her furry friends.

They take good care of her, now it feels like a second home ‚ô•

I‚Äôm so glad I chose K9‚Äôs Place for my puppy, Bluey! Brendan has been incredible during their one on one sessions his calm, knowledgeable approach has helped Bluey make real progress. You can tell he genuinely cares and knows how to bring out the best in each pup.

K9‚Äôs Place also offers a fantastic puppy socialization program called PALS, which I highly recommend. It‚Äôs been a great way for Bluey to build confidence and interact with other dogs in a safe, supportive setting.

Overall, I couldn‚Äôt be happier with our experience. If you‚Äôre looking for expert guidance and a nurturing environment for your puppy, K9‚Äôs Place is the way to go!

I cannot recommend Jenna Shively enough! From the very first session, her down-to-earth and compassionate nature put me at ease. She has a remarkable ability to listen deeply and make you feel truly understood, without judgment. Her expertise is evident in the way she offers insightful guidance, blending professional knowledge with genuine care.

What sets her apart is how gracefully she incorporates faith-based values into therapy, creating a space where spiritual growth and emotional healing go hand in hand. Whether navigating challenges or celebrating breakthroughs, she walks alongside you with wisdom and kindness.

Jenna is more than a therapist‚Äîshe‚Äôs a trusted guide who helps you find clarity, strength, and peace. Grateful to have her support on this journey!

Working with Jenna has been truly life-changing. She is incredibly kind, compassionate and insightful, always creating a space where I feel heard and supported. Her guidance has helped me navigate some of the most difficult periods of my life and I am so grateful for her presence during those times. If you are looking for a therapist who will genuinely inspire growth and empower you to become the best version of yourself, I wholeheartedly recommend Jenna!

Highly recommend the services offered.

Working with Jenna has been truly transformative for our relationship. She created a safe, supportive space where both of us felt heard, validated, and genuinely understood. Through her guidance, we learned how to communicate more openly and effectively, shift our perspectives, and develop foundational tools that continue to strengthen our relationship to this day.

Her insight, empathy, and practical approach not only helped us navigate challenges, but also empowered us to grow together in ways we hadn‚Äôt imagined. We are so grateful for her impact on our lives and can confidently say that her work has made a lasting difference in our relationship. Highly recommend!

Jenna is an incredible therapist who has truly made a difference in my life. She supported me through one of the most difficult times‚Äîmy separation‚Äîand continued to guide me as I worked through other personal challenges. Her compassion, insight, and professionalism are unmatched. Jenna creates a safe, nonjudgmental space where it‚Äôs easy to open up and do the hard work of healing and growth. review_text: Friendly staff. Physicians are wonderful and took excellent care of our grandson. Everything was explained to us thoroughly. We would definitely recommend this practive.
