We were taking him to another therapy center before going to Libre and we truly believe if we kept going there our son would still be going to therapy to this day. Lily started seeing our son at around 4 months and at 6 months our pediatrician cleared him and he didn't need any more therapy. Lily was patient with our son and everyone always tried to cheer him up when he started crying during the session. Absolutely wonderful people.

provider_name: Life Care Center of Palm Bay
review_text: Nursing and staff are extremely helpful and dedicated. They always answer my questions and take time to explain next steps and alternatives. They do so many ‚Äúbehind the scene‚Äù things to make our loved  ones comfortable. It is a difficult job and I want to say thank you so much!

provider_name: Life Care Center of Palm Bay
review_text:
it's the first place in iBrevard County that feels like they take pride in the appearance and cleanliness of the the entire place, it's tastefully decorated  and most staff are very respectful residents and visitors .They have an Ice Crem Parlor and a nice restaurant.
I feel this place is going to be a nice home for my Father .
Thank you for caring .‚ù§Ô∏è

provider_name: Life Care Center of Palm Bay
review_text: To be clear, I did not have a loved one placed here. We were in immediate need and there was no availability at the moment, which I understand completely. Barbara gave me a tour and I met several staff members. The facility is beautiful! The staff is very, very friendly.  Everyone I interacted with expressed how much they like working there and they clearly take a lot of pride in the facility.   I was really hoping that I could get my mother in there, but she needed to move quickly, so we had to go with another facility, which isn‚Äôt nearly as nice.  Based on my limited experience, I would highly recommend Life Care Center of Palm Bay.

provider_name: Life Care Center of Palm Bay
review_text: Our tour with Barb was fantastic! She took the time to personally walk us around the entire facility. All the staff were smiling, very kind, and welcoming. Dining room, gym, rehab area all super clean and well kept. We can‚Äôt say enough wonderful things about Life Care Center of Palm Bay. I‚Äôm sure my 92 year old father will be happy and feel safe during his stay. Thanks again Barb.

provider_name: Life Care Center of Palm Bay
review_text: Spent a couple hours today with my Mom at Life Care. We were able to enjoy free ice cream and a wonderful time with Mom outside in their beautiful courtyard. It felt good to get her outdoors! Also appreciate the sweet nurses and care she gets here!! So very thankful for wonderful servant hearts and the care of these special nurses!!

provider_name: Life Care Center of Port St. Lucie
review_text: Very clean and well maintained.  Cute decorations for fall.  People were friendly.  Our friend had good care and was comfortable.  Fresh cold water near his bed within reach.  We‚Äôre glad he‚Äôs in a good facility.

provider_name: Life Care Center of Port St. Lucie
review_text: Everyone has been very patient in taking care of Bill Duffy. They‚Äôre doing a good job, keeping him clean and feeding him, which was one of the most important things for me when deciding which nursing home to bring him to. In order to recover from his injury. The facility is bright and it‚Äôs clean, which I think adds to a positive mental state of the patient.. And I‚Äôm happy to see that he has side bars on his bed.

provider_name: Life Care Center of Port St. Lucie
review_text: I only pay the bills for a resident, I am not a family member. But my impression of staff is very good. Especially Gina Urbina the Business Office Manager. She explained in detail what was needed. Extremely patient, with a family member who did not understand what documented information was needed. So far a very good impression of this facility.

provider_name: Life Care Center of Port St. Lucie
review_text: From the outside to the inside the facility it's beautiful, I have worked in elderly care for years and the moment you step through the doors you smell all kind of unpleasant smells,  that was not the case with Life Center of Port St. Lucie. It smelled and looked clean and the warm welcome front the front staff was wonderful.  The CNA's we encountered in the hallways gave us a welcoming 'hello'. I will definitely be talking about Life Center we my friends when I get back home.

provider_name: Life Care Center of Port St. Lucie
review_text: My wife was a patient at Life Care Center after an auto accident. She had never been in a Skilled Nursing Facility as a patient, but had been in them with her parents in their later years. We‚Äôve been very impressed with the staff and their professionalism, courtesy and willingness to help. The food is better than we would have expected. The facility is very beautiful and serene, and provides a lovely atmosphere for healing and recovery. From our own personal experience, we highly recommend this facility.

provider_name: Life Care Center of Winter Haven
review_text: A group of three ladies went to visit our friend today. It was a lovely experience. We took her to get ice cream and to get her nails done. Unfortunately we didn‚Äôt wait to get her nails done because she was number 13 and after waiting quite some time they were only on #5. I think they really do need more nail techs. Overall it was very enjoyable for us and the client

provider_name: Life Care Center of Winter Haven
review_text:
There are plenty of things I could list about this amazing place..

Hello! My name is Tracy Kreider. I am Anita Morrisons daughter.
I call almost daily and until my own health issues arose,  I visited my Mom every 8-10 weeks there in Florida- coming from Michigan..... I stayed at the house, multiple hospital visits and another facility before she was placed there a little over a year ago.
That was our dream to get her into that particular facility!!

It was the biggest biggest blessing that my mom was able to secure a bed there!!

I have beautiful memories of me and my Mom together thru my life and I've made some fabulous memories in the two years prior to her arriving at Life Care..

I am so thankful that Don is  there every single day and lets me talk to her on the phone and often we do video..

I have asked for everyone who was involved in my mother's care because I personally wanted to extend a heartfelt.
I have met or spokento a few of you..

I want to  Thank you, and write to each and every one of you as I thought I was going to be meeting everyone this week and this weekend.. however, I fell even more sick and lost my voice,  and have bronchitis...and I'm unable to be there and attend the auction and celebrate the day with everyone..especially Don, he was excited to go together.

The job that's done by each of you  is one that's so underappreciated, and one that most people don't understand all of what's involved every single day...

I would normally get there at 9 o'clock in the morning and stay there until 9 or 10 o'clock at night until I put my mom to bed.
I met so many of the different people along the way, and I loved all the memories that I made with my Mom..
I would do her hair and her nails. Give her a massage and then we would do different crafts together. I have long and yearned for all of that

So I wanted to take a moment to thank each and every one of you for all that you do for her and the good times and bad, because I certainly know that there are some bad bad times but that was never a person that I knew in my almost fifty seven years of life...

My mom was a funny Witty, smart, talented woman, and my gosh, was she ever beautiful Classy and stylish!!

These photos are of the last times she was at her  home and me taking her  to the mall and to see Santa and go to the makeup counter,going to boktower where she was a docent there.. .. then her first faculty where I would walk with her everyday.. and do crafts.. she's changed a lot in just a two years.. the ones in the winterhaven was where I spent the most time aftershe was placed before she went home briefly.

Please enjoy these..
And thank you. Thank youthank you

Stephanie week daytime

Miki- weekend

Kia daytime head

Micheal evening week

Janelle- weekend head nurse just promoted and moved to hospice.. thank you for all you've done.. Don loves you and we thank you

All weekend nurses

First, doing a job that is Very under appreciated, most days are very harsh because it's in memory care, exhausting hours and so MUCH that's required.

The care, attention, sweetness, communication and so much more  .....you can dream about having people who day after day after day after day for weeks,months and years on end... POOOOUR OUT THEIR ENERGY into total strangers...

That..THAT THAT TAKES A VERY SPECIAL people...

Back several months ago TWO hurricanes back to back in Florida where Nafeesa, no longer there and her team hunkered down on the mattress on the floors to stay throughout the storm..

That's sheer dedication!!!!

Thank you so much!!

I cannot cannot cannot be MORE THANKFUL.

provider_name: Life Care Center of Winter Haven
review_text: We had a wonderful experience at Life Care Center of Winter Haven. My brother-in-law was treated with great care and respect. The Administrator, Sarah, and the Director of Nursing, Jenna, were both highly professional and clearly passionate about the well-being of the residents. The facility was very clean, and the food was generally quite good. A special thank you to Zoe, the wound care nurse‚Äîher kindness, attentiveness, and willingness to go the extra mile made a lasting impression on our family. I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to recommend this facility to anyone in need of skilled nursing care. Thank you to the entire staff for your hard work and compassion.

provider_name: Life Care Center of Winter Haven
review_text: I have a mixed review. The staff is nice. The beds have a prison mattress on it. It is so thin I wouldn‚Äôt want my dog to sleep on it. My mother developed sores. They finally got her a blow up mattress but she can‚Äôt move herself very well and needs repositioning. This seems to be an afterthought for them. The beds have rust on them which is not safe if anyone scrapes against them. The rooms need a makeover with new beds. It is better for someone who can get around some.

provider_name: Life Care Center of Winter Haven
review_text: I went to visit someone from my church ?Im a Pastor) and she wasn‚Äôt in her room.  But, the nurse (Alycia or Alyssa - can‚Äôt remember) walked me across campus to the salon, and then checked with the resident to see if it was okay for me to come in.  Crissy the Hairdresser was very kind as well - stopping her work and stepping out to give me time to talk.  I was impressed with the kindness of staff and the cleanliness of the facility.  It was a great visit!

provider_name: Life In Motion Physical & Hand Therapy
review_text: I've worked with Life in Motion for 3 years for PT with both hip replacements, and I have thoroughly enjoyed working with the staff there. Both Carlos and Josh are very knowledgeable therapists, but I've mostly worked with Josh. I was always impressed with his explanations of the working of the body, and what to do to fix or relieve an issue. I was able to make great progress. I was also impressed with the tech helpers - good attitudes and always willing to help. It was a fun group to be a part of, made the hardness of therapy more pleasant. I would highly recommend Life in Motion.

provider_name: Life In Motion Physical & Hand Therapy
review_text: The physical therapists and staff here are amazing! They worked with my college figure-skater daughter while she was home for the summer, recovering from ankle surgery. Josh and Carlos (PTs) are very personable, knowledgeable, and motivating. They made each visit enjoyable (even though my daughter had to work hard!) and the progress she made was remarkable. They are also great about communicating and scheduling visits. I highly recommend this PT clinic!

provider_name: Life In Motion Physical & Hand Therapy
review_text: Great staff and Dr.Reilly DPT is awesome and very knowledgeable and helpful, he knows his stuff. I recommend Life in Motion physical therapy!

provider_name: Life In Motion Physical & Hand Therapy
review_text: I‚Äôve been to a couple of other PT centers and found that Life in Motion offers not only highly qualified therapists but presents a great environment for their patients and employees. I actually look forward to coming to therapy because I know I will have a great work out on my issue.  Life in motion treats their patients like family and that is very important to me.

provider_name: Life In Motion Physical & Hand Therapy
review_text: Super people who really care. My mother had an elbow replacement and these guys took excellent care of her. The therapy was excellent and her doctor was impressed at her improvement and range of motion. They would go above and beyond and they treat you like a person they care about. Great atmosphere, great people. Very highly recommended. Thank you all, I really appreciate everything that you did.

My physical therapist James was so great. He was able to come to the house to give me my physical therapy. He introduced several different exercises for me to do for my back, and helped me to do them correctly.  He never rushed me, and always asked me if I had any questions before he would leave, and that meant so much to me . James was always available for phone calls if I needed to ask questions or had an issue with one of the exercises. I would advise anyone to go to Life Care for their Physical therapy, my back feels so much better after having gone through the PT.

Caroline

With a serious back problem, I felt I needed therapy in an outpatient facility, rather than at home.  I was not disappointed.  The facility is well appointed, and all equipment is kept in great woking condition.  Close parking is readily available. As great as the campus is, the real selling point is  my therapist, James..  Treatment was one on one, and specifically designed for me.  On my bad days we switched to exercises I could manage to do.  On my good days, he pushed me to do more. Responsibly, we wore our masks during sessions, and James cleaned everything I touched as we went along.   It turned out to be a useful protocol.  As far as i could tell, James is one on one with each of his clients.  He is full of good will and genuinely interested in his clients. I would recommend him (and his Life Care facility) without hesitation

The staff at LifeCare always greeted my Mom with a smile.
Our Physical Therapist, James,  is awesome. He was beyond patient with my Mom, challenged her in a positive way and has a great sense of humor!
We were discharged today from his work... although Mom‚Äôs strength and balance much much better he will be missed. Thank you!!üòä

Thank you LifeCare!! James, the physical therapist, is wonderful!! He works so well with my sister-in-law who is intellectually challenged and having a lot of difficulty walking. He takes notice of what interests her, such as Disney and Nascar, and incorporates them into her therapy thus motivating her to try her best. We've seen great improvement. I would highly recommend James and LifeCare if you're looking for a clean facility and thoughtful, as well as helpful, staff.

I suffered a right shoulder dislocation and had to do physical rehab here at Lifecare and working with James. 4 weeks going forward he has guided me to make great progress in the recovery process which was really needed seeing how I am in the Army reserves and needed to get back to the point of working out. James has been nothing but amazing in the recovery process. I couldn't recommend him and lifecare enough. You are definitely in good hands here.

Lifeskills ABA therapy is a phenomenal place to start your journey with. My child received exceptional treatment and care. The staff is so flexible, supportive, understanding, professional and caring. I would recommend them at all cost.

This ABA clinic is exceptional . The atmosphere was very welcoming and the therapist displayed exceptional skills, dedication and professionalism . If you want to see positive changes in your children I recommend this clinic because all RBTs are very professional.

There is so much I would love to express about Life Skills. I want to start out by saying that Life Skills has been the biggest blessing my family and I have received. My son started at Life Skills as a ‚Äúnon- verbal‚Äù child in the spectrum. My son has achieved so many goals since he‚Äôs been coming to this office. Not only has his behavior changed for the better, he‚Äôs been more independent, he say so many words, expresses his feelings, plays and shares with other children, interacts well with other, is now learning to say full sentences and most importantly he is such a happy child. Everyone can see his genuine smile and sees how happy he is when he gets to the office and when I pick him up. Everyone is the office from front desk to the RBTs are all wonderful. Maria has changed our lives permanently. She has made a big impact in my son‚Äôs life and I am forever so thankful to have her as my son‚Äôs therapist. She is so loving and so caring, she is like a second mother to my son and I can‚Äôt ask for anything better than that. Along with Genesis who‚Äôs always been part of my son‚Äôs journey. She is such a good time and I love that she teaches him new dances and makes him feel confident. Dayanara and Alda are amazing as well. They are are always responding on time, are always available to speak to, very attentive with everything, and makes me feel so welcomed. The process was very easy when applying for services and in a timely manner. Honestly I couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better place to take my son. They most definitely changed our lives for the better. As a mom, I love seeing my son be himself and seeing him the happiest kid ever makes me proud. Thank you Life Skills for all that you do. We truly love every single person there. They have became family ‚ù§Ô∏è
The ladies at the corny provide amazing customer service. My little has been here for some time and seen improvements within the first month.
the best place my son could be! Loving everything about this clinic, Jasmine is a wonderful person who teaches my son with lots of love.

My son has seen many therapists that claim to specialize in sensory needs‚Ä¶This place is the real deal. Experienced, educated therapists who really listen to you. Just this past year my son learned how to drink from a cup and a straw, sit for longer periods of time and focus‚Ä¶ I saw him paint with a brush independently (which amazed me) and has learned some self-regulating techniques that have helped calm him especially with transitioning from preferred activities. All because they take a foundational approach to sensory integration that is so impactful. Our Occupational Therapist, Adam is phenomenal, we are so very grateful he is helping our little boy! And our son never wants to leave‚Ä¶he is having too much fun.  Carmen in the front office is extremely considerate and caring. And Elleri wrote up the most detailed and purposeful initial assessment that we have ever seen. If you‚Äôre on the fence if they can help‚Ä¶they absolutely can. Give them a call.

Really amazing place to help with children dealing with Sensory Processing issues. Staff are extremely friendly, helpful, and caring. They explain what your child is going through and show you the steps to help your child cope with it. Highly recommend if you have a child with SPD.

What a truly horrible experience. My child had ‚Äúsensory‚Äù testing done at Lifeskills. The report my husband and I received was awful. There were medical mistakes, grammar mistakes and it looks like they took 5 minutes on it. After they took my money for this I was then told my son needs to attend an ‚Äúintensive‚Äù. The cost, SEVERAL THOUSAND DOLLARS! This is absurd. Elerie was our occupational therapist. She was abrasive and rude to my son. The staff were not friendly and looked bored. I have never written a review before, but I feel obligated to do so, as I don‚Äôt want another family to go through a similar experience and then get swindled out of their money. It seems they only care about their bottom line. I have since taken my child to elsewhere and I will never recommend Lifeskills.

I have a 7 years old son. I brought him for an evaluation and it seems will start here for an intensive sensory program. I had a chance to meet with the director of center and I feel so comfortable about his approach. It seems this center really taking care of my son. I spoke with some parents and heard about the changes with their kids. One of the parents were coming from Bahamas for the intensive program and the mom said we understand the underlying of the issues with our child here. And another mom said his son get the peace after a lot of anxiety. They explained me all the steps clearly. Now I am waiting for the consultation and  then will start for an intensive program. Hope I will see my son in a calm body and mind...

It‚Äôs really a sad and disappointing thing to read all these wonderful reviews of your programs when you don‚Äôt accept insurance (not even Children‚Äôs Medical Services; for medically complex children). You don‚Äôt offer scholarships or even a sliding scale for families on limited incomes. I guess the only children and families worth helping are the ones who can afford to pay hundreds of dollars out of pocket each week.

My first time coming to this office and I was blown away. The aesthetic of the building was so stylish, but Professional. My appointment and my therapist exceeded my expectations. I would HIGHLY  Recommend this place
Great therapy and therapist but I miss the old LifeStance waiting room. A zoom meeting feels like another meeting at work.
The staff was friendly and professional. The doctor was very thorough and compassionate. I felt very safe with my interaction
Your website is really bad. I also could not login on my computer. Had to go to my smart phone. It‚Äôs not the first time this has happened. Your system is horrendous

Process was simple and admissions staff was very friendly. Although it‚Äôs not their job, they listen to my concern and appoint me to the perfect therapist. The only thing is that I had to call them to get the link to the zoom appointment, but once you there you can download the app and you are all set. The therapist was perfect, she listen to my concern and is making the perfect strategy for me. I‚Äôve never done this in my life, but I felt it was time I talk to someone. I‚Äôm happy I did and I feel so much better from my first meet and greet. Highly recommend talking to someone, you have no idea what a relief.

Honestly I dreaded doing this because of ‚ÄúFear of retaliation‚Äù & with the followers and viewers my profile receives, I never want to ‚ÄúBash‚Äù a company.. I just simply never participate again.

My experience with this psychiatrist‚Äôs office has been deeply frustrating and disappointing. From the very beginning, it became clear that professionalism and patient care are not their priorities. Phone calls are almost never answered, and messages are rarely returned. For a medical office, this level of inaccessibility is unacceptable, especially for patients seeking consistent support with their mental health.

In addition, there is a clear pattern of pushing unnecessary sessions, which feels more like a strategy to generate revenue than an effort to provide genuine care. Appointments themselves often feel rushed and dismissive, leaving me with the impression that my concerns were not being heard or taken seriously.

The most damaging issue, however, has been their neglect of critical documentation needed for work and daily responsibilities. Failing to complete or provide this information has created additional stress and complications in my life ‚Äî the very opposite of what mental health care is supposed to accomplish.

Mental health treatment requires compassion, attentiveness, and professionalism. Unfortunately, this office demonstrates none of those qualities. Instead, patients are left feeling unsupported, dismissed, and taken advantage of financially.

If you are considering this practice, I strongly recommend looking elsewhere. There are providers who will respect your time, listen to your concerns, and prioritize your well-being. Sadly, this office is not one of them.

I‚Äôm concerned that writing this review might delay the important documents I need to maintain my job. They claim that you need six visits for them to even inform your employer that you‚Äôre seeking their assistance. Of course the appointments are WEEKS apart, how can I afford these six visits without having supporting documentation that I‚Äôm actually seeing them?

Just be very careful and weigh your options. There‚Äôs tons of Mental Health Professionals and Centers that will 100% Treat you right.

My psychiatrist was a very nice man and wanted to help me but the office was incompetent, the patient portal kept glitching, I was punished for being honest about my mental health problems under duress, now I don't get calls back, the patient portal will not send messages, and there is no way for a voicemail to be left.  As  medical sociologist and as a patient this is a nightmare. It's a shame because I liked the doctor but the red tape and BS outside of the doctor has been more exhausting than I, a person with progressive MS and chronic migraine, have time to deal with

As a medical sociologist (UM MA 2016), it is critical for a practice to have systems set up for patients to at least leave a message but this incompetent practice and the staff behind the doctors are less than useless and I am just tired.  Too tired.  After attempting to send five portal messages on various devices in a row and there being no voice mail option and not getting calls returned, I'm done with this place.   Maybe someday they'll get it together but for now they are an inefficient office with a broken website and that is not a great thing for someone's mental health. Go somewhere where more than just your individual doctor but the people who set up the practice actually understand patient needs and what they are doing and have failsafe message options for when the patient portal is down.  Like I said, I have finite energy and this practice has exhausted during a time I have none to spare.

Too too much, too too much you got to do everything on your phone ahead of time put your card on file let them know if you don't want it on file then you got to do it every time, then you got to check in yourself this is getting worse than the airline. The people of course are very nice when you get there their victims as well they have nothing to do with it but all of this registering making accounts logging in checking yourself in it's like everything else too too much why bother, so many times I want to say forget it cancel the appointment I don't have time for this I feel like I'm doing the administration's job at the health centers or call center or the headquarters Hi how are you 816-61
Wow, I am so impressed by my therapist:) she was able to see me relatively quickly and she was generous with her time. I genuinely loved her and will continue to see her.

DID  NOT EVEN HAVE THE DECENCY TO CALL AND CANCEL MY APPOINTMENT!!!
I had my first appointment scheduled on a Monday and took a half day off of work to make this appointment. I am a single mother of four and cannot afford to miss work but taking into account the importance of my mental health I took off from work when my children and I really needed that extra income. When I got to my appointment they said they had cancelled it a week ago. I did not get a call, text or email. I guess it‚Äôs backing to drinking and popping pills for this mommy!
Thankful for Dr. Godfrey and everyone in her practice! They are the best of the best!

I‚Äôve been seeing Allison Cobian @ Lifescapes for 5 months now and I just love & appreciate her - she‚Äôs helped me so much & the future is looking brighter! The practice has a very relaxed & friendly feel, which I found helpful and reduced any anxiety I had when I first started my therapy

Absolutely amazing therapy clinic. Dr. Godfrey truly knows what she's doing and is amazing at what she does.  I highly recommend this clinic over others because the care here is genuine and they aren't trying to rob you.
Absolutely THE BEST OF THE BEST!  Dr Godfrey has, by far done more to help me process some difficult times and situations. I highly recommend her.

Transformative, welcoming, and supportive! I love Charity! She has amazing incite, utilizes wonderful techniques to help guide an individual through processing events of the past and present, and helps acheive goals.  Another bonus, lifescape counseling group is involved in many community projects, workshops, and book clubs!

I truly don‚Äôt have enough words to express the gratitude I feel for this amazing team. George, Curtis, Yolanda, Alex, Khamari, and the entire nursing staff are not just professionals ‚Äî they‚Äôre compassionate, dedicated, and genuinely invested in every person who walks through their doors.

Each one of them played a role in helping me through one of the most difficult chapters of my life.  Their support didn‚Äôt just aid my recovery ‚Äî it saved my life.

I have been a patient at many different facilities and this so far has been the most helpful to me. A HUGE part of what makes this program special is that they have a "family allience" group for psychoeducation and family therapy included once a week. They include family in treatment, which truly every program should. I also love that the program is not capped at 30 days. This place allows you to heal at your own pace. I highly recommend lifeskills and if I ever need help again I will be coming back.

I came to RTC seeking for help with my mental health. As an anxious but very independent person as well, the transition was a little rough. However, the staff and techs assisted in making the transition easier. They were always checking in on my wellbeing, assisting as needed, but also planned fun activities and found myself laughing often with them.

As hard as RTC was in terms of intense therapy, there were days I struggle a lot. I would have outburst and at times the staff would get the worst of it. However, at the end of the day, they always understood and didn‚Äôt hold a grudge.

I want to give the biggest shout outs to George, Melissa, Patricia, Tea, Francis, Imoni, Tisha, Kamari, and Alex. Thank you so much for your support as I‚Äôve done the hardest things I‚Äôve ever done. Words cannot describe the amazing community you all have built, the safety at the villa, and the feeling of ‚Äúa home away from home.‚Äù Thank you for even being interested in my lifestyle outside of the villa, whether it be future goals, current events, or even accomplishments from my past. I know I was challenging at times, but wouldn‚Äôt be able to do this without y‚Äôall.

Another big shoutout to the nursing staff! Val, Angie, Carlee, Gui, thank you for making sure we‚Äôre all in good health! I know you all go through a lot (making sure we get our medication on time, scheduling appointments, etc) and your work does not go unnoticed! I will say as well, I don‚Äôt think I have ever felt more comfortable with asking anyone in nursing about my own health concerns. I knew I could come to you guys with no judgement.

My experience with life skills has been amazing! They have helped me out so much. The staff all around has been super friendly and the therapist are more than supportive in my journey to recovery. I‚Äôd like to give a big shoutout to Imoni the staff member for making me feel included into the community and for being there whenever I needed help or to talk. This has been a wonderful place that I recommend to everyone!!
LifeSkills has been great to me, very helpful in everyday stress. The therapists, staff, Dr. Yolanda and Dr. Ryan are awesome. They are all so patient, kind and really help you!

Hands down the best chiropractor in Florida!!!
Dr. Fritz is so nice and caring, he helped me a lot after giving birth I had lots of hip pain, sciatica and he took the time to make sure I had the care I needed, he helped me tremendously and I no longer have sciatica problems. He‚Äôs not someone who wants to keep you coming just to make money off of you, we made a plan, he regularly checked to see what my problems, pain level and progress I made so he could adjust how many sessions I needed a week, I now see him a few times a year for regular maintenance or if I tweak something.
If you know doctor Fritz going to his office feels like coming home!
He also does DOT physicals/CDL medical certification for drivers, he‚Äôs busy but truck drivers seem to love coming there too!
Truly the best in the business! Thanks for all your help all these years! üôè
Dr Philippe was extremely professional. I highly recommend this business to you. #DOT

Just Amazing! I needed a last minute appointment and although he was busy he was very accommodating and not to mention gave me feel immediate relief!!!!! I will definitely come back and recommend to anyone in pain

Dr. Fritz is definitely top tier! I visit occasionally for an adjustment, and every time he relieves pressure, stress or tight muscles from somewhere I didn‚Äôt even know needed attention. Extremely professional and knowledgeable. Also provides other services for like truck drivers too! Definitely recommend always!

Once when you see this doctor you‚Äôll realize why he got 5 stars. Did my DOT physical exam today, didn‚Äôt took long like at some other places and Dr. Fritz was really professional and helpful. I already recommended him to some of my friends...

I can‚Äôt say enough about how Sheilah has helped me. I came to her struggling with health anxiety due to a recent chronic illness diagnosis and high levels of stress due to other family issues. From our very first session, I felt heard and supported. Her calm, steady presence immediately put me at ease, and she created a safe space where I could open up without fear of judgment. That alone was huge for me.

She has a gentle, encouraging way of guiding conversations that helped me explore my thoughts and emotions more clearly. Instead of feeling overwhelmed, I began to feel more grounded and capable of managing what once felt out of control. Her insights were always spot-on, and she offered practical tools that I still use daily.

I‚Äôm deeply grateful for her support and highly recommend her to anyone dealing with anxiety, stress, or just in need of a calm, compassionate guide through life‚Äôs challenges.

My daughter was in a fragile emotional state due to circumstances well beyond her control. A friend referred Dr. Ledesma to me and we started weekly counseling. I would recommend anyone to take advantage of her care. My daughter found a safe spot to share her feelings and feel empowered and independent while also acknowledging some difficult truths. She has blossomed with Dr. Ledesma and I am forever thankful for finding her.

If I could leave Sheilah a million stars in a Google review I would - I've been seeing her for a few years now and without her I would be totally lost - She has been the most effective therapist I have ever been to without question - Her ability to administer EMDR has changed me into a completely different person in the best way possible - If you are looking for a therapist in Ft. Lauderdale your search should start and end with Sheilah Ledesma

Working with Sheilah has been an absolute game-changer for me! She's not just a therapist; she's been my guiding light through the dark tunnel of burnout. She has this amazing ability to really get to the core of what's going on and offer practical strategies to help me cope. But what I love most about Sheilah is her warmth and compassion. She creates such a safe space where I can be completely vulnerable without fear of judgment. Thanks to her, I've learned to prioritize self-care and set boundaries, and I'm finally starting to feel like myself again. Sheilah is a true gem, and I'm so grateful to have her in my corner!

I am so glad and grateful to have found Sheilah and her practice. I‚Äôve been considering therapy for a long time but still had that hesitation. I knew after my first conservation with Sheilah that I can put my trust in her and take the next step. She allowed me to talk through my thoughts openly, without judgement. I tend to keep my guard up but Sheilah created a space where it was safe for me to peel back bit by bit. Her office definitely helped me feel at ease as well! She so thoughtfully decorated and makes you feel like you are walking into your interior decorator friend‚Äôs house. I would recommend Sheilah and her practice to anybody.

Courtney essentially saved my life seven years ago when I was absolutely pummeled by PTSD and all that comes with it. She saw me, pro bono, for six MONTHS because I ran out of employee mental health coverage. She is the reason I am writing this, why I own my own home, my own car, and am financially independent and will never have to work another day in my life at age 40. She taught me that true empathy is real, and that selflessness is a trait we should all strive to attain. If you're reading this, Courtney, thank you. Infinity times, thank you.

My son has improved his speech so much with Ms. Hillary! She makes speech fun and my four year old is always excited for his appointments. We started last summer for twice a week and moved to once a week this school year. She has been so helpful in accommodating our schedule so he can go to appointments after school/work. She communicates about his progress regularly and provides him with practice to do at home to accelerate his progress.
We had to stop going for a few months after the last hurricane because my work schedule changed. I noticed that he kept the speech he learned with her, but was not making additional progress. He has been back for about a month and he's already making huge gains again. We live over half an hour away and it is so worth the drive.
Highly recommend!

The best. Compassionate team who listens to your concerns, keeps you informed and connects quickly and effortlessly with kids. My daughter loves going to speech with Hillary and Alicia. We‚Äôve seen vast improvement and love how they help you to best implement / practice at home WITHOUT it feeling like a chore to you or your kids through various activities or games. Highly recommend

We have used both speech therapy services and tutors at Lighthouse for several years now.  Our kids absolutely adore  everyone they work with and the proof is in the data.  Our kids test scores at school continue to improve, often putting them above grade level expectations.  And I can happily report that our son, once unintelligible to unfamiliar people,  has graduated from needed speech services.  You simply can't get a better outcome than that!  Much appreciation to the entire team!

My son, now 6, has been with Ms. Alicia for speech since March of 2022, and he has made leap and bounds in his progress.

When we started, most people - even close family - had a very difficult time understanding him.  He was quite vocal but blended letters, avoided others, and then there were just some sounds that he couldn't quite get.  It was frustrating for him, and was negatively affecting not only his confidence around others but also his introduction to reading. Fast forward to today and he has close to all of his sounds down.

I am very glad we chose Lighthouse because it seems there is more than just meeting benchlines and goals in their approach to teaching.  My son looks forward to his time with Ms. Alicia - they play games, create art, and work on speech along the way.  For a child who typically dislikes anything resembling a curriculum or forced learning, his excitement there is impressive.  She makes him happy, which makes me happy.

Our time spent at lighthouse with Alicia has been invaluable.  I cannot recommend them and specifically her enough. Thank you a million, zillion times.

We have been with Lighthouse for about 3 years now and I can't say enough about them! The entire staff are so kind and are fully invested in my daughter's success. Her current therapist, Emily, is amazing with teaching AAC devices and is creative and flexible. She comes up with endless ways to keep my daughter engaged. I highly recommend Lighthouse Pediatric Therapy Partners!

Lighthouse Veterinarian is not just a clinic for animals.  Lighthouse is a safe haven for our furry family members.

We have come to Lighthouse twice.  Once was a sad outcome, and once was a positive outcome.

Leah, Savannah, Maria, Amy, Wendy are the names we remember; however, everyone there is an absolute angel.

Our  Bella Thompson had her last treat and hug at the ripe age of 13 on our first visit, and the whole team handled each one of us with so much grace and kindness.

One month later, bellas children had 9 puppies.

4 months later, one of our late bellas grandson‚Äôs, got into some banyan chinaberries in the yard.

Our baby painted that poor office with the stuff that he couldn‚Äôt keep in üò≠

Even after the puking, the poking, and the fluid hump back to rehydrate him‚Ä¶. LB wanted to stay with the nice doctors that made him feel all better.

We left there KNOWING our puppy will be ok and everyone was going to make sure of it.

Thank you is never enough ‚ô•Ô∏è

5 stars isn't enough to describe how we were treated.
Amy was the super friendly voice on the phone, she went above and beyond to help schedule us.

The amazing staff met us at the front door, ushered my little buddy to a private room and immediately checked on her.

The Vet Techs came in and explained what was going to happen and gave me options, they were very kind and patient.
I wish I could remember all the names that came to check on us, but it was a very stressful moment.

Ultimately it was a bad day for me, but it would have much worse  if the team at Lighthouse hadn't gotten us in as quick as they did, with a level of compassion I didn't expect.

If you're looking for a vet for your little one that actually care about them, I highly recommend giving Lighthouse a try.

Dr. Laura and her entire staff are absolutely amazing! I have three dogs and all have different ailments and needs. Two are senior dogs and one puppy. The techs are fantastic! Denise and Leah are always so patient and attentive. The front desk girls are wonderful! Amy and Savannah are always helpful with refills, scheduling appointments and billing. My dogs are always nervous at the vet, but they do great at Lighthouse. I recommend them to everyone I know with pets!

My dog, Oliver received an incredible service and personal attention on his visit. I took my dog for an ear infection and he was treated very well by staff especially Ms Maria!  She loved on him while she cleaned his ears out.   Oliver got peanut butter for being a good boy during the visit. I highly recommend this clinic for your pet‚Äôs needs.  They exceeded my expectations!

We are first time cat owners and our first time visiting a vets office. We were greeted so kindly by Amy and Angie! The place is so clean! Then we were attended by Denise and Leidy who gave our kitten so much love!
We are so happy to have come here! Thank you ladies!

Mary is the instructor we all need‚Äîbut truly do not deserve‚Äîin our lives. I‚Äôve been to a few Pilates studios, but the level of personalized attention you receive at Lighthouse Pilates & Physical Therapy is unmatched. From the very beginning of each class, Mary checks in with everyone individually about any trouble spots (for me, it‚Äôs always my neck and hip), and she tailors the session accordingly‚Äîincorporating exercises that both strengthen those areas and work around them when needed.

Mary is incredibly intelligent and has such a deep understanding of the human body. Being a physical therapist, she ensures that everyone is performing the exercises safely and with proper form. Anytime I perform a move that doesn‚Äôt feel quite right, she‚Äôs quick to offer modifications and explains why my body might be reacting that way. I trust her with my entire soul. All of my friends who have come to this studio have raved about it‚Äîand many have found their new Pilates home here.

The studio and equipment are in immaculate condition, which only adds to the top-notch experience.

If you‚Äôre looking for chaotic Pilates classes with loud music and little guidance‚Äîthis is not the place for you. This is real Pilates, taught with care and precision, and Mary will challenge your body in the best way possible

Mary is wonderful!  Her classes are very focused, and she explains each exercise well.

The studio is not large, so the classes are personalized to suit your fitness level.

This is a fabulous fitness routine and approach for those who need targeted therapy.

Update: 11/30/2023
Love how Mary changes the class routine to target different muscle groups.  It also adds spontaneity to the routine

Mary‚Äôs Pilates and PT fusion with her expertise makes one amazing class! She plans her ‚Äúall levels‚Äù class with focus to hit all major muscle groups, all while her watchful eyes gently offer cues to what may need attention. She makes sure you have just the right color springs resistance for your skills, so the more she knows you, the more she can tailor. Excellent studio, clean and friendly environment- highly recommended especially to those in the Hollywood/Ft Lauderdale area. Can‚Äôt wait to be back!

This is an incredible pilates studio. Mary is such a sweet instructor who explains the moves in a way that makes sense. Classes are small and not intimidating. She provides individual attention in them which is wonderful.  Going there makes you feel good.

This place is great! Mary is an excellent instructor! She knows proper techniques to avoid injuries and delivers a quality workout. She‚Äôs also very personable, plus with her PT background knows the body! The studio is spotless with the latest equipment. What is also great, there are plenty of classes, especially morning, to work with my schedule. I highly recommend!

Can‚Äôt say enough good things about Lighthouse Therapy Center. Ms. Ingrid is wonderful, very helpful dealing with insurance and very responsive. Ms. Ursula (ST) is heaven sent, my daughter has made great strides thanks to her. We love that she gives great feedback to continue work at home and is always looking for the best way to help my daughter. Ms Amy (OT) is the sweetest, my daughter always asks to see her. Needless to say I‚Äôm beyond satisfied with the services and feel blessed to have found them and would absolutely recommend them to other parents.

‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

Ms. Ursula has been an absolute blessing in my son‚Äôs speech therapy journey. From day one, she has shown incredible patience, dedication, and expertise in helping him make tremendous progress. My son has autism and struggles with expressive language, but Ms. Ursula has tailored her approach to fit his unique needs, making sessions engaging, fun, and highly effective.

One of the things we appreciate most is her ability to connect with him on a personal level. She understands what motivates him, incorporating his favorite characters and interests into therapy to keep him engaged. Whether it‚Äôs using visual supports, interactive games, or hands-on activities, she finds creative ways to make learning enjoyable. Her encouragement has helped build his confidence, and we have seen a noticeable improvement in his ability to express himself.

Before working with Ms. Ursula, my son had difficulty forming sentences and articulating his thoughts clearly. Now, he is using longer phrases, engaging in more conversations, and showing excitement in communicating with others. She has also given us invaluable strategies to use at home, ensuring that his progress continues beyond therapy sessions.

Ms. Ursula‚Äôs kindness, expertise, and unwavering support have made an incredible impact on my son‚Äôs life. We are beyond grateful for her dedication and highly recommend her to any family seeking a compassionate and skilled speech therapist. She has truly been an integral part of his success!

I stumbled upon them while working at a near by office in the same building and went in to ask a few questions about speech therapy for my then 18mo. I was told that I could have someone come to the daycare since it was near by, but later I was told that due to availability it was not feasible for only 1 child. I was a bit upset, but understood.

I requested a bilingual person because it is important for me that my kids grab Spanish as well as English plus I also teach them ASL. We have been paired up with Cindy and my daughter, now 2, absolutely loves her. She runs out the car into the elevator and even though still having a bit of a hard time speaking (she is stubborn) she knows to press the numbers when I tell her and then runs out to the office door before I am even out the elevator! It is awesome to see her get so excited, sometimes too much, to spend time learning one on one which is hard for me to do while taking care of my baby. Cindy is also very flexible when I need to have a schedule accommodation and understanding when last minute things happen.

She has always kept great open communication while in sessions and out and I have even been told of a possibility to now see my daughter at the day care, but I turned it down because it was a different person and we just love Cindy. Don't get me wrong everyone is great, even the other girls my daughter enjoys being around them and they all greet us with respect, but of course my daughter has built a special connection that I do not want to break plus I am happy with her process in Spanish and Sign Language. Even my almost 1 yo loves coming here as I let him run around the wait room while we wait for my daughter and he loves to play with the toys and the books, gets a little upset he can't go with his sister but still enjoys just running around.

All in all Lighthouse is amazing. Would have given 5 starts if it wasn't because of the original miscommunication as being a single mom with 2 under 2 it can be difficult to find time after work to do these things. Other than that, it is a great place with knowledgeable staff. Even the interactions with the other families I have seen is great. If I could get another referral to also put my 1 yo I would because it is so helpful aside from their daycare because it truly does take a village and I consider Cindy as part of mine.

My son has been seeing Cindy with Speech as well as Jessica for occupational therapy for about 6 months now and they have done incredible things with my sons progress. I have noticed a huge difference in both his speech and motor skills. The ladies are great and are very patient and understanding and very communicative. They are also very flexible and are able to accommodate your child‚Äôs needs. I‚Äôm very happy with Lighthouse Therapy and I‚Äôm glad that I found them.

I have nothing but great experiences with this establishment thus far. From the first phone conversation, I was impressed. The care, professionalism and patience that Vanessa has with my son is the absolute best. I can say I‚Äôve made the right decision switching from a previous Kids therapy office, who has no comparison to the level of service, and expertise displayed at Lighthouse. They actually care about your child and works with them, to ensure they succeed. Ingrid your team rocks!! Vanessa thanks a million for screaming, laughing, playing and overall, helping my son with your magic, in gaining confidence to overcome his hurdles.

When my son was diagnosed with autism, I was heartbroken but the only thing you can do as a parent is start by getting the help he needs to make sure he strives in life. I am so happy I found Lighting Behavior Services. From the moment he started his journey the girls in the front desk all made me feel welcomed and worked me thru the process. I want to give a huge thanks to my sons RPT teacher Rachel. She is amazing, so skilled and professional. I want to thank his speech therapist Laura because I thought my son was going to be non-verbal and has been saying words with her skills it has open the doors to the possibility of him speaking one day. I wanted to thank his OT teacher Ms. T.  She is very loving and caring works with passion.  Thanks to her my son does way more than before. The ABA, Yanela has kept me informed thru the process. I love his team, and I am so Grateful for everything they have done and continue to do for my little one. You guys are amazing!!

Lighting Behavior Services is a good school.
They are very professional clean and productive. My son teacher Mrs Graciela is very competent, and responsible ; she is fantastic. My son is doing so much better,
He started talking the first week of the school.  he is improving just because of this Team.
I love the whole staff üí•üí•‚ù£Ô∏è‚ù£Ô∏è

Thank you for your service üôè

I'm delighted to leave a 5-star review for Lighting Behavior Services. My son has made incredible progress under their care. The front desk staff is highly competent, the facility is super clean, and their therapists knowledge in child development is impressive to say the least. I‚Äôm so sorry that I wasted precious time anywhere else‚Ä¶.but here at Lightning my husband and I  couldn't be happier with the support they provide!

Observations from an accidental visitor,
To Chamile and Anabelli,
I had the opportunity to attend the birthday celebration of my godson, Jorge (George) Daniel Toledo last month at your facility. I was very impressed with what I saw. Yadira, his therapist was very loving and understanding with him. The interactions were positive. I could say the same about Gretel, his analyst.
In fact, though the children were having fun, not one child was unattended. They were watched and taken care of at all times. I could see that these women were doing their job, but, what mostly impressed me is that they did it with dedication and love. All these children deserve that extra ingredient and they are receiving it at your facility.
As a retired nurse for many years, I have worked at different hospitals and have met patients with all kinds of needs. Medicine, surgeries, treatments are essential, yes. However, it is the dedication, the extra effort, the caring smiles, especially towards children, that matter the most for them to heal and progress.
I have noticed that little George has made tremendous progress since he has been at your therapy school.
This is why I am writing this letter to you. I want to praise the work that these young women are doing day in and day out, with the enthusiasm and dedication that I witnessed from them. I would appreciate if my comments are passed down to them.

With appreciation,
Lourdes A. Diaz

I really recommend this agency. They are really professional, they have ethics and special attentions. Thanks to this agency I found my son‚Äôs therapist who has been an angel in our lifes  she is dedicated and a lovely person. I have seen the improvement and success in my son‚Äôs life thanks to her and the agency team. Thanks Claudia Vigoa, Yuliet and everyone that works every day to help the kids to have a better life.

provider_name: Limitless Potentials: Jupiter Therapist & Counseling, Kathy Shafer Ph.D
review_text: When I arrived at my first appointment, I could immediately tell that this was not going to be a "run of the mill" boring therapy session.  Dr. Shafer's office is an eclectic space with a great vibe.  I have only had a few appointments with Dr. Shafer so far,  and I am amazed at my progress.  I feel quite fortunate that I came upon her practice.  Her untraditional style really gets results and promotes a comfortable but professional environment.  She offers innovative sessions and personal attention.  Thank you Dr. Shafer!

provider_name: Limitless Potentials: Jupiter Therapist & Counseling, Kathy Shafer Ph.D
review_text:
I go to Dr Shafer for psychotherapy weekly and I can honestly say I have never met someone better at their job. I have been through around 8 therapist so far and no one has been able to truly reach through to me. Since week 1 with Dr. Shafer I have felt comfortably safe and more than happy to share my experiences with her; both bad and good. With the help of mindfulness, essential oils, yoga, and meditation, she makes one feel relaxed and open to vulnerability. I would‚Äîwith no doubt ‚Äî recommend going to her for therapy/yoga.

PS. She has a cute therapy dog that comes sometimes and the office is RIGHT next to the beach. Need I say more?

provider_name: Limitless Potentials: Jupiter Therapist & Counseling, Kathy Shafer Ph.D
review_text:
Dr. Kathy has so much training, call her!

As a consultee of Dr. Kathy, the encouragement, training, support and knowledge I have received from her has continued to assist me in helping my clients find their own personal healing.  She is passionate about helping others and this shines through in how she supports other therapists expand their own tool box.  I recommend her 100% for anyone looking for additional training, supervision, consultation or personal therapy.

provider_name: Limitless Potentials: Jupiter Therapist & Counseling, Kathy Shafer Ph.D
review_text: Dr. Shafer has helped my family immeasurably through our grief. The sudden and traumatic loss of a loved one is a difficult journey and can tear families apart. She has always been there for us. She is professional, compassionate and thoughtful in her analysis and advice. She has broadened my knowledge and use of important coping skills to push through challenging events. Life is certainly a journey and there is no better therapist to have by your side than Dr. Kathy Shafer.

provider_name: Limitless Potentials: Jupiter Therapist & Counseling, Kathy Shafer Ph.D
review_text: I have known Dr. Shafer both professionally and personally for over 14 years.  I have found Dr. Shafer to be integral, inspiring, informed and engaging. She continues to challenge herself to grow spiritually as well as expand her knowledge base to be on the cutting edge of the ever evolving field of psychology. Dr. Shafer's vast experience, knowledge and creativity gives birth to an experience that's interactive and fun. I most admire Dr. Shafer's commitment to making this world a better place one cause at a time, one workshop at a time, one class at a time, one family at a time, one life at a time.

Courtney is very professional, compassionate and dedicated to making a difference. You can really tell she loves what she does and the children are always her utmost priority. Her new clinic is very welcoming and I highly recommend her!

Courtney is a real professional. She‚Äôs really dedicated to the well-being of the kids she looks after. Her clinic is beautiful, brand new, you can tell she put a lot of thought and effort into her new place.

Very professional and is great with my child. Courtney is very friendly, OMG very patient and goes above and beyond to make sure my son gets the necessary services he needs in order to be successful. We love her!

Courtney worked with my son for several years. She is knowledgeable, patient, and professional. She evaluated and supported my son in specific areas according to his learning needs, and she adapted his therapy to his growth each year in academics and behavior.  Courtney communicated with me regularly and was a good resource person when I had questions. My son could be stubborn and challenging to work with at times, but she connected easily with him, and he enjoyed working with her. He is currently thriving in school now.

My child attended this facility and received outstanding care. Candice do a wonderful job at this center and making sure of my child's safety and well-being. The service I received was truly great , and I would recommend this center to anyone, especially under Candice's supervision. Her compassion and genuine care truly stand out

My brother attended this facility and was highly mistreated just like many other kids in the care of nurse Candice and the staff. Staff member Karen was extremely unprofessional and extremely rude to the children. My brother would literally cry in the morning when it was time for drop off and she would be the staff member on duty. Nurse Candice was extremely unprofessional and her role at the PPEC is supposed to ensure safety of these children yet she would hold medications and diagnose my brother based off her own personal opinion instead of her actual job title. They would constantly send other belongings of other children home in my brothers bag and also send my brothers belongings to other children when my brother has medical conditions that are not to be shared with others ! Everyday we would send lunch and the lunch would be untouched yet my child came home starving from the PPEC. When asked what he ate they would say a snack from hours ago yet his lunch was untouched. There were multiple incidents where my brother got hurt and I was not notified nor was an incident report created. They do not send sick children home either bc they don‚Äôt want to loose out on money from insurance companies. My brother caught RSV from the PPEC program and had to be hospitalized for a week in the ICU bc they did not send sick children home like they are supposed to. These people lack empathy, professionalism, and just plain old morals. Do not let these fake good reviews fool you, take it from the parents who have had to take their children out of this hell hole bc our children were regressing and suffering in the hands of nurse CANDICE and her staff. Matters have escalated and the health department has been notified.

This is the best childcare for any child with medical conditions/special needs ‚Ä¶All the nurses and staff are my child‚Äôs extended family, she is so excited every day to go she brings her shoes to me.
I know my little angel is in the best care with the most loving  nurses at Little Angels. They even offer transportation. I am so lucky to have found this place. She has fun every day
Grand new opening! What a lovely office, lovely & friendly staff. Very modern, bright colors, great daycare for our special needs kids.  Highly recommend to those looking for a PPEC.
Highly recommend! The team is professional, kind, and truly cares about the kids.

provider_name: Little Champs Pediatric Care PPEC - Medical Daycare
review_text: Very attentive and caring staff. Happy with the service provided, will definitely recommend it.

provider_name: Little Champs Pediatric Care PPEC - Medical Daycare
review_text: Hello my name is Desiree Gutierrez and i been with little champs just a short period of time but all i have to say is that they are really great people

provider_name: Little Champs Pediatric Care PPEC - Medical Daycare
review_text: This place is very beautiful

provider_name: Little Champs Pediatric Care PPEC - Medical Daycare
review_text: It's a beautiful place where children are loved wholeheartedly. I highly recommend it. My nephew is there, and I thank everyone for such wonderful care. God bless this wonderful place.

provider_name: Little Champs Pediatric Care PPEC - Medical Daycare
review_text: I have had the pleasure of being in this center and I have shared with its staff. It is truly a pleasure to see that they work with much love and are very professional. Do not lose perspective and continue growing. Your children need to be loved to cope with life, which for some is very ephemeral. I wish you much success and great achievements.

provider_name: Little Champs Therapy & Yoga - Fort Lauderdale, FL
review_text: The therapists have a special way of bringing out the best in every child. My son has become more independent and confident since we started coming here. The progress is remarkable.

provider_name: Little Champs Therapy & Yoga - Fort Lauderdale, FL
review_text: Every therapist we‚Äôve met has been kind, professional, and truly invested in helping children succeed. You can see their passion in the way they celebrate each milestone.

provider_name: Little Champs Therapy & Yoga - Fort Lauderdale, FL
review_text: The environment is calm and nurturing. My child feels safe and supported, and that makes such a difference in how much effort he puts into every activity.

provider_name: Little Champs Therapy & Yoga - Fort Lauderdale, FL
review_text:
Very disappointed. No one ever calls you back, no one ever knows what is going on, no one can ever answer your questions correctly. They keep canceling and rescheduling my daughters appointments without any explanation and only call me to allow me to know they are going to charge a no show fee when I wasn‚Äôt even aware of an appointment.

The ONLY good thing I can Say is that Emily is super sweet.

Horrible place.

provider_name: Little Champs Therapy & Yoga - Fort Lauderdale, FL
review_text:
We cannot express enough gratitude for the incredible work of Melissa and Sheryl. In just a few months, we‚Äôve seen remarkable improvements in our daughter‚Äôs communication and daily life skills. Melissa has been nothing short of amazing, helping our daughter articulate her thoughts with newfound confidence and clarity. Her creative, patient, kind and engaging approach has made therapy sessions enjoyable for her, and we‚Äôve seen her vocabulary and social interactions flourish.

Sheryl has been equally phenomenal, tailoring sessions to meet our daughter‚Äôs unique needs and helping her develop crucial fine motor and sensory processing skills. Activities that once felt overwhelming to her are now approached with ease and even excitement.

The progress we‚Äôve witnessed in such a short period speaks volumes about their expertise, dedication, and genuine care for their patients. We are incredibly thankful to have them on this journey and would wholeheartedly recommend their services to any family seeking top-notch therapists who truly make a difference.

I cannot say enough good things about Little Dreamers PPEC. The entire team is compassionate, professional, and truly dedicated to the well-being of the children in their care. From the moment we started, we felt welcomed and supported. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable, always going above and beyond to make sure all of the children's medical and developmental needs are met. Derek has been an incredible part of our experience making a noticeable impact on my child's development, helping to improve her motor skills and coordination.

The center provides a safe, nurturing, and stimulating environment where children not only receive their necessary medical care but also have the opportunity to socialize, learn, and grow. Communication with parents is excellent! I always felt informed about my child‚Äôs progress and daily activities.

I am grateful for the peace of mind Little Dreamers PPEC has given me, knowing my child is in good hands every day. I highly recommend this center to any family seeking a caring and professional environment for their little one‚Äôs specialized needs.

An exceptional place for children with special needs! Little Dreamers PPEC provides outstanding care in a warm, nurturing environment. The staff is not only highly knowledgeable but also incredibly loving and compassionate. They go above and beyond to ensure that every family feels welcome and valued. The facility itself is immaculate and thoughtfully designed to meet the needs of each child. I can't recommend Little Dreamers PPEC enough ‚Äì they truly make a difference in the lives of children and their families.

Little Dreamers PPEC is truly a blessing for families with medically fragile children. The care, compassion, and dedication of the staff are unmatched. They create a warm, nurturing environment where children receive top-quality medical and therapeutic care while feeling safe and loved. The facility is well-equipped, and their tailored approach to each child‚Äôs needs is remarkable. It‚Äôs more than just a care center‚Äîit‚Äôs a second home. Highly recommend!

I would like to express my gratitude for Little Dreamers PPEC. I transferred my baby to LD, because I had such a bad experiences with another PPEC. I am very pleased with choosing LD! The facility is ALWAYS clean which is very important to me since the previous PPEC was not well kept and my baby stayed sick a lot.

My daughter has been with LD for over one year now, and the experience has been nothing short of amazing! The staff members are very supportive and loving to all of the children! My daughter has progressed soo much since I transferred her to LD PPEC. She has also built great bonds with both the staff as well as with peers!
The staff / therapist keep me updated on her goals and accomplishments. My child looks forward to attending PPEC everyday. This is such a loving and positive environment! I highly recommended LIttle Dreamer PPEC!

Little Dreamers PPEC is a truly magical, safe, and wonderful place to be. Walking in through the doors and taking in all the areas this facility has to offer you can see the dedicate, commitment, pride, and joy that are emanating from the walls. Thank you üíú

Tiffany has been a game-changer for our family! Her expertise in creating a structured mealtime routine, expanding food variety, and supporting oral motor skills was incredible. We‚Äôve seen such positive changes, and I‚Äôm so grateful for her guidance. Highly recommend her to any parent!

Tiffany is fantastic! Highly recommend ! She has worked with my 4 year old for tongue thrust, myofunctional therapy and picky eating . We‚Äôve seen changes with all 3. there‚Äôs been a major shift with temperature and texture preferences , he feeds himself for all meals which used to be a challenge and he‚Äôs happier with meal times . I‚Äôm super grateful. Tiffany has also worked with my other son, we started around 6 months of age with myo based oral motor exercise sessions for his open mouth and low tongue posture . We also did baby led together and removing the pacifier. I‚Äôm incredibly happy with both my boys success with Tiffany! She‚Äôs truly wonderful

Tiffany was extremely helpful for my newborn baby post frenectomy. She helped with his latch, helped to strengthen his suck, showed me the correct bottle and pacifier for him specifically and much more. She‚Äôs so knowledgeable! Tiffany was really helpful throughout a really stressful time in my babies life and I can‚Äôt thank her enough. I‚Äôll definitely recommend her to my friends. Thank you!! -Shira

Tiffany is amazing! Amazing support and understanding during our virtual session. She‚Äôs very knowledgeable and provided great support and provider referrals on tongue ties, feeding etc. Very easy to work with, answers questions and explains very well. Highly recommended.

review_text: My child started at the Weston location two years ago and we transitioned after moving to the newer Coral Springs location almost a year ago. review_text: They have been great! Very supportive and helpful. Felt safe leaving my son with them.

I would recommend little leaves to anyone seeking services. Had a great experience! They are loving, experienced, and supportive.

I want to share my story and express my immense gratitude to Anna and the entire Little Movers team!

My daughter Amina was born at 24 weeks and spent her first eight months in the hospital, unable to master even the simplest skills. Daily sessions with Anna were nothing short of lifesaving: in just a few months, Amina not only caught up physically with her peers but also made an astonishing leap in her cognitive development.

Anna is a consummate professional of the highest caliber! Her boundless patience, genuine kindness, and keen attention to every small milestone make each session feel truly magical. She employs the most up-to-date methodologies, seamlessly blending compassionate care with a rigorous scientific foundation‚Äîand the results speak for themselves. Thanks to her sensitivity and enthusiasm, Amina didn‚Äôt just learn; she blossomed into a confident, happy, and curious little girl.

I honestly don‚Äôt know what we would have done if we hadn‚Äôt met Anna during the most challenging period of our lives and our daughter‚Äôs life.

I am certain that there is no more responsive, talented, or dedicated specialist anywhere in Florida. Anna invested not only her expertise and experience in our daughter‚Äôs development but also a piece of her heart. If you‚Äôre looking for support that truly transforms a child‚Äôs life for the better, Little Movers and Anna will exceed all your expectations!

We started sessions when Alice had just turned 3, and honestly, we had no idea how structured exercises could work for such a little kid. But Little Movers turned everything into playful stories that she loved. A few weeks in, what started as play with some movement became real exercises with playful touches.

The progress has been incredible. Her left side became more active, she started using both hands equally, and her balance really improved. Bedtime also got easier ‚Äì she now falls asleep calmly every night. Watching her do full exercise routines with joy and focus still amazes us. We‚Äôre truly grateful!

My daughter had a SID episode at the age of 2 months. She spent 10 days in NICU. After discharge from hospital, Sofia could barely hold her had and wasn‚Äôt active at all. The neurologists that we visit didn‚Äôt tell us how we can improve situation and suggest to wait. Two month later things didn‚Äôt change much. During this time, I tried some PT facilities, but we didn‚Äôt make progress. When Sofia was 4 months , we were lucky to finally find Anna and Little Movers. It is the best recovery facility we could find. The progress that Sofia made in less than 3 months is truly incredibly amazing. We went the path from baby who could barely hold her head to a baby which actively balances on her forth, can sit without support and even started babbling. Anna has a unique approach to every client. She not only simply train Sofia but also do it in a playing manner, adjust every class based on schedule and Sofia‚Äôs condition. Little movers truly did a miracle for us and we believe that with their help things will get even better. They not only give you support but also a help and hope. When someone with a big heart do a business they love their possibilities are unlimited. I will recommend Little mover to anyone who is looking for rehabilitation, recovery after injury or personal trainer. If you found this page your search is over.

When our daughter Sophia was diagnosed with ataxic cerebral palsy, we knew her rehab journey wouldn‚Äôt be easy. Balance and coordination were a real challenge, but Anna made every session something Sophia looked forward to. The exercises were fun and engaging, and we saw steady progress in her strength and movement. She also shared helpful tips we could use at home. We‚Äôre truly grateful for the care and support.

We did in-home sessions for a few months and had a really positive experience. We reached out for help with our two kids ‚Äî our 9-year-old son has diplegia, and our 11-year-old daughter was struggling with back pain from poor posture. The sessions made a big difference: our son‚Äôs walking improved and he was able to go longer distances, and our daughter got stronger, her pain went away, and her posture noticeably improved.
Thanks to the individualized approach, the sessions felt easy and fun for the kids, which made a huge difference. We had to stop after we moved, but we‚Äôre so grateful for the help and progress they made!
Rob was very friendly and a beautiful facility.  Great place for hunter jumper boarding and lessons!
Love the atmosphere here. Our horse is happier than he has ever been. Instruction from Rob is second to none and everyone is friendly and supportive‚ù§
Quality instruction for all levels from beginners to nationally competitive riders in a low pressure environment.  Beautiful facility with wonderful horse care.
Rob and the staff are wonderful. His ability to work with each students strengths and weakness es is unmatched.
We saw a great well organized show there.   Very professional.

My son is 3year old and didn‚Äôt even say mom or dad and less then six months he was talking....
The best place

We had the absolute BEST experience with Little Steps Florida! We took my son to their Palm Harbor location initially 2x a week then down to 1x a week. He had torticollis that caused him to get plagiocephaly. They worked with my son before, during, and after he was wearing his shaping helmet- AND they even took care of him until he was fully walking to make sure he got out all of the lingering kinks of his torticollis. We mainly had Tabitha as his physical therapist along with Morgan. They are SO fantastic with children, the BEST personalities! 10/10 they deserve a raise, employees of the week, month, year, etc. I HIGHLY recommend sending your children to Little Steps Florida- and more specifically I HIGHLY recommend Tabitha and Morgan üòäü©∑!

My 8 year old daughter attends Little Steps for both physical and occupational therapy. She has come leaps and bounds in her daily life and activities thanks to Tabitha (PT) and Missy (OT). Her confidence since starting therapy is incredible. Best of all, they make it fun so she looks forward to 3 days a week at the "fun doctor".

Tabitha is the best! We have been working with her for about four months now, and my son‚Äôs torticollis has improved drastically! She has given me so many tools to help him. I look forward to our time in therapy each week, and my other kids love it as well! Everything is always so clean and well kept. The entire staff is so fun and welcoming! I cannot thank Jessica and the team at Little Steps enough for all of their help with my son! We are so grateful for their support and help on this journey.
