From Michelle the receptionist, to Dr Sukie, Randy, Amari and Gaby, these 5 are incredible people!!! I will never forget how good I felt with my endless therapies. Randy also worked as an emotional therapist to me lol even when he didn't have to. They elevate you and care for you, I wouldn't wanna go to ANY other place for physical therapy other than NAU. I will be forever grateful and thankful for treating me like a king, specially during the days where I thought my life was over. THANK YOU SO MUCH GUYS!!! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
I have been to several therapy centers over the years but this one goes above and beyond. I really appreciate the personal attention and education. The doctor and staff know what they‚Äôre doing!

Dr. Suki has a caring manner making you feel your right where you should be, in healing hands. His staff is attentive and kind, they present themselves as people who enjoy helping others. I highly recommend this physical therapy and truly, a wellness center.

Amazing place! TRY THE KOMBUCHA! I would give more than 5 stars if I could! I went in with a broken bone and torn muscles etc, not being able to walk properly and having a lot of continual pain. Immediately after my first session with Sukie, I noticed a big difference. Now, I'm walking without a problem and no pain whatsoever! Sukie listens and works with you and genuinely cares. Michelle is also wonderful; she helped with my PT and organized everything. Thanks guys!

provider_name: NEURO PSYCHIATRIC ADDICTION CLINIC - Detox & Rehab in Port St. Lucie
review_text: As someone who's been to enough rehabs to see how things should be run, I can say without hesitation that this facility is an absolute disgrace. The place is poorly managed, and the so-called "clinical director" is a prime example of what happens when you give a little man too much authority. He struts around like he's Napoleon himself‚Äîfull of ego, completely disconnected from the patients, and more interested in power plays than actual care. The staff seems demoralized, and it‚Äôs no wonder... management treats them like they‚Äôre disposable. Confidentiality apparently means nothing here, with certain therapists openly discussing clients‚Äô private matters as if it‚Äôs cocktail hour. I‚Äôve seen better organization at a high school reunion. The only saving grace? The food is decent, and the techs aren't doing that bad. If you're considering this place for care, I‚Äôd strongly urge you to look elsewhere. You deserve better than an egocentric director and a crumbling system propped up by overworked staff.

provider_name: NEURO PSYCHIATRIC ADDICTION CLINIC - Detox & Rehab in Port St. Lucie
review_text: I completed this program with success and it was a very good place to be. The staff was very helpful. They helped me succeed in many ways and I am greatful to have been a part of this journey through recovery. Shout out Pastor Kim! I was in the right place at the right time when this program became available to me and I am very happy to have been part of the NPAC team.

provider_name: NEURO PSYCHIATRIC ADDICTION CLINIC - Detox & Rehab in Port St. Lucie
review_text: I had an amazing experience. Therapist are very knowledgeable about mental health and addiction. I would recommend this to any one struggling with either one. All groups were very well thought out and managed very well. I appreciate everything they did for me and my peers during my time there.

provider_name: NEURO PSYCHIATRIC ADDICTION CLINIC - Detox & Rehab in Port St. Lucie
review_text: This is my first recovery program and I can honestly say that Neuro Psychiatric Addiction clinic save my life. The staffs and techs was very good to the patients and that really played a big part, far as me receiving the love and care I needed to get better. Today I'm sober and clean and HAPPY!!!

provider_name: NEURO PSYCHIATRIC ADDICTION CLINIC - Detox & Rehab in Port St. Lucie
review_text: That place is just all around an amazing place. I traveled from my home town Jacksonville because of the lack of care or poor care when it comes to providing a comfortable invorment to detox in which believe having some where comfortable and having staff that truly care about you and your well being plays a huge roll in your recovery. I've been through detox 12√ó and this was the first time ever completing. When I walked in them doors I had the nurse tell me she wasn't letting me A.M. A There and I was so close to leaving the first week there but because of how much the staff made me comfortable and showed me they cared and showed me how important my soberity wasn't only important to me but them as well I stayed and formed the first steps to my recovery. Another thing I loved about them is not only did they do they focus on your recovery but they focus on your mental health as well. Going into your first stages of recovery is never comfortable but npact recovery made it very comfortable for me and are amazing all around their board from the clinical director to the lady who cooked our food who was just amazing.

Jon worked with me today, for an hour, on my dog‚Äôs reactivity to other dogs while walking on a leash. This was the most productive hour I have ever spent in a dog training session. Jon is helpful, professional, approachable, and kind. He truly understands canine behavior !! He taught me how to train my dog out of his reactive mind set, and helped me understand my role as the leader. He reviewed the concepts learned afterwards, and gave me a reminder sheet reviewing the concepts. Money well spent!!!!! I definitely recommend Jon for any and all of your canine training needs!!!!

Jon is great! I have a very nervous, reactive dog that is afraid of strangers, especially men, due to a traumatic past. Jon was very sympathetic to my dog and was not at all judgmental about his behavior. We went on a walk around the neighborhood and got hit with it all - strangers, barking dogs, and even the mailman. Jon gave me pointers on how to act and calm my dog and it worked! It's still going to be a long journey with my dog but Jon gave us the tools I need to finally get a confident, calm dog after 5 years of trial-and-error. I highly recommend Jon for dogs with reactivity issues!

Just got off the phone with the owner, John. While they don't provide the rattlesnake training I wad looking for specifically, he spent a good 20 min on the phone with me helping me find the service I'm in need of,  and gave multiple recommendations. If I ever need behavior training for my pup, I know where I'm going. Solid guy

We had the pleasure of meeting Jon for our 8 month old German shepherd/ Husky mix. He helped us keep our pup calm when the doorbell rang or door was knocked, which usually makes him go crazy! He also usually pulls so much when walking with his leash on, but within 10 minutes Jon taught us how to work with a reward system and our puppy no longer pulls on the leash!! Thank you Jon, we will definitely need you for our second puppy soon!! Amazing trainer, if I could give 10 stars I would!

John is an amazing trainer and person! He came today to help us with our soft coat wheaten terrier. He gave us some wonderful advice and tips and showed us what to do. Thank you John! We would highly recommend John with North Florida K9 BEHAVIOR it anyone needs help with their dog or dogs!

What a wonderful first-time experience boarding our fur-babies at Nala's Ranch. The owner, Tony, was extremely flexible with our very short notice request.  He took the time to show us where our dogs would be, listened to our concerns, and we felt assured we picked the perfect place! Thank you, Tony, for taking care of our fur-babies while we enjoyed Orlando.  We are customers for life!

Nala's Rach is amazing! Tony and the team truly care about the pups they take care of. Best dog boarding in all of Tampa if you ask me. The dens are so spacious, with air conditioning and their own doggy doors to their own personal yards. Seriously, I've never seen a place that has put this much thought and effort into making dogs feel loved. I loved all the pictures they sent of my senior pup, and they very attention to detail in taking care of medications and feeding instructions. Just an amazing staff that cares because not only is the ranch huge, but they love on site so they don't leave the dogs alone and I love that they're constantly monitored abd hey individual play time. Highly recommend dropping off your pup to this doggy resort when you go on vacation, they will get a vacation of their own!

Nala‚Äôs Ranch is exceptional! We regularly board our two Great Danes, and the care they receive is outstanding. The facility is clean, spacious, and perfectly suited for large breeds like ours. Tony, the owner, trained our youngest Dane Hero, and the results were phenomenal‚Äîhis expertise and dedication transformed our pup into a well-mannered companion. Every boarding experience is stress-free, with attentive staff ensuring our dogs are happy and comfortable. We trust Nala‚Äôs Ranch completely and highly recommend them for boarding and training!

We took our puppy there for first time this month. This was the best decision we ever made for our fur baby  Chloe. The care she received was amazing and the  staff and owner Tony sent us pictures several times to show us what she was  doing.  The  staff  truly cares about the love and care they provide. Chloe got lots of one on one play time too.  Nalas Ranch is only place we will be leave our puppy at now.   Thanks Tony for care and  love you gave Chloe .

Left my dog Koda 2 years old was skeptical at first, but Tony was great at reassuring he would be fine. Tony made you feel comfortable and was so pleasant telling me I could call at any time. When I picked up Koda after leaving him for 5 days, he was perfectly fine. I am glad to have used Nalas Ranch for boarding and will use again.

This is the worst agency to work for. For the past 5 months I have been asking for a copy of my last contract and they would never send it to me but they would tell me they would send it to me. It's like they're hiding something. They wouldn't even take my phone calls anymore. I think they are a dishonest company and I wouldn't trust them or work for them ever again.

Working with Nationwide Therapy Group has been a wonderful experience. Heather is a gem of a person and a fantastic recruiter, definitely recommend that you seek her out. She was able to match me with a position that fit all my requirements and then some.

I really enjoy working for NTG! They not only care about their travelers but they also care about their team of recruiters. We are a woman owned company which is always a bonus and she was a past traveler! It does not get much better than that
Heather is an incredible recruiter. She was sharp, timely, and really cared about what I wanted. I‚Äôd happily work with her again!
Heather is the absolute best recruiter to work with!!!! Compassion, caring and empathic as well as understanding! Answered all my questions. Definitely recommend!

I just love Dr. Laura and her staff!!!  She took the time to listen to my concerns and provided a thorough consultation, making me feel comfortable and understood. Her knowledge and expertise were evident, and her gentle technique made the entire experience incredibly relaxing. Her entire staff is also amazing as they always go above and beyond.

After several sessions, I have noticed significant improvements in my condition and overall well-being. I highly recommend Dr. Laura and her wonderful team to anyone seeking effective and compassionate care. They are truly a gem in the community!

Dr.Laura has done an incredible job easing the pain in my neck caused by Degenerative Disc Disease, a form of Arthritis. She and her entire staff are very nice, friendly and supportive.  I would give them a 10 star rating if I could.

Dr. Laura is an amazing practitioner. Her patients love her and have been seeing her for many years. She is always looking to learn more and willing to share her own knowledge.
I came to work for her after recently obtaining my acupuncture license. She was very welcoming and willing to take time to show me her practice and some of her techniques. The first day there I was very impressed with the staff. Everyone was attentive, knew the ins and outs of the office and participated in making the entire acupuncture treatment personalized and tailored for the patients. They treated each other like family and extended that same energy towards me.
I drive from Orlando to work there because there are very few acupuncture practices that conduct themselves with such professionalism & kindness.
Not only do I recommend Natural Approach Wellness Center to anyone seeking alternative care but also to any students and licensed professional looking to work in a calm and supportive environment. Laura is truly a gem in the community she serves.

Dr. Laura is absolutely amazing. She has helped me drastically since I became her acupuncture patient. She has gone above and beyond to finding a solution to my health issues.
She has surrounded herself with an incredible staff that's always professional, friendly and willing to help.
I have recommended Dr. Laura and her practice to my friends and will continue doing so.

I wasn't sure what to think about acupuncture, but after suffering headaches and anxiety for a year I gave it a try. I'm glad I found Dr Laura. She and her staff are great: Very personal, kind, and concerned. I've had some other health issues come up and am being treated for those now too. I'd highly recommend Natural Approach and Dr Laura for acupuncture.

reviewer_name: At Sunnyville Mobile Pet Grooming Laura Parker
review_text: This team is very committed to the well being and individualized care of their clients .Dr Catherine is extremely knowledgeable in Hashimoto's and the importance of a gluten free diet for relief of symptoms as well as hormone levels ,and np thyroid as a option if needed. A caring Doctor is hard to find .look no more!

I‚Äôve been going here on and off over the last couple of years. I find Dr. Catherine to be very thorough. I have seen many doctors concerning my health issues. Dr. Catherine is one of the few doctors that actually takes the time to listen and tries to run as many test as possible to get to the root cause. I haven‚Äôt found a root cause yet, but I feel seen and heard, and I feel like she is exhausting as many avenues as possible to identify the root issue.

I have been through the ringer medically and was looking for a place that would hear my concerns and work with me to create a treatment plan. ‚ÄúDoctor‚Äù Catherine looks great on paper and they assured me she was familiar with and even an expert on treating my condition. When i met with her however, she was extremely unprofessional and tried to force me into a cookie cutter treatment that i could not afford. What‚Äôs more is she got visibly angry with me when i asked if there was any research published on what she was telling me to do. This person is unqualified to treat patients and i hope this place gets shut down. My medical history was taken by a very nice man who was actually an MD but i could tell he was a contractor who was beholden to Catherine‚Äôs whims. He would try to interject on my behalf and get shut down immediately by her though she didn‚Äôt listen to my history at all nor seem to care, she just wanted my money. My blood for the labs ordered were taken by a nurse in a Solaris uniform leading me to believe any actual medical professional in this establishment is a 1099 contractor trying to make some extra money on the side. They also sell pyramid scheme products on the lobby and make unrealistic claims about everything they‚Äôre doing there. Overall a very poor and very expensive experience I‚Äôm not eager to repeat.

I had a health issue going on and other doctors were sure I needed an immediate surgery. I didn‚Äôt feel peace about the surgery, I just thought there‚Äôs no way this young and healthy I should go do such an invasive procedure that has a lot of dangerous side effects  (also scared of the what ifs, if I don‚Äôt do the procedure and I‚Äôm wrong). My mom heard of this doctor hopeful and doing anything to avoid this surgery, I called to see what they said. Dr Blount was only one available to get an appointment with which turned out to be a huge blessing. my issue was time sensitive so I saw him & he listened for an hour to me, everything I had to say. Assured me that I was not crazy, the research I had done that my other doctors had never heard of, was accurate. Patient, kind, wise, knowledgeable, gentle man. He heard me and did exactly what I wanted him to do, with his guidance and recommendations and a few months later I had tests ran with a primary care doctor (who was very skeptical of whoever I went to go see as she had never heard of this working) and I‚Äôm completely healed. Clear tests. When she called to give me results she told me she looked him up after I had left her office and in fact she very impressed by his resume. I believe anywhere Dr Blount goes, I‚Äôll follow for guidance for as long as he practices. Specifically, I would request to see him if you go here. Amazing doctor.

If I could give this a ZERO rating I would. Overall I had a shockingly awful experience! My first visit went ok. However, my second visit was scheduled to go over labs and a food allergy/sensitivity test performed by KBMO Diagnostics. Catherine greeted my husband and I with a steady cough wearing a mask under her chin, insisting that she was NOT contagious. She made no attempt to wear the mask on her face!  Sadly she got my husband very sick. On the way home, I called her office to verify why the KBMO test said I can eat gluten, amongst other things to which I have a strong allergic reaction. I could have ended up in the hospital! Several follow up calls and over a week later, Catherine called and left a muffled Voice message - incomprehensible. I immediately called her back, she did not answer and proceeded to text me while I was calling her, demanding that I never call her number or text her, and that if I needed my question answered I must be willing to make another appointment for another paid visit. Well don‚Äôt worry Catherine, you won‚Äôt be seeing my face again in your office, nor getting another phone call from me. I would never recommend anyone to your practice! These people are clearly incompetent at providing professional and safe patient care. I‚Äôm still waiting to have the $325.00 I paid for the KBMO test refunded. This request has been ignored. The conflicting test results could have landed me in the hospital! In summary, Catherine proved to be unprofessional, rude, uncaring, not practicing good hygiene protocol, extremely dismissive‚Ä¶more focused on getting more of my money, rather than providing the care I had already paid for!  Additionally she provided tests results that were inconclusive and contradictory with no clarifications which could have seriously damaged my health.

provider_name: Nature Coast Animal Wellness and Surgical Center
review_text: I am overwhelmed by the level of care by Dr. Marin.  I have owned Dogs and cats my entire life, mostly Dogs and I have never met such a conscientious and caring Vet as Dr. Marin.  We are new and my Bichon, Sebastien had some issues but Thank God those issues are treatable.   Dr.  Marin took blood work, gave us medicine and now with the blood results known we are additionally putting Sebastien on supplements that Dr. Marin suggested.  Dr. Marin spent a very long time on the phone explaining everything.  I have never ever spoken to such a caring, professional skilled Vet as Dr. Marin.  Frankly I cannot remember the last time a doctor who sees humans as patients had this level of care and conscientiousness and professionalism.  I wish I was Dog üòä

provider_name: Nature Coast Animal Wellness and Surgical Center
review_text: I'll give them 6out of 5 stars if I could, I had dogs all my life and vets good and bad , I would have to say , this place went well beyond that they didn't have to do, there service and the vets are all good , no great , keep up the great work and thanks a bunch .

provider_name: Nature Coast Animal Wellness and Surgical Center
review_text: We came from another vet we had for over 20 years. The amount of care, compassion, and help from the staff leaves us questioning why we didn't find them sooner. Rating them a 5 just doesn't give enough praise!!!

provider_name: Nature Coast Animal Wellness and Surgical Center
review_text:
Can't rate vet, didn't get a chance to work with them.
Very rude condescending wholly a than thou women who made no sense called me 4 days after I scheduled to tell me they would not do ultrasound and why didn't I go to the vet recommended by the vet who has been treating my pet the last 2 weeks for the ultrasound.
I had records forwarded and t2 the clinic twice to verify everything was a go for Mondays ultrasound.
I have 3 large dogs all show and trial dogs. This women should be fired.

provider_name: Nature Coast Animal Wellness and Surgical Center
review_text: The clinic is clean. The staff are so nice, welcoming and knowledgeable. My baby had surgery due to a CCL tear and everything went well.

Nature‚Äôs Pet Grooming did a fantastic job on our three dogs of very different sizes (from 10 lbs to 50 lbs). We booked baths with sanitary and paw shaving, and all three came out looking and feeling amazing. Their coats were so soft afterward, and they smelled wonderful too!

The staff was extremely accommodating and gentle with each dog, making the whole experience stress-free. I especially appreciated how patient they were with my Husky‚Äîshe‚Äôs very vocal, but they handled her with kindness and care, and she was still okay with the whole process.

It‚Äôs not easy to find a grooming place that can consistently do a great job across multiple breeds and temperaments, but Nature‚Äôs Pet Grooming really delivered. Highly recommend!

Amber has been grooming my 4 year old Bella and she does a fantastic job with her. I'm now bringing my 5 mth old for her spa day and Amber is amazing with her! Thank you Amber I'm very particular when it comes to my girls and you've always done a wonderful job!

Melissa is the doodle queen!! She is very experienced with poodle doodle hair! My girl is a mini sheepadoodle she does an amazing job shaping her face and styling my girl without butchering her. I greatly appreciate all you do!! Before and after üíñ

Highly recommend- Patient, soothing, at a great price. It was my pups first time getting her nails dremeled not by us. They had an ‚Äúemotional support‚Äù person comfort her while the other dremeled
And I bought her  a special cookie for the occasion. (1st time)
Just had second appointment- awesome once again

Amber did a beautiful job giving our little Suzy a summer style. So grateful for her kind and gentle patience with our 11 yr old Yorkie who had many matts in her coat from home baths. I could tell she felt better and the whole family thinks she looks adorable!
Nature‚Äôs Pet Day Spa staff is always so welcoming, kind and helpful. This is a wonderful and trusted pet grooming spa.
Amber is amazing! Thank you!

Sherese has been the most amazing, supportive, and knowledgeable physical therapist through my knee replacement recovery. I‚Äôve had the best experience with her care and support and have made impressive progress in our 3 weeks together. I was walking with a cane at 9 days and can bend my knee 120 degrees at 3 weeks with absolutely NO pain! I am scheduled to have my other knee replaced in 5 months and will 100% request her as my PT for that as well. I can not say enough about her thoroughness, professionalism, and care.

I had recent total knee replacement by Dr. Humbert and chose navigate home care due to my therapist , Sherese PT , she was also the therapist for my wife earlier this year and last year. It was a great experience. I have full range of motion at my knee. The doctor was very pleased with my outcome and now I‚Äôm off to outpatient therapy. I highly recommend this agency and this therapist. üòä I‚Äôm very pleased!

Sherese Mowry PT is my amazing therapist!
I had a hip replacement in 2020 and the other  in 2025, she was my PT in both cases. My recovery was extremely fast, her knowledge and guidance allowed me to get back to normal activities within a few weeks and tennis within 2 months. She goes to that extra level of care !!!!
The best!!!

I recently had a revision knee replacement and was fortunate enough to have Sherese come to my home for physical therapy rehab. I had her for my previous knee replacement as well and I can‚Äôt say enough about the care and compassion that she provided. Her well disciplined recovery program far exceeded any other that I have had in the past and I highly recommend her for your post surgical recovery!

Sherese Is a fantastic PT. She listens to what you‚Äôre saying about the surgery hip and carefully assesses how you move and then adjusts the stretching & exercises to minimize the pain and maximize your progress. She even adjusted the program to take into account another previous surgery to help both the current hip and the other surgery. I can‚Äôt thank her enough!!

I really recommend this place. Naye is amazing with the doggies. She cares a lot and makes sure they have a pleasant experience. She sent photos and videos every day. I would definitely continue letting my precious dog here.

Naye was amazing!! She took care of my 2 little Poms and I have never had such great service. I paid a little more for the separate VIP room for them and it was so worth it, they had so many toys, a video access camera where I spoke to my babies, and several beds! She also attentive to them all day and night which I really appreciated! I will 100% leave my babies here again any day!

My husband and I are very happy we found Naye‚Äôs Pet Hotel to take care of Rocky, our dog. We were going on a long trip, and the person we usually takes care of him cancelled on us the same day, just a few hours before we were leaving. We panicked and thought we had to cancel the trip, since we don‚Äôt feel comfortable leaving the dog anywhere where we don‚Äôt know, but decided to search online and that‚Äôs when we found Naye‚Äôs Pet Hotel, and I am glad we did.
I called and spoke to Nayelin explaining to her what happened and she was very understanding and asked me a few questions about the dog, she then checked for availability for those days and told to bring the dog.
We were received by her husband and we realized they love what they do; Rocky was very friendly with him and we knew he was going to be taken care of the way we wanted.
We could enjoy our vacation days knowing he would be treated like one of their own.
We loved seeing the photos and videos of our pet playing and enjoying throughout the day.
We couldn‚Äôt be happier and would definitely bring Rocky back in the future.

Have been using Nayes for almost 2 years.  Great with our 3 dogs, constant pictures and videos throughout the day.  Dogs are always happy when they are there playing with all the other dogs.  Would highly recommend.  You can tell the staff really loves all the dogs that stay there.

Naye has gone above and beyond for my baby boyüíôüê∂ I had to find a place to leave my dog throughout the day while at work and had to find one soon! She gives me such a peace of mind and constantly is sending us pictures and updates makes us feel like a family! I feel so happy that he loves it, she keeps everything so clean and the dogs all get along it‚Äôs unlike anything I‚Äôve ever seen. He goes 5 days a week and was used to being by my side 24/7 she made the transition so so smooth and my dog took it so easy. She is truly the best and besides family, the only person I would leave are big boy with. He loves hanging with his best fur friends. Gracias Naye eres la mejorrrüôèüèª‚ô•Ô∏èüëèüèªü©µüíô

Neubility was recommended by social worker from Encompass Acute rehab as a strong therapy option after a rehab stay. As a family member looking for the best options to get as much function back after a stroke I could not be happier with my choice . Han  coordinated our care in the home for a couple of weeks and then we started on site once we got our feet under us . Hope is powerful thing . I have watched other clients with severe deficits improve while on our own journey. My mother feels she is heard and her concerns incorporated in her treatments .. thank you :)

Earlier this year,  my husband participated in a two week intensive Parkinson‚Äôs program at Neubility Rehabilitation and Wellness. He admits that he was not too enthusiastic about making the commitment. However, he challenged himself to do so, and it‚Äôs made a positive difference in his wellbeing.
After the two week program, my husband continues therapy at Neubility. The individual attention provided by his Physical Therapist, Dr. Bridget, and his Occupational Therapist, Dr. Kara, is definitely beneficial to his everyday life.
My husband and I are grateful to be associated with Neubility and the wonderful people who make it all happen!

I did a clinical rotation as a student here and I loved my experience! The physical and occupational therapists at Neubility are exceptional at what they do & are great mentors/teachers. I appreciate how much they value education, learning, evidence-based practice, & building a community!

I am three years out from a stroke which affected the left side of my body.  After attending PT and OT I decided that there was more that I hoped to do. I contacted Encompass Rehab to explore my options. It was then when I was told about Neubility and decided to attend.
I could immediately tell that Neubility  was well equipped to deal with serious brain injuries and deficits from stroke to Parkinson's disease among 0thers.
I was assigned to Dr. Zak Kimmett & Kara Eldridge for an evaluation and treatment. They paid close attention to where I was with a professional eye assessing what is needed to be done to achieve my goals. They work together seamlessly.
As a stroke survivor I understand that I will never have my old life back, but I know that Neubility, their highly trained staff and appropriate equipment and safety approach will deliver me to a level of function I could only hope for previously.
I highly recommend Neubility to those who seek comfort and relief in doing and being all that one can do to make those life improvements.
Sincerely,
Cynthia Jaffe

My experience with Neubility  was initially very positive with Dr. Becca Canizares. Becca not only who knew how to provide physical therapy with ALS patients, but she did so with a great deal of understanding and compassion.

Unfortunately, Han Nguyen (the owner) fails to demonstrate the the same degree of compassion as Becca or the high degree that she falsely portrays to the public. For example, I missed my last appointment when I suddenly experienced an ALS related episode as I was preparing to leave my home. There was no way I could make it at the appointed time let alone do any of the physical therapy exercises. I immediately got to my bed and rested for several hours. Later that night when I woke up I found a message on my cell phone from Becca expressing concern over my well being.  Looking further down my message list, I also found a message from Han reminding me that I will now be charged an $80.00 fee for missing my appointment.There was no concern expressed about my welfare. There was, however, concern expressed about how my missed appointment affected her business, future bookings, financial impact on employees, etc.

I was more than accommodating when Becca asked me to rearrange my schedule to help her see other patients. But Han disregards this and other legitimate circumstances all in the name of business policy and an owner's financial well-being.

You may want to consider this experience before deciding on a provider.

Joe Kearney
Former Patient

CC: Claudia Guerra-Hernandez, PA
ALS Clinic, University of South Florida

NeuroFit360 is one of the most incredible neurological rehabilitation centers in Florida. Great environment and amazing energy. Guy and his staff are very friendly, caring, professional and make you feel welcomed. If you‚Äôre looking for the best, visit NeuroFit360. We highly recommend checking them out!

I had an incredible experience at NeuroFit 360! This physical therapist clinic goes above and beyond in providing exceptional care for brain injury patients, sci, and more. The staff's welcoming and great culture creates a positive environment where both patients and therapists work together tirelessly to ensure the best possible recovery outcomes. I highly recommend NeuroFit 360 to anyone seeking top-notch rehabilitation and support. They truly excel in their dedication to helping patients recover to the best of their abilities.

AMAZING!!!! NeuroFit360 physical therapists are all extremely caring, thoughtful, creative professionals who help you through rehabilitation and recovery. They think outside the box and aren‚Äôt afraid of pushing limits. They help me achieve my best potential and keep moving the goalpost forward, while encouraging me to find the strength within my self to meet and exceed those goals. They‚Äôve helped me become capable of helping myself. It‚Äôs not for the weak of heart and mind. Guy will make you question everything, and will guide you to find the answers within yourself. Like he says, he works with gladiators. If you‚Äôre willing to put in the WORK, this is the team that will guide you towards SUCCESS!!

I am only 5 weeks into my treatment here at Neurofit360 and 7 years out from surviving  emergency brain surgery. Since my recovery I‚Äôve  adopted some pretty bad walking patterns that must be undone. Basically I need to RELEARN how to walk. I was desperate to find a place to help get me walking independently once again. From my experience so far, I can confidently say that I am in the right place. The team here is top notch. This will not be a quick fix but if anyone can help me achieve my goals Dr.Guy Romain and his brilliant staff will. I am TRULY grateful that I have found this placeüôèüèª

These group of incredible human beings are a blessing, every single one of the members at Neurofit360.
They truly understand and they want to help! With their hard work and consistency, combined with my daughters willingness to get better, we see progress.
They make you feel like family.
we highly recommend Neurofit360.

Thank you üôèüèº

review_text: Robert Kevlin has been working with my son two times a week for the last year or so,  my son has come a very long way because of Robert his techniques have worked wonders with my son he is vocalizing more and having more conversations and he is much more confident in doing so because of Robert. I would highly recommend him he is wonderful. He has changed my and my son‚Äôs life for the better. üôèüëèüëçüòÄ

provider_name: Neurorehab & Speech Healers - Speech Therapy & Pathology, Pediatric & Adult Language Disorder Therapist
review_text:
Robert helped a few people I know, besides my own son.
My boy had articulation issues, and the rapport between them was amazing from day one. Robert helped my boy dramatically. And it took just a couple of months!

Also, I recommended this specialist to my father, who has been struggling with dementia. His cognition is becoming better week by week! Robert is super polite and patient with my father. He explains everything to him and our family, and guide us as the caregivers, too.

Robert has also healed my mother‚Äôs friend, who had a dysphonia. She said the treatment program was fun!

I‚Äôll keep recommending Robert Kevlin to everyone in need because he is amazing with both kids and adults!

provider_name: Neurorehab & Speech Healers - Speech Therapy & Pathology, Pediatric & Adult Language Disorder Therapist
review_text: Robert was very instrumental in helping me after my stroke. He was always encouraging and patient as I struggled through my recovery. I can say ( clearly now) without a doubt that his coaching compassion and expertise helped  me on my journey to becoming more confident in speech and cognitive recovery. Thank you for getting my back in front of an audience.

provider_name: Neurorehab & Speech Healers - Speech Therapy & Pathology, Pediatric & Adult Language Disorder Therapist
review_text: We have been working with a speech therapist named Robert Kevlin for four years now. Our son Daniel has a complex medical history that includes speech delay and intellectual disability, and he met Robert during the pandemic. We are so grateful for Robert's accommodations in evaluating Daniel on a Sunday when his office was closed so that he would be less exposed to COVID-19. When Daniel was 14 years old, he could not speak a complete sentence. However, since working with Robert, he has made great strides in his speech and has improved his social, problem-solving, and life skills. Robert has greatly supported Daniel in every session, making him feel comfortable and confident to overcome his obstacles. We highly recommend Robert for speech therapy.

provider_name: Neurorehab & Speech Healers - Speech Therapy & Pathology, Pediatric & Adult Language Disorder Therapist
review_text: Robert is a very professional, thoughtful, caring therapist. His attention to the patient‚Äôs  problems and needs, his approach in planning the course of treatment cannot be overestimated. He explained every step and made it very clear, which gained family‚Äôs confidence in Robert firm. Thank you, Robert!

I had an appointment set for the 23rd of September and Hilary never called to refill my meds. They took 200 out of the account for this meeting. Then after trying to resolve the issue over the last week and a half, I tried to call the number today and it is disconnected. So now, I am fully off my meds and out 200 dollars. I have been a loyal patient for over a year now and patience has run thin. Almost every month there is an issue getting my meds filled. Either they forget to send one in or they send it to the wrong pharmacy. EVERY MONTH THERE IS AN ISSUE. I'm over it. Do better, Hilary

Many moons ago I was introduced to this company by a friend. And all I can say is for the past few years even though i‚Äôve been inconsistent, this company has not. Every time I‚Äôve needed assistance getting back on track New Age has been right by my side. The customer service is unmatched and the selection of doctors just continues to get better. From digital appointments to in person visits, New Age has never let me down. Grateful to have such a supportive team throughout the years

This is the most poorly ran office I‚Äôve EVER encountered. They will take money from your account but not call in medications, they ignore calls, they ignore texts, and even ignore messages in the portal. I‚Äôve been trying to reach them for five days to refill my daughter meds but nope. They won‚Äôt return any correspondences, but sure take that money. She‚Äôs out of her medication and they could literally care less.  If it didn‚Äôt have private information I would upload an image showing the texts they‚Äôre ignored for five days when the are receiving the messages. Save your money, time, and frustration, go elsewhere where, we sure are.

Pay $99 each month just to get prescriptions refilled and often times they don‚Äôt even correctly send all your prescriptions to the pharmacy. You constantly have to be on them about it but half the time you message them and you don‚Äôt get a response. They also have an attitude for no reason the minute they pick up the phone. Right now it is 4/28/25 and I am still waiting for my prescriptions to be sent from an appointment I had in the middle of FEBRUARY 2025.

Found this office through Google a few years back and they have been the most consistent practice I‚Äôve dealt with. I wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect coming in, but over time, this place has made a difference. I won‚Äôt fluff up this review or practice as there has been a few hiccups but nothing that wasn‚Äôt resolved professionally and in a timely manner. They are thoughtful, a team that cares, from people who seem to actually give a damn. They make you feel heard and seen and with mental health, that‚Äôs what makes it or breaks it.

I went everywhere to try and fix my back pain. I did chiropractic, saw a spine surgeon, worked with personal trainers and physical therapists. Nothing helped. Once I got to ND Wellness there specialized approach and exercise techniques had me feeling better almost immediately. I would never go anywhere else! New Dimensions is hands down the best!

I love this place. I‚Äôve accomplished a lot in fitness and mental health. The benefits of one visit is the same as multiple visits mentally , emotionally and physically. During each visit I received one on one instruction training, communication of understanding and suggestions to assist with practicing from home. Thank you ND Wellness Club for being apart of my wellness to healing journey.
ND wellness changed my life. The best physical therapy and biomechanics training. My body is now pain free and functioning better than ever!

I have been to physical therapists, tried Pilates, yoga and body trainers for the past several years since developing neuropathy in my lower left. I have never experienced the level of skill that is possessed across the board by the entire team at ND. I have been coming for two months and am experiencing steady improvement. I don‚Äôt know who does the hiring and training but definitely always keep that person!

Keeping it simple, as I only just signed up a few hours ago, but I'll share brief first impressions after walking in:

I wasn't expecting what I got. Learning about body alignment, movement, tissues, etc

I had an amazing experience during my tour. When the tension on my body was relieved, shortly afterwards, I had a realization of who I did not want to be in the future. It was a rush of emotions and a flash memory of something bad in my past. This clarified to me who I wanted to be in the future and it brought me to tears. It was a feeling of empowerment more than anything!

So this is the caliber that you're dealing with when you come to this place.
An amazing caring group of people. Seeing the impact they have other people‚Äôs lives is a blessing. Other organizations should use you as a role model! Continue the great work!
Caring, loving people trying to help others.  New Heights could do. Much more if they had sufficient funding.i it is a shame that so little is given to those who need so much
My experience was very good they have nice staff and a lot of thing to learn from.
30 yrs +.
Great place

I recently had my first myofascial release appointment with Jen, and it was an exceptional experience. From the moment I walked in, Jen made me feel comfortable and at ease. Her extensive knowledge and background in occupational therapy truly shined through during our session. She has a natural talent for manipulating the body‚Äôs tissues, which helped release chronic tension that I had been dealing with for some time.

After just one hour with Jen, I felt noticeably lighter and more relaxed. I also want to mention the financial aspect; don‚Äôt let the price deter you! My insurance covered 90% of the session, thanks to Jen's willingness to help me submit the necessary form. I am incredibly grateful for this experience and can‚Äôt wait to return for more sessions. Highly recommend Jen for anyone seeking myofascial release!

Jennifer has done exceptional work on me post delivery of my first and second child. She‚Äôs very professional and informative. She also has been working with my infant during our sessions for tongue tie issues. Her business space provided a relaxing environment in addition to her exceptional work. I would highly recommend her to anyone especially pregnant and  postpartum mothers

I‚Äôve seen Jen throughout my entire pregnancy and I am so grateful to have experienced her care. Her clinical expertise and passion for her work is unmatched. I leave each session feeling calm and restored. Jen is a truly one-of-kind practitioner and we‚Äôre very lucky to have her in the Tampa Bay Area. I highly recommend New Life MFR!

New Life Myofascial Release has been instrumental in my healing journey post cervical disc replacement. Jen is very knowledgeable and treats the whole body, just an overall fantastic practitioner. I look forward to my treatments and seeing Jen and the progress we've made.

The myofascial therapy has been a physiological game change for me.  For over 10 years, I've had a hip pain that comes and goes with physical therapy and yin yoga.  The doctors have said it's arthritis and not much I can do.  Then, I came across MFR and figured I try it to see if new insights arise, and they did! Jen was able to diagnose my skeletal mis-alignment and posture and apply the correct fascial therapy to fix the ROOT CAUSE of the pain.  I follow with exercises to maintain the alignment.  MFR is truly revolutionary and Jen is incredibly good at it.  And she is a delightful person as well.

provider_name: Newberry Animal Holistic And Wellness Center
review_text:
I believe it was a year or so ago that I brought Zephyr to Dr. Spinosa for his first acupuncture treatment. Zephyr was struggling with issues related to a neurological condition he had since a kitten. With her care along with Dr. Morris's, Zephyr was more stable in his gait and use of the litter box. Between the drs and their wonderful caring staff - Heidi, Sabrina, and Danielle - Zephyr was at ease with his treatments and time at the center. A few months later, Zephyr was given a special nickname -- Spicy Boy - due to his big MEOW attitude. I never worried about Zephyr while he was at the holistic center as I knew those who cared for him, actually cared for him. Despite the care and affection Zephyr received from Drs. Spinosa and Morris as well as Sabrina, Danielle, and Heidi ... Zephyr passed away in early January 2022. Thank you so much for caring for and loving on my Zman. Your thoughtfulness and concern will not be forgotten. I apologize too for the delay in this review .... time has not made Zephyr's passing any easier for me perhaps with more time ..........

Always with affection and respect,

Cj Montgomery
Zephyr's aka Zman's aka Spicy Boy's aka Grandpa to HSNCF foster kittens mom

provider_name: Newberry Animal Holistic And Wellness Center
review_text: I‚Äôm very into the holistic and western medicine and I was having trouble finding a vet that would be open minded and knowledgeable about raw feeding and other diets. Thankfully I found Dr. Spinosa.   She is always updated on the latest studies about different foods and treatments. She always been so helpful with all the questions I have when bring in my boys. Dr. Spinosa and Heidi are an awesome team. My dogs love them so much. This is an awesome clinic to visit for a calm and understanding atmosphere.

provider_name: Newberry Animal Holistic And Wellness Center
review_text: I chose the holistic office as I was wanting a more natural approach for my dog. The vet and tech both were super friendly and knowledgeable. This was my first visit and was treated like I have been a client for a long time. I am looking forward to future visits knowing that my dog is important to them.

provider_name: Newberry Animal Holistic And Wellness Center
review_text: I was informed that there was a holistic approach to add to my senior mastiffs issue with his arthritic hips.  I met with one of the Vets and she was wonderful with my furr guy. He tolerated the acupuncture well.   I‚Äôm just trying any and everything to make his last lap comfortable

provider_name: Newberry Animal Holistic And Wellness Center
review_text: This was a great experience. I brought my dog in for some itching around her lips, but they were very thorough and identified and ear infection, potential allergies causing the itchiness, and noted some back sensitivity. I really appreciate that they went above and beyond in taking care of my dog and she‚Äôs doing so much better now. As a holistic clinic, I was offered a variety of treatment options and empowered to choose the one that I thought would be best for my dog. It was also very affordable, which is always nice. I would strongly recommend.
I‚Äôm very satisfied with the care and they go over your pet with fine tooth comb my daughter feels comfortable taking her cat and I‚Äôm happy she recommended them when I moved to Gainesville

Took my new kitten Naomi here and I would highly recommend taking your pet! I am new to cat ownership and wanted to make sure I was doing everything right. They have a package for puppies and kittens that are very reasonable in price, and it covers 4 visits and all of their vaccinations and care. I am happy to report I did not feel like I was being upsold or forced into any procedures or medications that were unnecessary. They take great care of their animals here and the wait times are very reasonable!

Everyone was absolutely wonderful. The staff was so warm, welcoming, and kind. The doctor made me feel valued. She listened and addressed all the concerns I had about my pets and was patient and kind. I never felt rushed at any point or made to feel like I was just another number. I also loved the transparency. The technician made sure to show me estimates and go over each item in the estimate and why it encouraged. I really enjoyed my experience and will be recommending to all my friends.

I took my cat here after adopting him for a wellness visit. Staff was extremely pleasant and helpful! There was very little wait time, and the doctor was thorough with her exam. She answered all my questions. My pet and I will definitely be coming back!

Went for our first visit for our kitten Marmie and was very impressed by all the team members. They were very friendly and helpful throughout the visit. The vet tech, vet student, and vet were all gentle and thorough during the visit.

Nexo ABA Therapy has been a transformative support for our family. The level of care and dedication they provide is outstanding, we feel truly understood, respected, and supported. The progress our son has made is a testament to their commitment to his development. They go beyond traditional ABA services, focusing on meaningful advancement with professionalism and genuine compassion. We were fortunate to connect with Sunny, whose warmth and attentiveness left a lasting impression. We are immensely grateful to Nexo ABA Therapy for their dedication to our son‚Äôs growth and our family‚Äôs well-being.

Nexo ABA Therapy is one of the leading behavior agencies in Miami, specializing in providing analysis and support for the development of social and emotional skills. With a dedicated team of professionals and a personalized approach, we are committed to helping our clients reach their full potential. Our expertise in the field ensures that we deliver effective strategies and positive outcomes for those we serve.

Let me know if you need any further adjustments!

Nexo Aba therapy has been a lifesaver, thank you‚Ä¶ The care and support they provide us is exceptional, they make the difference, we feel understood and valued.
Our son's progress has been truly remarkable. Nexo Aba therapy not only offers ABA services, they focus on advancement, they are highly professional, compassionate and concerne.

We can only say wonderful things about Nexo Aba Therapy,If you need a special person to work with autistic children,This team is dedicated and wonderful!!
Hands down the best Aba company in Florida ! I hold myself to the highest standards in counseling and professionalism!!

I recently had the pleasure of working with one of the top behavior agencies in Hollywood, and the experience was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment I reached out, the team was incredibly professional and attentive. They took the time to understand my specific needs and goals, crafting a tailored strategy that truly made a difference.

The expertise of the agents is unmatched. They provided invaluable insights and guidance, helping me navigate the complexities of the industry with confidence. Their connections and reputation opened doors I didn‚Äôt think were possible, and their support throughout the process was unwavering.

What impressed me most was their commitment to personal growth and development. They not only focused on immediate results but also on building long-term skills that would serve me well in my career.

If you're looking for a behavior agency that combines professionalism, expertise, and a genuine passion for helping clients succeed, look no further. I can't recommend them highly enough!

I recently had the pleasure of undergoing physical therapy at NextGen Physical Therapy after my ACL surgery, and I can‚Äôt recommend them highly enough! From the moment I walked in, I was greeted by a kind and professional staff who made me feel comfortable and supported throughout my recovery journey.

The therapists are incredibly knowledgeable and tailored my treatment plan to fit my specific needs. They truly go above and beyond to ensure that I was making progress, all while maintaining a positive and encouraging atmosphere. I‚Äôve been to a few places in Miami, and the level of care and attention I received here far surpasses any other facility. My progress was immediate and I am way ahead of the curve in terms of recovery.

If you need physical therapy, look no further than NextGen Physical Therapy. They are an exceptional team dedicated to helping you heal and regain your strength!!

I can‚Äôt say enough great things about NextGen Physical Therapy in Kendall. After a complete ACL tear and medial meniscus repair, I was worried about what recovery would look like‚Äîbut from day one, Dr. Ray has been an incredible guide and support throughout the entire rehabilitation process. His knowledge, patience, and genuine care made a huge difference in my recovery journey. I‚Äôm also extremely grateful to Dr. Javier for his continued support and attention to detail. Thanks to both of them, I‚Äôm stronger, more confident, and well on my way to full recovery. If you‚Äôre looking for a team that truly cares and knows what they‚Äôre doing, I highly recommend NextGen!

I highly recommend NextGen for any physical therapy needs!  I went through 11 months of physical therapy after my ACL / meniscus surgery with NextGen.  First impressions were great.  The staff was super welcoming and accommodating on my first visit and showed a great deal of care.  The facility is kept very clean and the layout is very open to where you can engage with other patients and staff.  Ray was my assigned therapist.  He is very professional, personable, and tailored a specific plan to maximize my recovery.  Most importantly, he‚Äôs a great person!  Each session with Ray was different.  Just when I thought I had the exercise program figured out he would innovate new exercises to challenge me and make sure I recovered optimally.  Over the months I got to engage with all the therapists, assistants, and interns‚ÄîJavi, Cristy, Lanie, Shannon, James, Mark, etc.  Each were great in their own right‚Äîit‚Äôs a very strong team.  Even if I wasn‚Äôt a given trainer or assistant‚Äôs assigned patient they would take note of my technique and help me if I was doing an exercise wrong.  There was never a clock timing my session‚ÄîI stayed as long as was needed to recover correctly and was never rushed.  Scheduling was very flexible.  Something that stood out right away was the youthful energy / chemistry of the team and the diversity of patients from young to old and from athletic to out of shape.  Over time I made friends with the staff and patients and it was very much a family atmosphere.  Multiple professional athletes trained there as well which was reassuring.  So whether you an everyday person or a professional athlete, I would highly recommend considering NextGen for your physical therapy needs!

I‚Äôve dealt with chronic hip pain and back issues for years and have been to many well-known physical therapy clinics, both for myself and for my daughter, (she is a dancer). I can honestly say I‚Äôve never experienced the level of attention and dedication that I‚Äôve found at NextGen Physical Therapy.
From day one, it felt like Javi (the owner) was genuinely invested in helping me recover, not just managing symptoms. When I first started, I could barely move, and now I‚Äôm back on my bike‚Äîthis place has made a huge difference in my life. I can see how caring Javier is with every patient. He goes above and beyond, not only with the therapy itself but by guiding you through the entire process.
All the therapists here are excellent, and so are the trainers‚Äîthey consistently check on you while you exercise and make sure you‚Äôre comfortable and supported. I used to be skeptical about physical therapy making a real impact, but I‚Äôm so glad I found this place. I truly recommend NextGen to anyone looking for real results and outstanding care.

This was my first visit, and I absolutely loved it. I truly felt heard, and the focus was right where it needed to be with my back. My therapist, Rich, was both professional and courteous throughout the session. I‚Äôve been to another location before, but the level of care and service just didn‚Äôt compare. I‚Äôm so grateful to have found this place.
Thank you!!

Next Step Orlando is my "gym away from home" when we winter in Florida and I'm so happy to have found it! The atmosphere is friendly and comfortable, allowing clients, family members and staff  to get to know and be comfortable with each other. The space is filled with equipment that the trainers utilize on specific objective areas agreed upon with each individual client. Usually an aide is available to help with lifts and setting up and can often advance to become a trainer. Much positive reinforcement is evident within a serious but fun atmosphere. I highly recommend Next Step Orlando!
NextStep has the best team and the best equipment for helping patients with a variety of strength, mobility and coordination challenges.

The entire staff at Next Step Orlando is phenomenal. They are very caring and take the time to make their clients feel comfortable. They all work very well together and are a fun group. They have several different types of exercise equipment tailored to rehabilitation of spinal cord injuries and neurological disorders. The trainers and therapists ensure that their clients are safe and are getting the exercise they need to recover.

NextStep Orlando has been an amazing blessing to our family. The staff has been so helpful with or visit from Atlanta. The energy and expertise at the facility made us really comfortable with the care provided for our 12 year old daughter. They have essential, quality equipment. I would recommend NextSteps to anyone in need of physical rehab due to Spinal cord and/or other traumatic injuries. I look forward to return.

We are from the UK and this is our 3rd annual visit to NextStep Orlando. It just keeps getting better and better. My daughter has a C5/6 incomplete SCI from a gymnastics accident 5 years ago. The trainers are passionate about what they do, engaging the clients with encouragement and humour to reach beyond what they thought they could do. There is a real sense of community with regular social get togethers with clients and staff making it a wholly holistic experience. We will be back üëçüèº

provider_name: Nicklaus Children's Dan Marino Outpatient Center
review_text: I cannot recommend this office enough. The staff is so kind and helpful. Specifically Leah and Ryan at the front desk. On two separate occasions Leah has gone out of her way to help obtain documents needed. Ryan was so kind to explain exactly what I needed to look for on these documents. We absolutely love and adore Opal Hamilton! We travel quite a distance because we love this office and the staff. Thank you for all you do!

provider_name: Nicklaus Children's Dan Marino Outpatient Center
review_text:
Absolutely unacceptable experience.
This has been the worst place I‚Äôve ever dealt with ‚Äî not just in terms of service, but in the complete lack of compassion and resources for our children. After waiting an entire year for an appointment, we were given only a 15-minute grace period, despite traveling a long distance from Homestead to Weston. We arrived just after that window and were refused service.

I tried to speak with multiple staff members and the office manager, asking for any flexibility ‚Äî even just to be added to a waitlist ‚Äî but was met with cold, robotic responses and no willingness to help. The only solution offered was to reschedule, with no regard for how long the next wait might be.

This place is beyond disappointing. The customer service is terrible, and I would never recommend this office to anyone, especially families who already face enough stress trying to get care for their kids

provider_name: Nicklaus Children's Dan Marino Outpatient Center
review_text: Unfortunately, I cannot say good things about this facility. The therapists have a measure of talent, and one of the physicians gave us important advise, but the facility and the administration are so defunct that they undermine the delivery of good care. The receptionists give false and incoherent information and their lazy ignorance coupled with incompetence demand immediate punitive action. I am going to have to report this facility to the state for mismanagement, because, in addition to wasting peoples' time, they are wasting healthcare resources and putting kids at risk--official letter forthcoming.

provider_name: Nicklaus Children's Dan Marino Outpatient Center
review_text: After seeing the reviews I got a little scared but thankfully the staff were nice . My son had a MRI and the staff from the front to the nurses in the back were all very nice. They explained the procedure process good .

provider_name: Nicklaus Children's Dan Marino Outpatient Center
review_text: My son was referred to this outpatient center by his orthopedic doctor for an MRI. We were able to secure the first available appointment without any wait, and the process was quick and efficient. The office was clean, and the registration went smoothly. The only drawback was the MRI technician, who was a bit loud and somewhat pushy. He seemed eager to complete the testing as quickly as possible; my son has a torn ligament, and the technician rushed him into the machine. Additionally, he made an inappropriate comment suggesting that my son should take care of himself because most athletes do not make a career in sports and should consider his future. I found that comment concerning, as he was unaware of my son‚Äôs competitive level. Other than that, the overall experience was positive.

I‚Äôll begin by stating that I brought my kid here for the urgent care due to something skin related, both the doctor and either medical assistant or nurse that tended to her are pleasant. The only issue I see here is the parking, think about that before you come here for urgent care purposes and especially if you‚Äôre coming for an appointment because you will be driving around only to locate a parking space. Nicklaus is such a prestigious organization therefore they should have way more available parking, thankfully they do have valet services. Regardless Nicklaus needs to do something about their parking situation.

My appoitment was at 3 but they call me at 3:45 and the funny thing they say please be on time for your appt ü§£. I got earlier what about your guys to be on time. And please in Amazing place like this why they don‚Äôt fixing the phone calls i have to wait so long for talk to someone

Denied service. Have a sign that reads ‚Äúonly one adult can accompany the patient into the center.‚Äù (Emphasis on the patient).

We arrived with two patients and two adults. Requested they separate us and treat us as separate patients with one adult per patient to comply with their one adult per patient rule. Initially denied us several times and insisted only one parent can enter with both patients (two very sick little children).

After waiting outside in the sun for 10 minutes we were told the rule is actually ‚Äúone adult per family‚Äù, despite this not existing anywhere in writing and contradicting the rule they had on their sign. We left to a different urgent center.

I love this dental office especially for children with special needs. They treat them very well and always accommodate. Although, since the pandemic I haven't been able to get a hold of anyone over the phone and its been 42 minutes... so far. I requested an appointment online and hopefully they will respond sooner that way. If not I would have to drive 35 minutes just to make an appointment,  and hope they have something available.

An update on this review: after just 43 minutes I got through with someone on the line. I was able to schedule the appointments that I needed. Thank you Nicklaus Children Doral dentistry it was worth the wait over the phone. These people are very professional and caring.

Avoid at all cost, I was charged $1500 for 10 minute visit to check my daughter was fine as she had high fever.

Let me be more specific based on the response. This charge was for doing the routine lab test for influenza, covid, and a simple check on pulse and oximetry. All that would could have been done at Walgreens for 10x less of the price I was charged.
If this center had any interest in customer service, they would tell the patient, an estimate of the charge, before providing, so they can make an informed decision. These are super standard checks.

Sorry but there is no other way around it, this center is terrible, and the doctors working here should be ashamed.

Their customer service was terrible. On the phone communication was a painful and dragged out affair with basic requests and explanations not being understood by the representative on the hospital end. The end of the call could not come soon enough.

The most amazing experience with the best of the best Dr. Utset-Ward literally God sent! All the nurses were really amazing, made our very scary hospital visit a breeze! I couldn‚Äôt thank them anymore for such an amazing service, surgery, and care! Amazing hospital!!!! God bless you all.

Look for a Dr. somewhere else. These office is horrible. 1st appointment waited an hour and after they called me to the front desk to tell me that my daughter needed an X ray before seen the doctor. They charged $430 por x ray. I was given the option to go somewhere else for the X-ray and come back. We did. Got the X-ray for $150 an came back. They told us it was the first appointment. When we arrived there were 4 people in front of us. Waited two hours to see the doctor. I complained to the front desk of the lack of respect for the long wait but they had an entire speech ready. At the end the Dr saw my daughter and spent 5 minutes with us. Very nice person but because of the way the office treated us we will never be coming back.

I'll be looking for a practice that doesn't chronically overbook, leaving patients waiting in a tiny closet-sized waiting room for hours.  Every time I take my daughter here, I'm hopeful that we'll be seen in a timely manner, but it's the same story over and over again.  I have no tolerance for offices that don't respect the time of their patients

They are excellent!!! My daughter has special needs and I‚Äôve been taking her there since she was an infant, she 22 now. Every time i go there the staff makes her feel welcome, the techs are patient with her, the Dr‚Äôs that see her explain everything in detail and they let me know what the next step is. I leave there knowing she could be in no better hands for her Orthopedic needs.  Absolutely love them

provider_name: Nicklaus Children's Miami Lakes Outpatient Center
review_text:
My experience at this Third World country Children‚Äôs Urgent Care in Miami Lakes was incredibly frustrating and disappointing. From the moment we walked in, the staff was disorganized, inattentive, and unprofessional. The wait times were outrageous despite the place not being full, and no one offered updates or showed any urgency‚Äîespecially considering this is supposed to be a children‚Äôs care center.

The front desk staff lacked basic courtesy, and the medical team seemed rushed and dismissive, not taking the time to properly explain anything or show genuine care for the patient. It felt like we were just a number to them.

If you‚Äôre looking for compassionate, professional, and efficient care for your child, I strongly recommend going elsewhere. This location needs serious improvement in both staff training and patient care.

provider_name: Nicklaus Children's Miami Lakes Outpatient Center
review_text:
I‚Äôm only putting 3 stars because of the nurses and staff were so sweet and patient but to the doctor that treated my son I would give NO stars. Dr. Alicia Serrano was rude, no bedside manner whatsoever ever, inconsiderate and quick to dismiss us. She came into the room sat down on the stretcher and when my son went to sit down next to her so she could use her stethoscope on him she told him no get down and stand still in front of her, my son is autistic & hes very jittery she told him ‚ÄúYou need to stop moving‚Äù in a rude tone while her still sitting on the bed trying to listen to his lungs. I told her he‚Äôs autistic for her to respond ‚Äúoh I didn‚Äôt know‚Äù. Autistic or not to work with kids I know it‚Äôs not easy but there‚Äôs no reason to talk to a kid with that tone and be so rude.

Ever since the comment she made it seem like I was being dramatic for even bringing him just because he didn‚Äôt have a fever, sent us home with eyedrops for his red eyes since flu & other results came back negative. Only that I had to come back the next day to the urgent care and request another doctor to see my son and this new doctor took the time to listen and order tests and X-rays on my son to come to find out he has bronchitis and did indeed need antibiotics & more medicines. Something that could‚Äôve been avoided if Dr. Serrano would‚Äôve done her job in the first place. I was even going to avoid going to this urgent care just because of my experience with her but I decided to give it another try & happy I did. I‚Äôm not one to leave reviews but it scares me to even think she treats her patients like this especially kids I hope no one else has to go through this.

provider_name: Nicklaus Children's Miami Lakes Outpatient Center
review_text: Awful service astronomically  long wait times, while the nurses station is filled with nurses socializing and cracking jokes. The professionalism of the health care professionals is below respectable and inconsiderate with sick children. I waited for four hours with a 7 year old with fever, no medication was available, no physicians were able to see her and the once they did come, the physician was  in there for less than 5 mins she  was inattentive to her patient.  Her swab for strep was negative results and waited another 45 mins for someone to come back into the room for a flu and covid swab, which is when I decided to leave. I received a call from the physician almost an hour after leaving asking where I had gone.The temperature in the room was unbearably cold. Too add, my  daughter had a lesion in her throat and the doctor said it was food. You can clearly see that it was not food but a lesion, the puss in her throat was underneath her veins. I am beyond myself how they can have physicians like this in a children‚Äôs hospital and care like the one provided. I came to another hospital and was in and out in less than 45 mins; and what do you know my child tested positive for strept. NEVER GOING TO THIS URGENT CARE AGAIN!!! I had also told them my other daughter was at home with strep. It‚Äôs incredible how upsetting the service that was provided; it seems Miami Children‚Äôs is notorious for their poor service. I can go on and on about this experience.

provider_name: Nicklaus Children's Miami Lakes Outpatient Center
review_text:
I have visited this institution about 3 times now. I have always been pleased with the attention we have received so far, until today. This review is solely based on the experience from today.
I visited the urgent care center last night due to my son's pediatrician being out of town for a convention for 1 week. The visit went perfect as usual. My son was prescribed antibiotics and ibuprofen for the fever. When I went to pick up the medicines at around midnight I found the prescription for ibuprofen was not sent electronically and I had to purchase it over the counter as my baby needed it. I called today to request that the prescription be sent to the pharmacy and spoke with 2 different nurses. The first just transferred to a second one who was like a robot repeating they do not prescribe it as it can be purchased over the counter. Why would I spend on a medicine that the insurance I pay for monthly would cover? She said I would need to request from the pediatrician. Even when I mentioned the pediatrician is out of town for a week she would not help, she repeated "over the counter", like a robot
I am very disappointed.

provider_name: Nicklaus Children's Miami Lakes Outpatient Center
review_text: Clean facility. Customer service is ok. Therapeutic service is excellent. We had a bad first impression with someone at the front desk when my child was supposed to begin therapy sessions. He actually ended up not seeing his therapist which made me not want to return. My child‚Äôs therapist called me a week later and the issue was resolved with lots of care. We love our child‚Äôs therapist and only reconsidered being serviced at this facility because of her reaching out. Since then customer service has improved and thankfully I haven‚Äôt had to interact with the person we dealt with the first time. That experience brought me to tears considering I had to wait 2-3 months before finally getting in touch with someone to schedule an appointment. I‚Äôd recommend ongoing patient/customer service training to prevent experiences like mine. Some people can be rude and nasty but that‚Äôs not me. Most parents want the best for their children and we expect healthcare workers to partner with us in that.

We had a great experience here with our 2-year old with a broken foot. Everyone from the security officer at the front door to the receptionist to all of the medical stuff we're extremely nice and professional, the treatment was of the highest quality, and waiting times were negligible. Never fun bringing your child to a hospital, especially when also having to navigate the byzantine structure of our Healthcare system, so this was genuinely a positive surprise that everything went so smoothly. Thank you!

The doctor who treated us on 5/16/2025 lacked empathy and compassion for people. She was cold and treated parents as if they were ignorant. She was also a complete liar about the procedures. I will never return to this place and I don't recommend it to anyone! And don't say you're sorry for my experience because it's not true!

It is a pleasant experience, they are professionals from the counter, the administration, the security, but above all Riana, Wendy, Zeena, Vanessa and Wilma are empathetic, kind and very excellent people.

I would like to express my heartfelt gratitude to our wonderful physical therapist, Thatiany Oliveira Salgado, at Nicklaus Children‚Äôs Miramar Outpatient Center, for her sensitivity, professionalism, and incredibly warm approach to working with our daughter, Amalia.

From the very first session, it was clear how naturally Thatiany connects with children‚ÄîAmalia immediately felt comfortable and eagerly engaged in the process. Each session is filled with care, support, and attention to detail.

Thanks to Thatiany‚Äôs work, we are already seeing noticeable improvements‚ÄîAmalia has become more confident in her movements, her coordination has improved, and she‚Äôs gaining more independence in her daily activities.

We are truly grateful for the professional care, patience, and genuine passion Thatiany brings to her work. We‚Äôre so happy to have found such a caring and dedicated specialist at Nicklaus Children‚Äôs Miramar Outpatient Center!

The worst experience in this hospital if you can go to another hospital I recommend it the care of this one is useless the nurses treat you as they want and are not friendly at all since they deal with children or babies they give you the discharge papers without explanation of medications you ask for something and they say they are not authorized that only a doctor can do it and they deny you to see the doctor directly it is very bad that this happens when you go with the concern of your children looking for help to heal them

provider_name: Nicklaus Children's Miramar Urgent Care Center
review_text: I been going to this place for about 5 years and they have always been very professional and helpful and their service is fast. But last week they went above and beyond for my 6 month baby, after being send home twice from a hospital ER I came here for a second opinion because she was very sick and the ER didn't seem like much help, as soon as got there they call an ambulance and acted very fast and even while waiting on the ambulance they put her on oxygen something the ER didn't even do. Thanks to them my daughter got send to a different hospital and she is safe.  Thank you for acting so fast and genuinely caring about your patients!

provider_name: Nicklaus Children's Miramar Urgent Care Center
review_text: Came to bring my daughter here for a swollen foot from falling....... after a while was told that the x-ray machine was down and needed to be unplugged and restarted.....30 minutes later nothing!!!  So I left..... when i walk out more than 12 staff members standing around.... will never go here again!! And they couldn't wait to get my deductible without knowing what the problem is!!! Rather take her somewhere that actually cares about the patient

provider_name: Nicklaus Children's Miramar Urgent Care Center
review_text:
Following up: I reached out to the email provided from the Urgent care and they have no responded in over a month. Sticking to the 1-star review.

This place is false advertising!!! They use a tax ID associated with their hospital not an urgent care and even though they say they are an urgent care, they are billing as a hospital visit.

Been feeling with this for months now and still haven‚Äôt had any help.

They need to take their sign down that says urgent care as that is not what they are!

They are greedy and only care about money, not your children.

Check your billing‚Ä¶ you will see.

Best just not to go.

provider_name: Nicklaus Children's Miramar Urgent Care Center
review_text: We had the absolute best experience at our last urgent care visit! The nurses and doctor were all so welcoming and made my little one feel so comfortable throughout the visit. The LOVE and PASSION for what they do truly stood out while caring for our little one and for that we couldn‚Äôt be more grateful!

provider_name: Nicklaus Children's Miramar Urgent Care Center
